verses.sanskrit: तवमग्ने दयुभिस्त्वमाशुशुक्षणिस्त्वमद्भ्यस्त्वमश्मनस परि तवं वनेभ्यस्त्वमोषधीभ्यस्त्वं नर्णां नर्पते जायसे शुचिः |||
verses.transliteration: tvamaghne dyubhistvamāśuśukṣaṇistvamadbhyastvamaśmanas pari tvaṃ vanebhyastvamoṣadhībhyastvaṃ nṛṇāṃ nṛpate jāyase śuciḥ

translations.griffith: THOU, Agni, shining in thy glory through the days, art brought to life from out the waters, from the stone:  From out the forest trees and herbs that grow on ground, thou, Sovran Lord of men art generated pure.

verses.sanskrit: तवाग्ने होत्रं तव पोत्रं रत्वियं तव नेष्ट्रं तवमग्निद रतायतः तव परशास्त्रं तवमध्वरीयसि बरह्मा चासि गर्हपतिश्च नो दमे |||
verses.transliteration: tavāghne hotraṃ tava potraṃ ṛtviyaṃ tava neṣṭraṃ tvamaghnid ṛtāyataḥ tava praśāstraṃ tvamadhvarīyasi brahmā cāsi ghṛhapatiśca no dame

translations.griffith: Thine is the Herald's task and Cleanser's duly timed; Leader art thou, and Kindler for the pious man.  Thou art Director, thou the ministering Priest: thou art the Brahman, Lord and Master in our home.

verses.sanskrit: तवमग्न इन्द्रो वर्षभः सतामसि तवं विष्णुरुरुगायो नमस्यः तवं बरह्मा रयिविद बरह्मणस पते तवं विधर्तःसचसे पुरन्ध्या |||
verses.transliteration: tvamaghna indro vṛṣabhaḥ satāmasi tvaṃ viṣṇururughāyo namasyaḥ tvaṃ brahmā rayivid brahmaṇas pate tvaṃ vidhartaḥsacase purandhyā

translations.griffith: Hero of Heroes, Agni! Thou art Indra, thou art Viṣṇu of the Mighty Stride, adorable:  Thou, Brahmaṇaspati, the Brahman finding wealth: thou, O Sustainer, with thy wisdom tendest us.

verses.sanskrit: तवमग्ने राजा वरुणो धर्तव्रतस्त्वं मित्रो भवसि दस्म ईड्यः तवमर्यमा सत्पतिर्यस्य सम्भुजं तवमंशो विदथे देव भाजयुः |||
verses.transliteration: tvamaghne rājā varuṇo dhṛtavratastvaṃ mitro bhavasi dasma īḍyaḥ tvamaryamā satpatiryasya sambhujaṃ tvamaṃśo vidathe deva bhājayuḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, thou art King Varuṇa whose laws stand fast; as Mitra, Wonder-Worker, thou must be implored.  Aryaman, heroes' Lord, art thou, enriching all, and liberal Aṁśa in the synod, O thou God.

verses.sanskrit: तवमग्ने तवष्टा विधते सुवीर्यं तव गनावो मित्रमहः सजात्यम तवमाशुहेमा ररिषे सवश्व्यं तवं नरां शर्धो असि पुरूवसुः |||
verses.transliteration: tvamaghne tvaṣṭā vidhate suvīryaṃ tava ghnāvo mitramahaḥ sajātyam tvamāśuhemā rariṣe svaśvyaṃ tvaṃ narāṃ śardho asi purūvasuḥ

translations.griffith: Thou givest strength, as Tvaṣṭar, to the worshipper: thou wielding Mitra's power hast kinship with the Dames.  Thou, urging thy fleet coursers, givest noble steeds: a host of heroes art thou with great store of wealth.

verses.sanskrit: तवमग्ने रुद्रो असुरो महो दिवस्त्वं शर्धो मारुतं पर्क्ष ईशिषे तवं वातैररुणैर्यासि शंगयस्त्वं पूषा विधतः पासि नु तमना |||
verses.transliteration: tvamaghne rudro asuro maho divastvaṃ śardho mārutaṃ pṛkṣa īśiṣe tvaṃ vātairaruṇairyāsi śaṃghayastvaṃ pūṣā vidhataḥ pāsi nu tmanā

translations.griffith: Rudra art thou, the Asura of mighty heaven: thou art the Maruts’ host, thou art the Lord of food,  Thou goest with red winds: bliss hast thou in thine home. As Pūṣan thou thyself protectest worshippers.

verses.sanskrit: तवमग्ने दरविणोदा अरंक्र्ते तवं देवः सविता रत्नधासि तवं भगो नर्पते वस्व ईशिषे तवं पायुर्दमे यस्तेऽविधत |||
verses.transliteration: tvamaghne draviṇodā araṃkṛte tvaṃ devaḥ savitā ratnadhāasi tvaṃ bhagho nṛpate vasva īśiṣe tvaṃ pāyurdame yaste'vidhat

translations.griffith: Giver of wealth art thou to him who honours thee; thou art God Savitar, granter of precious things.  As Bhaga, Lord of men! thou rulest over wealth, and guardest in his house him who hath served thee well.

verses.sanskrit: तवमग्ने दम आ विश्पतिं विशस्त्वां राजानं सुविदत्रं रञ्जते तवं विश्वानि सवनीक पत्यसे तवं सहस्राणि शता दश परति |||
verses.transliteration: tvamaghne dama ā viśpatiṃ viśastvāṃ rājānaṃ suvidatraṃ ṛñjate tvaṃ viśvāni svanīka patyase tvaṃ sahasrāṇi śatā daśa prati

translations.griffith: To thee, the people's Lord within the house, the folk press forward to their King most graciously inclined.  Lord of the lovely look, all things belong to thee: ten, hundred, yea, a thousand are outweighed by thee.

verses.sanskrit: तवामग्ने पितरमिष्टिभिर्नरस्त्वां भरात्राय शम्या तनूरुचम तवं पुत्रो भवसि यस्ते.अविधत तवं सखा सुशेवः पास्याध्र्षः |||
verses.transliteration: tvāmaghne pitaramiṣṭibhirnarastvāṃ bhrātrāya śamyā tanūrucam tvaṃ putro bhavasi yaste.avidhat tvaṃ sakhā suśevaḥ pāsyādhṛṣaḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, men seek thee as a Father with their prayers, win thee, bright-formed, to brotherhood with holy act.  Thou art a Son to him who duly worships thee, and as a trusty Friend thou guardest from attack.

verses.sanskrit: तवमग्न रभुराके नमस्यस्त्वं वाजस्य कषुमतो राय ईशिषे तवं वि भास्यनु दक्षि दावने तवं विशिक्षुरसियज्ञमातनिः |||
verses.transliteration: tvamaghna ṛbhurāke namasyastvaṃ vājasya kṣumato rāya īśiṣe tvaṃ vi bhāsyanu dakṣi dāvane tvaṃ viśikṣurasiyajñamātaniḥ

translations.griffith: A Ṛbhu art thou, Agni, near to be adored thou art the Sovran Lord of foodful spoil and wealth.  Thou shinest brightly forth, thou burnest to bestow: pervading sacrifice, thou lendest us thine help.

verses.sanskrit: तवमग्ने अदितिर्देव दाशुषे तवं होत्रा भारती वर्धसेगिरा तवमिळा षतहिमासि दक्षसे तवं वर्त्रहा वसुपते सरस्वती |||
verses.transliteration: tvamaghne aditirdeva dāśuṣe tvaṃ hotrā bhāratī vardhaseghirā tvamiḷā ṣatahimāsi dakṣase tvaṃ vṛtrahā vasupate sarasvatī

translations.griffith: Thou, God, art Aditi to him who offers gifts: thou, Hotrā, Bhāratī, art strengthened by the song.  Thou art the hundred-wintered Iḷā to give strength, Lord of Wealth! Vṛtra-slayer and Sarasvatī.

verses.sanskrit: तवमग्ने सुभ्र्त उत्तमं वयस्तव सपार्हे वर्ण आ सन्द्र्शि शरियः तवं वाजः परतरणो बर्हन्नसि तवं रयिर्बहुलो विश्वतस पर्थुः |||
verses.transliteration: tvamaghne subhṛta uttamaṃ vayastava spārhe varṇa ā sandṛśi śriyaḥ tvaṃ vājaḥ prataraṇo bṛhannasi tvaṃ rayirbahulo viśvatas pṛthuḥ

translations.griffith: Thou, Agni, cherished well, art highest vital power; in thy delightful hue are glories visible.  Thou art the lofty might that furthers each design: thou art wealth manifold, diffused on every side.

verses.sanskrit: तवामग्न आदित्यास आस्यं तवां जिह्वां शुचयश्चक्रिरेकवे तवां रातिषाचो अध्वरेषु सश्चिरे तवे देवा हविरदन्त्याहुतम |||
verses.transliteration: tvāmaghna ādityāsa āsyaṃ tvāṃ jihvāṃ śucayaścakrirekave tvāṃ rātiṣāco adhvareṣu saścire tve devā haviradantyāhutam

translations.griffith: Thee, Agni, have the Ādityas taken as their mouth; the Bright Ones have made thee, O Sage, to be their tongue.  They who love offerings cling to thee at solemn rites: by thee the Gods devour the duly offered food.

verses.sanskrit: तवे अग्ने विश्वे अन्र्तासो अद्रुह आसा देवा हविरदन्त्याहुतम तवया मर्तासः सवदन्त आसुतिं तवं गर्भो वीरुधां जज्ञिषे शुचिः |||
verses.transliteration: tve aghne viśve anṛtāso adruha āsā devā haviradantyāhutam tvayā martāsaḥ svadanta āsutiṃ tvaṃ gharbho vīrudhāṃ jajñiṣe śuciḥ

translations.griffith: By thee, O Agni, all the Immortal guileless Gods cat with thy mouth the oblation that is offered them.  By thee do mortal men give sweetness to their drink. Bright art thou born, the embryo of the plants of earth.

verses.sanskrit: तवं तान सं च परति चासि मज्मनाग्ने सुजात पर च देवरिच्यसे पर्क्षो यदत्र महिना वि ते भुवदनु दयावाप्र्थिवी रोदसी उभे |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ tān saṃ ca prati cāsi majmanāghne sujāta pra ca devaricyase pṛkṣo yadatra mahinā vi te bhuvadanu dyāvāpṛthivī rodasī ubhe

translations.griffith: With these thou art united, Agni; yea thou, God of noble birth, surpassest them in majesty,  Which, through the power of good, here spreads abroad from thee, diffused through both the worlds, throughout the earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit: ये सतोत्र्भ्यो गोग्रामश्वपेशसमग्ने रातिमुपस्र्जन्ति सूरयः अस्माञ्च तांश्च पर हि नेषि वस्य आ बर्हद वदेम विदथे सुवीराः |||
verses.transliteration: ye stotṛbhyo ghoaghrāmaśvapeśasamaghne rātimupasṛjanti sūrayaḥ asmāñca tāṃśca pra hi neṣi vasya ā bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ

translations.griffith: The princely worshippers who send to those who sing thy praise, O Agni, guerdon graced with kine and steeds,—  Lead thou both these and us forward to higher bliss. With brave men in the assembly may we speak aloud.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञेन वर्धत जातवेदसमग्निं यजध्वं हविषा तना गिरा समिधानं सुप्रयसं सवर्णरं दयुक्षं होतारंव्र्जनेषु धूर्षदम |||
verses.transliteration: yajñena vardhata jātavedasamaghniṃ yajadhvaṃ haviṣā tanā ghirā samidhānaṃ suprayasaṃ svarṇaraṃ dyukṣaṃ hotāraṃvṛjaneṣu dhūrṣadam

translations.griffith: WITH sacrifice exalt Agni who knows all life; worship him with oblation and the song of praise,  Well kindled, nobly fed; heaven's Lord, Celestial Priest, who labours at the pole where deeds of might are done.

verses.sanskrit: अभि तवा नक्तीरुषसो ववाशिरे.अग्ने वत्सं न सवसरेषुधेनवः दिव इवेदरतिर्मानुषा युगा कषपो भासि पुरुवार संयतः |||
verses.transliteration: abhi tvā naktīruṣaso vavāśire.aghne vatsaṃ na svasareṣudhenavaḥ diva ivedaratirmānuṣā yughā kṣapo bhāsi puruvāra saṃyataḥ

translations.griffith: At night and morning, Agni, have they called to thee, like milch-kine in their stalls lowing to meet their young.  As messenger of heaven thou lightest all night long the families of men. Thou Lord of precious boons.

verses.sanskrit: तं देवा बुध्ने रजसः सुदंससं दिवस्प्र्थिव्योररतिंन्येरिरे रथमिव वेद्यं शुक्रशोचिषमग्निं मित्रं नक्षितिषु परशंस्यम |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ devā budhne rajasaḥ sudaṃsasaṃ divaspṛthivyoraratiṃnyerire rathamiva vedyaṃ śukraśociṣamaghniṃ mitraṃ nakṣitiṣu praśaṃsyam

translations.griffith: Him have the Gods established at the region's base, doer of wondrous deeds, Herald of heaven and earth;  Like a most famous car, Agni the purely bright, like Mitra to be glorified among the folk.

verses.sanskrit: तमुक्षमाणं रजसि सव आ दमे चन्द्रमिव सुरुचं हवार आ दधुः पर्श्न्याः पतरं चितयन्तमक्षभिः पाथो न पायुं जनसी उभे अनु |||
verses.transliteration: tamukṣamāṇaṃ rajasi sva ā dame candramiva surucaṃ hvāra ā dadhuḥ pṛśnyāḥ pataraṃ citayantamakṣabhiḥ pātho na pāyuṃ janasī ubhe anu

translations.griffith: Him have they set in his own dwelling, in the vault, like the Moon waxing, fulgent, in the realm of air.  Bird of the firmament, observant with his eyes, guard of the place as ’twere, looking to Gods and men.

verses.sanskrit: स होता विश्वं परि भूत्वध्वरं तमु हव्यैर्मनुष रञ्जते गिरा हिरिशिप्रो वर्धसानासु जर्भुरद दयौर्न सत्र्भिश्चितयद रोदसी अनु |||
verses.transliteration: sa hotā viśvaṃ pari bhūtvadhvaraṃ tamu havyairmanuṣa ṛñjate ghirā hiriśipro vṛdhasānāsu jarbhurad dyaurna stṛbhiścitayad rodasī anu

translations.griffith: May he as Priest encompass all the sacrifice. men throng to him with offerings and with hymns of praise.  Raging with jaws of gold among the growing plants, like heaven with all the stars, he quickens earth and sky.

verses.sanskrit: स नो रेवत समिधानः सवस्तये सन्ददस्वान रयिमस्मासु दीदिहि आ नः कर्णुष्व सुविताय रोदसी अग्ने हव्या मनुषोदेव वीतये |||
verses.transliteration: sa no revat samidhānaḥ svastaye sandadasvān rayimasmāsu dīdihi ā naḥ kṛṇuṣva suvitāya rodasī aghne havyā manuṣodeva vītaye

translations.griffith: Such as thou art, brilliantly kindled for our weal, a liberal giver, send us riches in thy shine,  For our advantage, Agni, God, bring Heaven and Earth hither that they may taste oblation brought by man.

verses.sanskrit: दा नो अग्ने बर्हतो दाः सहस्रिणो दुरो न वाजं शरुत्या अपा वर्धि पराची दयावाप्र्थिवी बरह्मणा कर्धि सवर्ण शुक्रमुषसो वि दिद्युतः |||
verses.transliteration: dā no aghne bṛhato dāḥ sahasriṇo duro na vājaṃ śrutyā apā vṛdhi prācī dyāvāpṛthivī brahmaṇā kṛdhi svarṇa śukramuṣaso vi didyutaḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, give us great wealth, give riches thousandfold. unclose to us, like doors, strength that shall bring renown.  Make Heaven and Earth propitious through the power of prayer, and like the sky's bright sheen let mornings beam on us.

verses.sanskrit: स इधान उषसो राम्या अनु सवर्ण दीदेदरुषेण भानुना होत्राभिरग्निर्मनुषः सवध्वरो राजा विशामतिथिश्चारुरायवे |||
verses.transliteration: sa idhāna uṣaso rāmyā anu svarṇa dīdedaruṣeṇa bhānunā hotrābhiraghnirmanuṣaḥ svadhvaro rājā viśāmatithiścārurāyave

translations.griffith: Enkindled night by night at every morning's dawn, may he shine forth with red flame like the realm of light,—  Agni adored in beauteous rites with lauds of men, fair guest of living man and King of all our folk.

verses.sanskrit: एवा नो अग्ने अम्र्तेषु पूर्व्य धीष पीपाय बर्हद्दिवेषु मानुषा दुहाना धेनुर्व्र्जनेषु कारवे तमना शतिनं पुरुरूपमिषणि |||
verses.transliteration: evā no aghne amṛteṣu pūrvya dhīṣ pīpāya bṛhaddiveṣu mānuṣā duhānā dhenurvṛjaneṣu kārave tmanā śatinaṃ pururūpamiṣaṇi

translations.griffith: Song chanted by us men, O Agni, Ancient One, has swelled unto the deathless Gods in lofty heaven—  A milch-cow yielding to the singer in the rites wealth manifold, in hundreds, even as he wills.

verses.sanskrit: वयमग्ने अर्वता वा सुवीर्यं बरह्मणा वा चितयेमा जनानति अस्माकं दयुम्नमधि पञ्च कर्ष्टिषूच्चा सवर्णशुशुचीत दुष्टरम |||
verses.transliteration: vayamaghne arvatā vā suvīryaṃ brahmaṇā vā citayemā janānati asmākaṃ dyumnamadhi pañca kṛṣṭiṣūccā svarṇaśuśucīta duṣṭaram

translations.griffith: Agni, may we show forth our valour with the steed or with the power of prayer beyond all other men;  And over the Five Races let our glory shine high like the realm of light and unsurpassable.

verses.sanskrit: स नो बोधि सहस्य परशंस्यो यस्मिन सुजाता इषयन्त सूरयः यमग्ने यज्ञमुपयन्ति वाजिनो नित्ये तोके दीदिवांसं सवे दमे |||
verses.transliteration: sa no bodhi sahasya praśaṃsyo yasmin sujātā iṣayanta sūrayaḥ yamaghne yajñamupayanti vājino nitye toke dīdivāṃsaṃ sve dame

translations.griffith: Such, Conqueror! be to us, be worthy of our praise, thou for whom princes nobly born exert themselves;  Whose sacrifice the strong seek, Agni, when it shines for never-failing offspring in thine own abode.

verses.sanskrit: उभयासो जातवेदः सयाम ते सतोतारो अग्ने सूरयश्च शर्मणि वस्वो रायः पुरुश्चन्द्रस्य भूयसः परजावतः सवपत्यस्य शग्धि नः |||
verses.transliteration: ubhayāso jātavedaḥ syāma te stotāro aghne sūrayaśca śarmaṇi vasvo rāyaḥ puruścandrasya bhūyasaḥ prajāvataḥ svapatyasya śaghdhi naḥ

translations.griffith: Knower of all that lives, O Agni may we both, singers of praise and chiefs, be in thy keeping still.  Help us to wealth exceeding good and glorious, abundant, rich in children and their progeny.

verses.transliteration: ye stotṛbhyo ...

translations.griffith: The princely worshippers who send to those who sing thy praise, O Agni, guerdon, graced with kine and steeds,—  Lead thou both these and us forward to higher bliss. With brave men in the assembly may we speak aloud.

verses.sanskrit: समिद्धो अग्निर्निहितः पर्थिव्यां परत्यं विश्वानि भुवनान्यस्थात होता पावकः परदिवः सुमेधा देवो देवान यजत्वग्निरर्हन |||
verses.transliteration: samiddho aghnirnihitaḥ pṛthivyāṃ pratyaṃ viśvāni bhuvanānyasthāt hotā pāvakaḥ pradivaḥ sumedhā devo devān yajatvaghnirarhan

translations.griffith: AGNI is set upon the earth well kindled; he standeth in the presence of all beings.  Wise, ancient, God, the Priest and Purifier, let Agni serve the Gods for he is worthy.

verses.sanskrit: नराशंसः परति धामान्यञ्जन तिस्रो दिवः परति मह्ना सवर्चिः घर्तप्रुषा मनसा हव्यमुन्दन मूर्धन यज्ञस्य समनक्तु देवान |||
verses.transliteration: narāśaṃsaḥ prati dhāmānyañjan tisro divaḥ prati mahnā svarciḥ ghṛtapruṣā manasā havyamundan mūrdhan yajñasya samanaktu devān

translations.griffith: May Narāśaṁsa lighting up the chambers, bright in his majesty through threefold heaven,  Steeping the gift with oil diffusing purpose, bedew the Gods at chiefest time of worship.

verses.sanskrit: ईळितो अग्ने मनसा नो अर्हन देवान यक्षि मानुषात पूर्वो अद्य स आ वह मरुतां शर्धो अच्युतमिन्द्रं नरो बर्हिषदं यजध्वम |||
verses.transliteration: īḷito aghne manasā no arhan devān yakṣi mānuṣāt pūrvo adya sa ā vaha marutāṃ śardho acyutamindraṃ naro barhiṣadaṃ yajadhvam

translations.griffith: Adored in heart, as is thy right, O Agni, serve the Gods first to-day before the mortal.  Bring thou the Marut host. Ye men do worship to Indra seated on the grass, eternal.

verses.sanskrit: देव बर्हिर्वर्धमानं सुवीरं सतीर्णं राये सुभरं वेद्यस्याम घर्तेनाक्तं वसवः सीदतेदं विश्वे देवा आदित्या यज्ञियासः |||
verses.transliteration: deva barhirvardhamānaṃ suvīraṃ stīrṇaṃ rāye subharaṃ vedyasyām ghṛtenāktaṃ vasavaḥ sīdatedaṃ viśve devā ādityā yajñiyāsaḥ

translations.griffith: O Grass divine, increasing, rich in heroes, strewn for wealth's sake, well laid upon this altar,—  On this bedewed with oil sit ye, O Vasus, sit all ye Gods, ye Holy, ye Ādityas.

verses.sanskrit: वि शरयन्तामुर्विया हूयमाना दवारो देवीः सुप्रायणा नमोभिः वयचस्वतीर्वि परथन्तामजुर्या वर्णं पुनानायशसं सुवीरम |||
verses.transliteration: vi śrayantāmurviyā hūyamānā dvāro devīḥ suprāyaṇā namobhiḥ vyacasvatīrvi prathantāmajuryā varṇaṃ punānāyaśasaṃ suvīram

translations.griffith: Wide be the Doors, the Goddesses, thrown open, easy to pass, invoked, through adorations,  Let them unfold, expansive, everlasting, that sanctify the class famed, rich in heroes.

verses.sanskrit: साध्वपांसि सनता न उक्षिते उषासानक्ता वय्येव रण्विते तन्तुं ततं संवयन्ती समीची यज्ञस्य पेशः सुदुघे पयस्वती |||
verses.transliteration: sādhvapāṃsi sanatā na ukṣite uṣāsānaktā vayyeva raṇvite tantuṃ tataṃ saṃvayantī samīcī yajñasya peśaḥ sudughe payasvatī

translations.griffith: Good work for us, the glorious Night and Morning, like female weavers, waxen from aforetime,  Yielders of rich milk, interweave in concert the long-extended thread, the web of worship.

verses.sanskrit: दैव्या होतारा परथमा विदुष्टर रजु यक्षतः सं रचावपुष्टरा देवान यजन्ताव रतुथा समञ्जतो नाभा पर्थिव्या अधि सानुषु तरिषु |||
verses.transliteration: daivyā hotārā prathamā viduṣṭara ṛju yakṣataḥ saṃ ṛcāvapuṣṭarā devān yajantāv ṛtuthā samañjato nābhā pṛthivyā adhi sānuṣu triṣu

translations.griffith: Let the two heavenly Heralds, first, most wise, most fair, present oblation duly with the sacred verse,  Worshipping God at ordered seasons decking them at three high places at the centre of the earth.

verses.sanskrit: सरस्वती साधयन्ती धियं न इळा देवी भारती विश्वतूर्तिः तिस्रो देवीः सवधया बर्हिरेदमछिद्रं पान्तुशरणं निषद्य |||
verses.transliteration: sarasvatī sādhayantī dhiyaṃ na iḷā devī bhāratī viśvatūrtiḥ tisro devīḥ svadhayā barhiredamachidraṃ pāntuśaraṇaṃ niṣadya

translations.griffith: Sarasvatī who perfects our devotion, Iḷā divine, Bhāratī all surpassing,—  Three Goddesses, with power inherent, seated, protect this holy Grass, our flawless refuge!

verses.sanskrit: पिशङगरूपः सुभरो वयोधाः शरुष्टी वीरो जायते देवकामः परजां तवष्टा वि षयतु नाभिमस्मे अथा देवानामप्येतु पाथः |||
verses.transliteration: piśaṅgharūpaḥ subharo vayodhāḥ śruṣṭī vīro jāyate devakāmaḥ prajāṃ tvaṣṭā vi ṣyatu nābhimasme athā devānāmapyetu pāthaḥ

translations.griffith: Born is the pious hero swift of hearing, like gold in hue, well formed, and full of vigour.  May Tvaṣṭar lengthen our line and kindred, and may they reach the place which Gods inhabit.

verses.sanskrit: वनस्पतिरवस्र्जन्नुप सथादग्निर्हविः सूदयाति पर धीभिः तरिधा समक्तं नयतु परजानन देवेभ्यो दैव्यः शमितोप हव्यम |||
verses.transliteration: vanaspatiravasṛjannupa sthādaghnirhaviḥ sūdayāti pra dhībhiḥ tridhā samaktaṃ nayatu prajānan devebhyo daivyaḥ śamitopa havyam

translations.griffith: Vanaspati shall stand anear and start us, and Agni with his arts prepare oblation.  Let the skilled heavenly Immolator forward unto the Gods the offering thrice anointed.

verses.sanskrit: घर्तं मिमिक्षे घर्तमस्य योनिर्घ्र्ते शरितो घर्तं वस्य धाम अनुष्वधमा वह मादयस्व सवाहाक्र्तं वर्षभ वक्षि हव्यम |||
verses.transliteration: ghṛtaṃ mimikṣe ghṛtamasya yonirghṛte śrito ghṛtaṃ vasya dhāma anuṣvadhamā vaha mādayasva svāhākṛtaṃ vṛṣabha vakṣi havyam

translations.griffith: Oil has been mixt: oil is his habitation. In oil he rests: oil is his proper province.  Come as thy wont is: O thou Steer, rejoice thee; bear off the oblation duly consecrated.

verses.sanskrit: हुवे वः सुद्योत्मानं सुव्र्क्तिं विशामग्निमतिथिं सुप्रयसम मित्र इव यो दिधिषाय्यो भूद देव आदेवे जने जातवेदाः |||
verses.transliteration: huve vaḥ sudyotmānaṃ suvṛktiṃ viśāmaghnimatithiṃ suprayasam mitra iva yo didhiṣāyyo bhūd deva ādeve jane jātavedāḥ

translations.griffith: FOR you I call the glorious refulgent Agni, the guest of men, rich in oblations  Whom all must strive to win even as a lover, God among godly people, Jātavedas.

verses.sanskrit: इमं विधन्तो अपां सधस्थे दवितादधुर्भ्र्गवो विक्ष्वायोः एष विश्वान्यभ्यस्तु भूमा देवानामग्निररतिर्जीराश्वः |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ vidhanto apāṃ sadhasthe dvitādadhurbhṛghavo vikṣvāyoḥ eṣa viśvānyabhyastu bhūmā devānāmaghniraratirjīrāśvaḥ

translations.griffith: Bhṛgus who served him in the home of waters set him of old in houses of the living.  Over all worlds let Agni be the Sovran, the messenger of Gods with rapid coursers.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निं देवासो मानुषीषु विक्षु परियं धुः कषेष्यन्तो नमित्रम स दीदयदुशतीरूर्म्या आ दक्षाय्यो यो दास्वते दम आ |||
verses.transliteration: aghniṃ devāso mānuṣīṣu vikṣu priyaṃ dhuḥ kṣeṣyanto namitram sa dīdayaduśatīrūrmyā ā dakṣāyyo yo dāsvate dama ā

translations.griffith: Among the tribes of men the Gods placed Agni as a dear Friend when they would dwell among them.  Against the longing nights may he shine brightly, and show the offerer in the house his vigour.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य रण्वा सवस्येव पुष्टिः सन्द्र्ष्टिरस्य हियानस्य दक्षोः वि यो भरिभ्रदोषधीषु जिह्वामत्यो न रथ्यो दोधवीति वारान |||
verses.transliteration: asya raṇvā svasyeva puṣṭiḥ sandṛṣṭirasya hiyānasya dakṣoḥ vi yo bharibhradoṣadhīṣu jihvāmatyo na rathyo dodhavīti vārān

translations.griffith: Sweet is his growth as of one's own possessions; his look when rushing fain to burn is lovely.  He darts his tongue forth, like a harnessed courser who shakes his flowing tail, among the bushes.

verses.sanskrit: आ यन मे अभ्वं वनदः पनन्तोशिग्भ्यो नामिमीत वर्णम स चित्रेण चिकिते रंसु भासा जुजुर्वान यो मुहुरा युवा भूत |||
verses.transliteration: ā yan me abhvaṃ vanadaḥ panantośighbhyo nāmimīta varṇam sa citreṇa cikite raṃsu bhāsā jujurvān yo muhurā yuvā bhūt

translations.griffith: Since they who honour me have praised my greatness,—he gave, as ’twere, his hue to those who love him.  Known is he by his bright delightful splendour, and waxing old renews his youth for ever.

verses.sanskrit: आ यो वना तात्र्षाणो न भाति वार्ण पथा रथ्येवस्वानीत कर्ष्णाध्वा तपू रण्वश्चिकेत दयौरिव समयमानो नभोभिः |||
verses.transliteration: ā yo vanā tātṛṣāṇo na bhāti vārṇa pathā rathyevasvānīt kṛṣṇādhvā tapū raṇvaściketa dyauriva smayamāno nabhobhiḥ

translations.griffith: Like one athirst, he lighteth up the forests; like water down the chariot ways he roareth.  On his black path he shines in burning beauty, marked as it were the heaven that smiles through vapour.

verses.sanskrit: स यो वयस्थादभि दक्षदुर्वीं पशुर्नैति सवयुरगोपाः अग्निः शोचिष्मानतसान्युष्णन कर्ष्णव्यथिरस्वदयन न भूम |||
verses.transliteration: sa yo vyasthādabhi dakṣadurvīṃ paśurnaiti svayuraghopāḥ aghniḥ śociṣmānatasānyuṣṇan kṛṣṇavyathirasvadayan na bhūma

translations.griffith: Around, consuming the broad earth, he wanders, free roaming like an ox without a herdsman,—  Agni refulgent, burning up the bushes, with blackened lines, as though the earth he seasoned.

verses.sanskrit: नू ते पूर्वस्यावसो अधीतौ तर्तीये विदथे मन्म शंसि अस्मे अग्ने संयद्वीरं बर्हन्तं कषुमन्तं वाजं सवपत्यंरयिं दाः |||
verses.transliteration: nū te pūrvasyāvaso adhītau tṛtīye vidathe manma śaṃsi asme aghne saṃyadvīraṃ bṛhantaṃ kṣumantaṃ vājaṃ svapatyaṃrayiṃ dāḥ

translations.griffith: I, in remembrance of thine ancient favour have sung my hymn in this our third assembly.  O Agni, give us wealth with store of heroes and mighty strength in food and noble offspring.

verses.sanskrit: तवया यथा गर्त्समदासो अग्ने गुहा वन्वन्त उपरानभि षयुः सुवीरासो अभिमातिषाहः समत सूरिभ्यो गर्णते तद वयो धाः |||
verses.transliteration: tvayā yathā ghṛtsamadāso aghne ghuhā vanvanta uparānabhi ṣyuḥ suvīrāso abhimātiṣāhaḥ smat sūribhyo ghṛṇate tad vayo dhāḥ

translations.griffith: May the Gṛtsamadas, serving in secret, through thee, O Agni, overcome their neighbours,  Rich in good heroes and subduing foemen. That vital power give thou to chiefs and singers.

verses.sanskrit: होताजनिष्ट चेतनः पिता पित्र्भ्य ऊतये परयक्षञ जेन्यं वसु शकेम वाजिनो यमम |||
verses.transliteration: hotājaniṣṭa cetanaḥ pitā pitṛbhya ūtaye prayakṣañ jenyaṃ vasu śakema vājino yamam

translations.griffith: HERALD and teacher was he born, a guardian for our patrons’ help,  Earner by rites of noble wealth. That Strong One may we grasp and guide;

verses.sanskrit: आ यस्मिन सप्त रश्मयस्तता यज्ञस्य नेतरि मनुष्वद दैव्यमष्टमं पोता विश्वं तदिन्वति |||
verses.transliteration: ā yasmin sapta raśmayastatā yajñasya netari manuṣvad daivyamaṣṭamaṃ potā viśvaṃ tadinvati

translations.griffith: In whom, Leader of sacrifice, the seven reins, far extended, meet;  Who furthers, man-like, eighth in place, as Cleanser, all the work divine.

verses.sanskrit: दधन्वे वा यदीमनु वोचद बरह्माणि वेरु तत परि विश्वानि काव्या नेमिश्चक्रमिवाभवत |||
verses.transliteration: dadhanve vā yadīmanu vocad brahmāṇi veru tat pari viśvāni kāvyā nemiścakramivābhavat

translations.griffith: When swift he follows this behest, bird-like he chants the holy prayers.  He holds all knowledge in his grasp even as the felly rounds the wheel.

verses.sanskrit: साकं हि शुचिना शुचिः परशास्ता करतुनाजनि विद्वानस्य वरता धरुवा वया इवानु रोहते |||
verses.transliteration: sākaṃ hi śucinā śuciḥ praśāstā kratunājani vidvānasya vratā dhruvā vayā ivānu rohate

translations.griffith: Together with pure mental power, pure, as Director, was he born.  Skilled in his own unchanging laws he waxes like the growing boughs.

verses.sanskrit: ता अस्य वर्णमायुवो नेष्टुः सचन्त धेनवः कुवित तिस्र्भ्य आ वरं सवसारो या इदं ययुः |||
verses.transliteration: tā asya varṇamāyuvo neṣṭuḥ sacanta dhenavaḥ kuvit tisṛbhya ā varaṃ svasāro yā idaṃ yayuḥ

translations.griffith: Clothing them in his hues, the kine of him the Leader wait on him.  Is he not better than the Three, the Sisters who have come to us?

verses.sanskrit: यदी मातुरुप सवसा घर्तं भरन्त्यस्थित तासामध्वर्युरागतौ यवो वर्ष्टीव मोदते |||
verses.transliteration: yadī māturupa svasā ghṛtaṃ bharantyasthita tāsāmadhvaryurāghatau yavo vṛṣṭīva modate

translations.griffith: When, laden with the holy oil, the  Sister  by the Mother stands,  The Priest delights in their approach, as corn at coming of the rain.

verses.sanskrit: सवः सवाय धायसे कर्णुतां रत्विग रत्विजम सतोमं यज्ञं चादरं वनेमा ररिमा वयम |||
verses.transliteration: svaḥ svāya dhāyase kṛṇutāṃ ṛtvigh ṛtvijam stomaṃ yajñaṃ cādaraṃ vanemā rarimā vayam

translations.griffith: For his support let him perform as ministrant his priestly task;  Yea, song of praise and sacrifice: we have bestowed, let us obtain.

verses.sanskrit: यथ विद्वानरं करद विश्वेभ्यो यजतेभ्यः अयमग्ने तवे अपि यं यज्ञं चक्र्मा वयम ||
verses.transliteration: yatha vidvānaraṃ karad viśvebhyo yajatebhyaḥ ayamaghne tve api yaṃ yajñaṃ cakṛmā vayam

translations.griffith: That so this man well skilled, may pay worship to all the Holy Ones.  And, Agni, this our sacrifice which we have here prepared, to thee.

verses.sanskrit: इमां मे अग्ने समिधमिमामुपसदं वनेः इमा उ षु शरुधी गिरः |||
verses.transliteration: imāṃ me aghne samidhamimāmupasadaṃ vaneḥ imā u ṣu śrudhī ghiraḥ

translations.griffith: AGNI, accept this flaming brand, this waiting with my prayer on thee:  Hear graciously these songs of praise.

verses.sanskrit: अया ते अग्ने विधेमोर्जो नपादश्वमिष्टे एना सूक्तेन सुजात |||
verses.transliteration: ayā te aghne vidhemorjo napādaśvamiṣṭe enā sūktena sujāta

translations.griffith: With this hymn let us honour thee, seeker of horses, Son of Strength,  With this fair hymn, thou nobly born.

verses.sanskrit: तं तवा गीर्भिर्गिर्वणसं दरविणस्युं दरविणोदः सपर्येम सपर्यवः |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ tvā ghīrbhirghirvaṇasaṃ draviṇasyuṃ draviṇodaḥ saparyema saparyavaḥ

translations.griffith: As such, lover of song, with songs, wealth-lover, giver of our wealth!  With reverence let us worship thee.

verses.sanskrit: स बोधि सूरिर्मघवा वसुपते वसुदावन युयोध्यस्मद दवेषांसि |||
verses.transliteration: sa bodhi sūrirmaghavā vasupate vasudāvan yuyodhyasmad dveṣāṃsi

translations.griffith: Be thou for us a liberal Prince, giver and Lord of precious things.  Drive those who hate us far away.

verses.sanskrit: स नो वर्ष्तिं दिवस परि स नो वाजमनर्वाणम स नः सहस्रिणीरिषः |||
verses.transliteration: sa no vṛṣtiṃ divas pari sa no vājamanarvāṇam sa naḥ sahasriṇīriṣaḥ

translations.griffith: Such as thou art, give rain from heaven, give strength which no man may resist:  Give food exceeding plentiful.

verses.sanskrit: ईळानायावस्यवे यविष्ठ दूत नो गिरा यजिष्ठ होतरा गहि |||
verses.transliteration: īḷānāyāvasyave yaviṣṭha dūta no ghirā yajiṣṭha hotarā ghahi

translations.griffith: To him who lauds thee, craving help, most youthful envoy! through our song,  Most holy Herald! come thou nigh.

verses.sanskrit: अन्तर्ह्यग्न ईयसे विद्वान जन्मोभया कवे दूतो जन्येवमित्र्यः |||
verses.transliteration: antarhyaghna īyase vidvān janmobhayā kave dūto janyevamitryaḥ

translations.griffith: Between both races, Agni, Sage, well skilled thou passest to and fro,  As envoy friendly to mankind.

verses.sanskrit: स विद्वाना च पिप्रयो यक्षि चिकित्व आनुषक आ चास्मिन सत्सि बर्हिषि |||
verses.transliteration: sa vidvānā ca piprayo yakṣi cikitva ānuṣak ā cāsmin satsi barhiṣi

translations.griffith: Befriend us thou as knowing all. Sage, duly worship thou the Gods,  And seat thee on this sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit: शरेष्ठं यविष्ठ भारताग्ने दयुमन्तमा भर वसो पुरुस्प्र्हं रयिम |||
verses.transliteration: śreṣṭhaṃ yaviṣṭha bhāratāghne dyumantamā bhara vaso puruspṛhaṃ rayim

translations.griffith: VASU, thou most youthful God, Bhārata, Agni, bring us wealth,  Excellent, splendid, much-desired.

verses.sanskrit: मा नो अरातिरीशत देवस्य मर्त्यस्य च पर्षि तस्या उतद्विषः |||
verses.transliteration: mā no arātirīśata devasya martyasya ca parṣi tasyā utadviṣaḥ

translations.griffith: Let no malignity prevail against us, either God's or man's.  Save us from this and enmity.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वा उत तवया वयं धारा उदन्या इव अति गाहेमहि दविषः |||
verses.transliteration: viśvā uta tvayā vayaṃ dhārā udanyā iva ati ghāhemahi dviṣaḥ

translations.griffith: So through thy favour may we force through all our enemies a way,  As ’twere through streaming water-floods.

verses.sanskrit: शुचिः पावक वन्द्यो.अग्ने बर्हद वि रोचसे तवं घर्तेभिराहुतः |||
verses.transliteration: śuciḥ pāvaka vandyo.aghne bṛhad vi rocase tvaṃ ghṛtebhirāhutaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou, Purifier Agni, high shinest forth, bright, adorable,  When worshipped with the sacred oil.

verses.sanskrit: तवं नो असि भारताग्ने वशाभिरुक्षभिः अष्टापदीभिराहुतः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ no asi bhāratāghne vaśābhirukṣabhiḥ aṣṭāpadībhirāhutaḥ

translations.griffith: Ours art thou, Agni, Bhārata, honoured by us with barren cows,  With bullocks and with kine in calf

verses.sanskrit: दर्वन्नः सर्पिरासुतिः परत्नो होता वरेण्यः सहसस पुत्रो अद्भुतः |||
verses.transliteration: drvannaḥ sarpirāsutiḥ pratno hotā vareṇyaḥ sahasas putro adbhutaḥ

translations.griffith: Wood-fed, bedewed with sacred oil, ancient, Invoker, excellent,  The Son of Strength, the Wonderful.

verses.sanskrit: वाजयन्निव नू रथान योगानग्नेरुप सतुहि यशस्तमस्य मीळ्हुषः |||
verses.transliteration: vājayanniva nū rathān yoghānaghnerupa stuhi yaśastamasya mīḷhuṣaḥ

translations.griffith: Now praise, as one who strives for strength, the harnessing of Agni's car,  The liberal, the most splendid One;

verses.sanskrit: यः सुनीथो ददाशुषे.अजुर्यो जरयन्नरिम चारुप्रतीकाहुतः |||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ sunītho dadāśuṣe.ajuryo jarayannarim cārupratīkaāhutaḥ

translations.griffith: Who, guiding worshippers aright, withers, untouched by age, the foe:  When worshipped fair to look upon;

verses.sanskrit: य उ शरिया दमेष्वा दोषोषसि परशस्यते यस्य वरतं न मीयते |||
verses.transliteration: ya u śriyā dameṣvā doṣoṣasi praśasyate yasya vrataṃ na mīyate

translations.griffith: Who for his glory is extolled at eve and morning in our homes,  Whose statute is inviolate;

verses.sanskrit: आ यः सवर्ण भानुना चित्रो विभात्यर्चिषा अञ्जानोजरैरभि |||
verses.transliteration: ā yaḥ svarṇa bhānunā citro vibhātyarciṣā añjānoajarairabhi

translations.griffith: Who shines refulgent like the Sun, with brilliance and with fiery flame,  Decked with imperishable sheen.

verses.sanskrit: अत्रिमनु सवराज्यमग्निमुक्थानि वाव्र्धुः विश्वा अधि शरियो दधे |||
verses.transliteration: atrimanu svarājyamaghnimukthāni vāvṛdhuḥ viśvā adhi śriyo dadhe

translations.griffith: Him Atri, Agni, have our songs Strengthened according to his sway:  All glories hath he made his own.

verses.sanskrit: अग्नेरिन्द्रस्य सोमस्य देवानामूतिभिर्वयम अरिष्यन्तःसचेमह्यभि षयाम पर्तन्यतः |||
verses.transliteration: aghnerindrasya somasya devānāmūtibhirvayam ariṣyantaḥsacemahyabhi ṣyāma pṛtanyataḥ

translations.griffith: May we with Agni's, Indra's help, with Soma's, yea, of all the Gods,  Uninjured dwell together still, and conquer those who fight with us.

verses.sanskrit: नि होता होत्र्षदने विदानस्त्वेषो दीदिवानसदत सुदक्षः अदब्धव्रतप्रमतिर्वसिष्ठः सहस्रम्भरः शुचिजिह्वो अग्निः |||
verses.transliteration: ni hotā hotṛṣadane vidānastveṣo dīdivānasadat sudakṣaḥ adabdhavratapramatirvasiṣṭhaḥ sahasrambharaḥ śucijihvo aghniḥ

translations.griffith: ACCUSTOMED to the Herald's place, the Herald hath seated him, bright, splendid, passing mighty,  Whose foresight keeps the Law from violation, excellent, pure-tongued, bringing thousands, Agni.

verses.sanskrit: तवं दूतस्त्वमु नः परस्पास्त्वं वस्य आ वर्षभ परणेता अग्ने तोकस्य नस्तने तनूनामप्रयुछन दीद्यद बोधि गोपाः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ dūtastvamu naḥ paraspāstvaṃ vasya ā vṛṣabha praṇetā aghne tokasya nastane tanūnāmaprayuchan dīdyad bodhi ghopāḥ

translations.griffith: Envoy art thou, protector from the foeman, strong God, thou leadest us to higher blessings.  Refulgent, be an ever-heedful keeper, Agni, for us and for our seed offspring.

verses.sanskrit: विधेम ते परमे जन्मन्नग्ने विधेम सतोमैरवरे सधस्थे यस्माद योनेरुदारिथा यजे तं पर तवे हवींषि जुहुरेसमिद्धे |||
verses.transliteration: vidhema te parame janmannaghne vidhema stomairavare sadhasthe yasmād yonerudārithā yaje taṃ pra tve havīṃṣi juhuresamiddhe

translations.griffith: May we adore thee in thy loftiest birthplace, and, with our praises, in thy lower station.  The place whence thou issued forth I worship: to thee well kindled have they paid oblations.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने यजस्व हविषा यजीयाञ्छ्रुष्टी देष्णमभि गर्णीहि राधः तवं हयसि रयिपती रयीणां तवं शुक्रस्य वचसो मनोता |||
verses.transliteration: aghne yajasva haviṣā yajīyāñchruṣṭī deṣṇamabhi ghṛṇīhi rādhaḥ tvaṃ hyasi rayipatī rayīṇāṃ tvaṃ śukrasya vacaso manotā

translations.griffith: Agni, best Priest, pay worship with oblation; quickly commend the gift to be presented;  For thou art Lord of gathered wealth and treasure. of the bright song of praise thou art inventor.

verses.sanskrit: उभयं ते न कषीयते वसव्यं दिवे-दिवे जायमानस्य दस्म कर्धि कषुमन्तं जरितारमग्ने कर्धि पतिं सवपत्यस्य रायः |||
verses.transliteration: ubhayaṃ te na kṣīyate vasavyaṃ dive-dive jāyamānasya dasma kṛdhi kṣumantaṃ jaritāramaghne kṛdhi patiṃ svapatyasya rāyaḥ

translations.griffith: The twofold opulence, O Wonder-Worker, of thee new-born each day never decreases.  Enrich with food the man who lauds thee, Agni: make him the lord of wealth with noble offspring.

verses.sanskrit: सैनानीकेन सुविदत्रो अस्मे यष्टा देवानायजिष्ठः सवस्ति अदब्धो गोपा उत नः परस्पा अग्ने दयुमदुत रेवद दिदीहि |||
verses.transliteration: sainānīkena suvidatro asme yaṣṭā devānāyajiṣṭhaḥ svasti adabdho ghopā uta naḥ paraspā aghne dyumaduta revad didīhi

translations.griffith: May he, benevolent with this fair aspect, best sacrificer, bring the Gods to bless us.  Sure guardian, our protector from the foemen, shine, Agni, with thine affluence and splendour.

verses.sanskrit: जोहूत्रो अग्निः परथमः पितेवेळस पदे मनुषा यत समिद्धः शरियं वसानो अम्र्तो विचेता मर्म्र्जेन्यः शरवस्यःस वाजी |||
verses.transliteration: johūtro aghniḥ prathamaḥ piteveḷas pade manuṣā yat samiddhaḥ śriyaṃ vasāno amṛto vicetā marmṛjenyaḥ śravasyaḥsa vājī

translations.griffith: AGNI, first, loudly calling, like a Father, kindled by man upon the seat of worship.  Clothed in his glory, deathless, keen of insight, must be adorned by all, the Strong, the Famous.

verses.sanskrit: शरूया अग्निश्चित्रभानुर्हवं मे विश्वाभिर्गीर्भिरम्र्तो विचेताः शयावा रथं वहतो रोहिता वोतारुषाह चक्रे विभ्र्त्रः |||
verses.transliteration: śrūyā aghniścitrabhānurhavaṃ me viśvābhirghīrbhiramṛto vicetāḥ śyāvā rathaṃ vahato rohitā votāruṣāha cakre vibhṛtraḥ

translations.griffith: May Agni the resplendent hear my calling through all my songs, Immortal, keen of insight.  Dark steeds or ruddy draw his car, or carried in sundry ways he makes them red of colour.

verses.sanskrit: उत्तानायामजनयन सुषूतं भुवदग्निः पुरुपेशासु गर्भः शिरिणायां चिदक्तुना महोभिरपरीव्र्तो वसति परचेताः |||
verses.transliteration: uttānāyāmajanayan suṣūtaṃ bhuvadaghniḥ purupeśāsu gharbhaḥ śiriṇāyāṃ cidaktunā mahobhiraparīvṛto vasati pracetāḥ

translations.griffith: On wood supine they got the well-formed Infant: a germ in various-fashioned plants was Agni;  And in the night, not compassed round by darkness, he dwells exceeding wise, with rays of splendour.

verses.sanskrit: जिघर्म्यग्निं हविषा घर्तेन परतिक्षियन्तं भुवनानि विश्वा पर्थुं तिरश्चा वयसा बर्हन्तं वयचिष्ठमन्नै रभसं दर्शानम |||
verses.transliteration: jigharmyaghniṃ haviṣā ghṛtena pratikṣiyantaṃ bhuvanāni viśvā pṛthuṃ tiraścā vayasā bṛhantaṃ vyaciṣṭhamannai rabhasaṃ dṛśānam

translations.griffith: With oil and sacred gifts I sprinkle Agni who makes his home in front of all things living,  Broad, vast, through vital power o’er all expanded, conspicuous, strong with all the food that feeds him.

verses.sanskrit: आ विश्वतः परत्यञ्चं जिघर्म्यरक्षसा मनसा तज्जुषेत मर्यश्रीः सप्र्हयद्वर्णो अग्निर्नाभिम्र्शे तन्वा जर्भुराणः |||
verses.transliteration: ā viśvataḥ pratyañcaṃ jigharmyarakṣasā manasā tajjuṣeta maryaśrīḥ spṛhayadvarṇo aghnirnābhimṛśe tanvā jarbhurāṇaḥ

translations.griffith: I pour to him who looks in all directions: may he accept it with a friendly spirit.  Agni with bridegroom's grace and lovely colour may not be touched when all his form is fury.

verses.sanskrit: जञेया भागं सहसानो वरेण तवादूतासो मनुवद वदेम अनूनमग्निं जुह्वा वचस्या मधुप्र्चं धनसाजोहवीमि |||
verses.transliteration: jñeyā bhāghaṃ sahasāno vareṇa tvādūtāso manuvad vadema anūnamaghniṃ juhvā vacasyā madhupṛcaṃ dhanasājohavīmi

translations.griffith: By choice victorious, recognize thy portion: with thee for envoy may we speak like Manu.  Obtaining wealth, I call on perfect Agni who with an eloquent tongue dispenses sweetness.

verses.sanskrit: शरुधी हवमिन्द्र मा रिशण्यः सयाम ते दावने वसूनाम इमा हि तवामूर्जो वर्धयन्ति वसूयवः सिन्धवो न कषरन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: śrudhī havamindra mā riśaṇyaḥ syāma te dāvane vasūnām imā hi tvāmūrjo vardhayanti vasūyavaḥ sindhavo na kṣarantaḥ

translations.griffith: HEAR thou my call, O Indra; be not heedless: thine may we be for thee to give us treasures;  For these presented viands, seeking riches, increase thy strength like streams of water flowing.

verses.sanskrit: सर्जो महीरिन्द्र या अपिन्वः परिष्ठिता अहिना शूर पूर्वीः अमर्त्यं चिद दासं मन्यमानमवाभिनदुक्थैर्वाव्र्धानः |||
verses.transliteration: sṛjo mahīrindra yā apinvaḥ pariṣṭhitā ahinā śūra pūrvīḥ amartyaṃ cid dāsaṃ manyamānamavābhinadukthairvāvṛdhānaḥ

translations.griffith: Floods great and many, compassed by the Dragon, thou badest swell and settest free, O Hero.  Strengthened by songs of praise thou rentest piecemeal the Dāsa, him who deemed himself immortal.

verses.sanskrit: उक्थेष्विन नु शूर येषु चाकन सतोमेष्विन्द्र रुद्रियेषु च तुभ्येदेता यासु मन्दसानः पर वायवे सिस्रते न शुभ्राः |||
verses.transliteration: uktheṣvin nu śūra yeṣu cākan stomeṣvindra rudriyeṣu ca tubhyedetā yāsu mandasānaḥ pra vāyave sisrate na śubhrāḥ

translations.griffith: For, Hero, in the lauds wherein thou joyedst, in hymns of praise, O Indra, songs of Rudras,  These streams in which is thy delight approach thee, even as the brilliant ones draw near to Vāyu.

verses.sanskrit: शुभ्रं नु ते शुष्मं वर्धयन्तः शुभ्रं वज्रं बाह्वोर्दधानाः शुभ्रस्त्वमिन्द्र वाव्र्धानो अस्मे दासीर्विशः सूर्येण सह्याः |||
verses.transliteration: śubhraṃ nu te śuṣmaṃ vardhayantaḥ śubhraṃ vajraṃ bāhvordadhānāḥ śubhrastvamindra vāvṛdhāno asme dāsīrviśaḥ sūryeṇa sahyāḥ

translations.griffith: We who add strength to thine own splendid vigour, laying within thine arms the splendid thunder—  With us mayst thou, O Indra, waxen splendid, with Sūrya overcome the Dāsa races.

verses.sanskrit: गुहा हितं गुह्यं गूळ्हमप्स्वपीव्र्तं मायिनं कषियन्तम उतो अपो दयां तस्तभ्वांसमहन्नहिं शूर वीर्येण |||
verses.transliteration: ghuhā hitaṃ ghuhyaṃ ghūḷhamapsvapīvṛtaṃ māyinaṃ kṣiyantam uto apo dyāṃ tastabhvāṃsamahannahiṃ śūra vīryeṇa

translations.griffith: Hero, thou slewest in thy valour Ahi concealed in depths, mysterious, great enchanter,  Dwelling enveloped deep within the waters, him who checked heaven and stayed the floods from flowing.

verses.sanskrit: सतवा नु त इन्द्र पूर्व्या महान्युत सतवाम नूतना कर्तानि सतवा वज्रं बाह्वोरुशन्तं सतवा हरी सूर्यस्य केतू |||
verses.transliteration: stavā nu ta indra pūrvyā mahānyuta stavāma nūtanā kṛtāni stavā vajraṃ bāhvoruśantaṃ stavā harī sūryasya ketū

translations.griffith: Indra, we laud thy great deeds wrought aforetime, we laud thine exploits later of achievement;  We laud the bolt that in thine arms lies eager; we laud thy two Bay Steeds, heralds of Sūrya.

verses.sanskrit: हरी नु त इन्द्र वाजयन्ता घर्तश्चुतं सवारमस्वार्ष्टाम वि समना भूमिरप्रथिष्टारंस्त पर्वतश्चित सरिष्यन |||
verses.transliteration: harī nu ta indra vājayantā ghṛtaścutaṃ svāramasvārṣṭām vi samanā bhūmiraprathiṣṭāraṃsta parvataścit sariṣyan

translations.griffith: Indra, thy Bay Steeds showing forth their vigour have sent a loud cry out that droppeth fatness.  The earth hath spread herself in all her fulness: the cloud that was about to move hath rested.

verses.sanskrit: नि पर्वतः साद्यप्रयुछन सं मात्र्भिर्वावशानो अक्रान दूरे पारे वाणीं वर्धयन्त इन्द्रेषितां धमनिं पप्रथन नि |||
verses.transliteration: ni parvataḥ sādyaprayuchan saṃ mātṛbhirvāvaśāno akrān dūre pāre vāṇīṃ vardhayanta indreṣitāṃ dhamaniṃ paprathan ni

translations.griffith: Down, never ceasing, hath the rain-cloud settled: bellowing, it hath wandered with the Mothers.  Swelling the roar in the far distant limits, they have spread wide the blast sent forth by Indra.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो महां सिन्धुमाशयानं मायाविनं वर्त्रमस्फुरन निः अरेजेतां रोदसी भियाने कनिक्रदतो वर्ष्णो अस्य वज्रात |||
verses.transliteration: indro mahāṃ sindhumāśayānaṃ māyāvinaṃ vṛtramasphuran niḥ arejetāṃ rodasī bhiyāne kanikradato vṛṣṇo asya vajrāt

translations.griffith: Indra hath hurled down the magician Vṛtra who lay beleaguering the mighty river.  Then both the heaven and earth trembled in terror at the strong Hero's thunder when he bellowed.

verses.sanskrit: अरोरवीद वर्ष्णो अस्य वज्रो.अमानुषं यन मानुषो निजूर्वात नि मायिनो दानवस्य माया अपादयत पपिवान सुतस्य |||
verses.transliteration: aroravīd vṛṣṇo asya vajro.amānuṣaṃ yan mānuṣo nijūrvāt ni māyino dānavasya māyā apādayat papivān sutasya

translations.griffith: Loud roared the mighty Hero's bolt of thunder, when he, the Friend of man, burnt up the monster,  And, having drunk his fill of flowing Soma, baffled the guileful Dānava's devices.

verses.sanskrit: पिबा-पिबेदिन्द्र शूर सोमं मन्दन्तु तवा मन्दिनः सुतासः पर्णन्तस्ते कुक्षी वर्धयन्त्वित्था सुतः पौर इन्द्रमाव |||
verses.transliteration: pibā-pibedindra śūra somaṃ mandantu tvā mandinaḥ sutāsaḥ pṛṇantaste kukṣī vardhayantvitthā sutaḥ paura indramāva

translations.griffith: Drink thou, O Hero Indra, drink the Soma; let the joy-giving juices make thee joyful.  They, filling both thy flanks, shall swell thy vigour. The juice that satisfies hath helped Indra.

verses.sanskrit: तवे इन्द्राप्यभूम विप्रा धियं वनेम रतया सपन्तः अवस्यवो धीमहि परशस्तिं सद्यस्ते रायो दावने सयाम |||
verses.transliteration: tve indrāpyabhūma viprā dhiyaṃ vanema ṛtayā sapantaḥ avasyavo dhīmahi praśastiṃ sadyaste rāyo dāvane syāma

translations.griffith: Singers have we become with thee, O Indra: may we serve duly and prepare devotion.  Seeking thy help we meditate thy praises: may we at once enjoy thy gift of riches.

verses.sanskrit: सयाम ते त इन्द्र ये त ऊती अवस्यव ऊर्जं वर्धयन्तः शुष्मिन्तमं यं चाकनाम देवास्मे रयिं रासि वीरवन्तम |||
verses.transliteration: syāma te ta indra ye ta ūtī avasyava ūrjaṃ vardhayantaḥ śuṣmintamaṃ yaṃ cākanāma devāsme rayiṃ rāsi vīravantam

translations.griffith: May we be thine, such by thy help, O Indra, as swell thy vigour while they seek thy favour.  Give us, thou God, the riches that we long for, most powerful, with stare of noble children.

verses.sanskrit: रासि कषयं रासि मित्रमस्मे रासि शर्ध इन्द्र मारुतंनः सजोषसो ये च मन्दसानाः पर वायवः पान्त्यग्रणीतिम |||
verses.transliteration: rāsi kṣayaṃ rāsi mitramasme rāsi śardha indra mārutaṃnaḥ sajoṣaso ye ca mandasānāḥ pra vāyavaḥ pāntyaghraṇītim

translations.griffith: Give us a friend, give us an habitation; Indra, give us the company of Maruts,  And those whose minds accord with theirs, the Vāyus, who drink the first libation of the Soma.

verses.sanskrit: वयन्त्विन नु येषु मन्दसानस्त्र्पत सोमं पाहि दरह्यदिन्द्र अस्मान सु पर्त्स्वा तरुत्रावर्धयो दयां बर्हद्भिरर्कैः |||
verses.transliteration: vyantvin nu yeṣu mandasānastṛpat somaṃ pāhi drahyadindra asmān su pṛtsvā tarutrāvardhayo dyāṃ bṛhadbhirarkaiḥ

translations.griffith: Let those enjoy in whom thou art delighted. Indra, drink Soma for thy strength and gladness.  Thou hast exalted us to heaven, Preserver, in battles, through the lofty hymns that praise thee.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हन्त इन नु ये ते तरुत्रोक्थेभिर्वा सुम्नमाविवासान सत्र्णानासो बर्हिः पस्त्यावत तवोता इदिन्द्र वाजमग्मन |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhanta in nu ye te tarutrokthebhirvā sumnamāvivāsān stṛṇānāso barhiḥ pastyāvat tvotā idindra vājamaghman

translations.griffith: Great, verily, are they, O thou Protector, who by their songs of praise have won the blessing.  They who strew sacred grass to be thy dwelling, helped by thee have got them strength, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit: उग्रेष्विन नु शूर मन्दसानस्त्रिकद्रुकेषु पाहि सोममिन्द्र परदोधुवच्छ्मश्रुषु परीणानो याहि हरिभ्यां सुतस्यपीतिम |||
verses.transliteration: ughreṣvin nu śūra mandasānastrikadrukeṣu pāhi somamindra pradodhuvacchmaśruṣu prīṇāno yāhi haribhyāṃ sutasyapītim

translations.griffith: Upon the great Trikadruka days, Hero, rejoicing thee, O Indra, drink the Soma.  Come with Bay Steeds to drink of libation, shaking the drops from out thy beard, contented.

verses.sanskrit: धिष्वा शवः शूर येन वर्त्रमवाभिनद दानुमौर्णवाभम अपाव्र्णोर्ज्योतिरार्याय नि सव्यतः सादि दस्युरिन्द्र |||
verses.transliteration: dhiṣvā śavaḥ śūra yena vṛtramavābhinad dānumaurṇavābham apāvṛṇorjyotirāryāya ni savyataḥ sādi dasyurindra

translations.griffith: Hero, assume the might wherewith thou clavest Vṛtra piecemeal, the Dānava Aurṇavābha.  Thou hast disclosed the light to light the Ārya: on thy left hand, O Indra, sank the Dasyu.

verses.sanskrit: सनेम ये त ऊतिभिस्तरन्तो विश्वा सप्र्ध आर्येण दस्यून अस्मभ्यं तत तवाष्ट्रं विश्वरूपमरन्धयः साख्यस्य तरिताय |||
verses.transliteration: sanema ye ta ūtibhistaranto viśvā spṛdha āryeṇa dasyūn asmabhyaṃ tat tvāṣṭraṃ viśvarūpamarandhayaḥ sākhyasya tritāya

translations.griffith: May we gain wealth, subduing with thy succour and with the Ārya, all our foes, the Dasyus.  Our gain was that to Tṛta of our party thou gavest up Tvaṣṭar's son Viśvarūpa.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य सुवानस्य मन्दिनस्त्रितस्य नयर्बुदं वाव्र्धानो अस्तः अवर्तयत सूर्यो न चक्रं भिनद वलमिन्द्रो अङगिरस्वान |||
verses.transliteration: asya suvānasya mandinastritasya nyarbudaṃ vāvṛdhāno astaḥ avartayat sūryo na cakraṃ bhinad valamindro aṅghirasvān

translations.griffith: He cast down Arbuda what time his vigour was strengthened by libations poured by Tṛta.  Indra sent forth his whirling wheel like Sūrya, and aided by the Aṅgirases rent Vala.

verses.sanskrit: नूनं सा ते परति वरं जरित्रे दुहीयदिन्द्र दक्षिणा मघोनी शिक्षा सतोत्र्भ्यो माति धग भगो नो बर्हद वदेम व. स. |||
verses.transliteration: nūnaṃ sā te prati varaṃ jaritre duhīyadindra dakṣiṇā maghonī śikṣā stotṛbhyo māti dhagh bhagho no bṛhad vadema v. s.

translations.griffith: Now let that wealthy Cow of thine, O Indra, yield in return a boon to him who lauds thee.  Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with brave men, in the assembly.

verses.sanskrit: यो जात एव परथमो मनस्वान देवो देवान करतुना पर्यभूषत यस्य शुष्माद रोदसी अभ्यसेतां नर्म्णस्य मह्ना स जनास इन्द्रः |||
verses.transliteration: yo jāta eva prathamo manasvān devo devān kratunā paryabhūṣat yasya śuṣmād rodasī abhyasetāṃ nṛmṇasya mahnā sa janāsa indraḥ

translations.griffith: HE who, just born, chief God of lofty spirit by power and might became the Gods’ protector,  Before whose breath through greatness of his valour the two worlds trembled, He, O men, is Indra.

verses.sanskrit: यः पर्थिवीं वयथमानामद्रंहद यः पर्वतान परकुपितानरम्णात यो अन्तरिक्षं विममे वरीयो यो दयामस्तभ्नात स जनास इन्द्रः |||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ pṛthivīṃ vyathamānāmadṛṃhad yaḥ parvatān prakupitānaramṇāt yo antarikṣaṃ vimame varīyo yo dyāmastabhnāt sa janāsa indraḥ

translations.griffith: He who fixed fast and firm the earth that staggered, and set at rest the agitated mountains,  Who measured out the air's wide middle region and gave the heaven support, He, men, is Indra.

verses.sanskrit: यो हत्वाहिमरिणात सप्त सिन्धून यो गा उदाजदपधा वलस्य यो अश्मनोरन्तरग्निं जजान संव्र्क समत्सु स. ज. इ. |||
verses.transliteration: yo hatvāhimariṇāt sapta sindhūn yo ghā udājadapadhā valasya yo aśmanorantaraghniṃ jajāna saṃvṛk samatsu s. j. i.

translations.griffith: Who slew the Dragon, freed the Seven Rivers, and drove the kine forth from the cave of Vala,  Begat the fire between two stones, the spoiler in warriors’ battle, He, O men, is Indra.

verses.sanskrit: येनेमा विश्वा चयवना कर्तानि यो दासं वर्णमधरंगुहाकः शवघ्नीव यो जिगीवान लक्षमाददर्यः पुष्टानि स. ज. इ. |||
verses.transliteration: yenemā viśvā cyavanā kṛtāni yo dāsaṃ varṇamadharaṃghuhākaḥ śvaghnīva yo jighīvān lakṣamādadaryaḥ puṣṭāni s. j. i.

translations.griffith: By whom this universe was made to tremble, who chased away the humbled brood of demons,  Who, like a gambler gathering his winnings seized the foe's riches, He, O men, is Indra.

verses.sanskrit: यं समा पर्छन्ति कुह सेति घोरमुतेमाहुर्नैषो अस्तीत्येनम सो अर्यः पुष्तीर्विज इवा मिनाति शरदस्मै धत्तस. ज. इ. |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ smā pṛchanti kuha seti ghoramutemāhurnaiṣo astītyenam so aryaḥ puṣtīrvija ivā mināti śradasmai dhattas. j. i.

translations.griffith: Of whom, the Terrible, they ask, Where is He? or verily they say of him, He is not.  He sweeps away, like birds, the foe's possessions. Have faith in him, for He, O men, is Indra.

verses.sanskrit: यो रध्रस्य चोदिता यः कर्शस्य यो बरह्मणो नाधमानस्यकीरेः युक्तग्राव्णो यो.अविता सुशिप्रः सुतसोमस्य स. ज. इ. |||
verses.transliteration: yo radhrasya coditā yaḥ kṛśasya yo brahmaṇo nādhamānasyakīreḥ yuktaghrāvṇo yo.avitā suśipraḥ sutasomasya s. j. i.

translations.griffith: Stirrer to action of the poor and lowly, of priest, of suppliant who sings his praises;  Who, fair-faced, favours him who presses Soma with stones made ready, He, O men, is Indra.

verses.sanskrit: यस्याश्वासः परदिशि यस्य गावो यस्य गरामा यस्य विश्वे रथासः यः सूर्यं य उषसं जजान यो अपां नेता स. ज. इ. |||
verses.transliteration: yasyāśvāsaḥ pradiśi yasya ghāvo yasya ghrāmā yasya viśve rathāsaḥ yaḥ sūryaṃ ya uṣasaṃ jajāna yo apāṃ netā s. j. i.

translations.griffith: He under whose supreme control are horses, all chariots, and the villages, and cattle;  He who gave being to the Sun and Morning, who leads the waters, He, O men, is Indra.

verses.sanskrit: यं करन्दसी संयती विह्वयेते परे.अवर उभया अमित्राः समानं चिद रथमातस्थिवांसा नाना हवेते स. ज. इ. |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ krandasī saṃyatī vihvayete pare.avara ubhayā amitrāḥ samānaṃ cid rathamātasthivāṃsā nānā havete s. j. i.

translations.griffith: To whom two armies cry in close encounter, both enemies, the stronger and the weaker;  Whom two invoke upon one chariot mounted, each for himself, He, O ye men, is Indra.

verses.sanskrit: यस्मान न रते विजयन्ते जनासो यं युध्यमाना अवसे हवन्ते यो विश्वस्य परतिमानं बभूव यो अच्युतच्युत स. ज. इ. |||
verses.transliteration: yasmān na ṛte vijayante janāso yaṃ yudhyamānā avase havante yo viśvasya pratimānaṃ babhūva yo acyutacyut s. j. i.

translations.griffith: Without whose help our people never conquer; whom, battling, they invoke to give them succour;  He of whom all this world is but the copy, who shakes things moveless, He, O men, is Indra.

verses.sanskrit: यः शश्वतो मह्येनो दधानानमन्यमानाञ्छर्वा जघान यः शर्धते नानुददाति शर्ध्यां यो दस्योर्हन्तास. ज. इ. |||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ śaśvato mahyeno dadhānānamanyamānāñcharvā jaghāna yaḥ śardhate nānudadāti śṛdhyāṃ yo dasyorhantās. j. i.

translations.griffith: He who hath smitten, ere they knew their danger, with his hurled weapon many grievous sinners;  Who pardons not his boldness who provokes him, who slays the Dasyu, He, O men, is Indra.

verses.sanskrit: यः शम्बरं पर्वतेषु कषियन्तं चत्वारिंश्यां शरद्यन्वविन्दत ओजायमानं यो अहिं जघान दानुं शयानंस. ज. इ. |||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ śambaraṃ parvateṣu kṣiyantaṃ catvāriṃśyāṃ śaradyanvavindat ojāyamānaṃ yo ahiṃ jaghāna dānuṃ śayānaṃs. j. i.

translations.griffith: He who discovered in the fortieth autumn Śambara as he dwelt among the mountains;  Who slew the Dragon putting forth his vigour, the demon lying there, He, men, is Indra.

verses.sanskrit: यः सप्तरश्मिर्व्र्षभस्तुविष्मानवास्र्जत सर्तवे सप्तसिन्धून यो रौहिणमस्फुरद वज्रबाहुर्द्यामारोहन्तंस. ज. इ. |||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ saptaraśmirvṛṣabhastuviṣmānavāsṛjat sartave saptasindhūn yo rauhiṇamasphurad vajrabāhurdyāmārohantaṃs. j. i.

translations.griffith: Who with seven guiding reins, the Bull, the Mighty, set free the Seven great Floods to flow at pleasure;  Who, thunder-armed, rent Rauhiṇa in pieces when scaling heaven, He, O ye men, is Indra.

verses.sanskrit: दयावा चिदस्मै पर्थिवी नमेते शुष्माच्चिदस्य पर्वता भयन्ते यः सोमपा निचितो वज्रबाहुर्यो वज्रहस्तः स. ज. इ. |||
verses.transliteration: dyāvā cidasmai pṛthivī namete śuṣmāccidasya parvatā bhayante yaḥ somapā nicito vajrabāhuryo vajrahastaḥ s. j. i.

translations.griffith: Even the Heaven and Earth bow down before him, before his very breath the mountains tremble.  Known as the Soma-drinker, armed with thunder, who wields the bolt, He, O ye men, is Indra.

verses.sanskrit: यः सुन्वन्तमवति यः पचन्तं यः शंसन्तं यः शशमानमूती यस्य बरह्म वर्धनं यस्य सोमो यस्येदं राधः स. ज. इ. |||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ sunvantamavati yaḥ pacantaṃ yaḥ śaṃsantaṃ yaḥ śaśamānamūtī yasya brahma vardhanaṃ yasya somo yasyedaṃ rādhaḥ s. j. i.

translations.griffith: Who aids with favour him who pours the Soma and him who brews it, sacrificer, singer.  Whom prayer exalts, and pouring forth of Soma, and this our gift, He, O ye men, Is Indra.

verses.sanskrit: यः सुन्वते पचते दुध्र आ चिद वाजं दर्दर्षि स किलासि सत्यः वयं त इन्द्र विश्वह परियासः सुवीरासो विदथमा वदेम |||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ sunvate pacate dudhra ā cid vājaṃ dardarṣi sa kilāsi satyaḥ vayaṃ ta indra viśvaha priyāsaḥ suvīrāso vidathamā vadema

translations.griffith: Thou verily art fierce and true who sendest strength to the man who brews and pours libation.  So may we evermore, thy friends, O Indra, speak loudly to the synod with our heroes.

verses.sanskrit: रतुर्जनित्री तस्या अपस परि मक्षू जात आविशद यासु वर्धते तदाहना अभवत पिप्युषी पयो.अंशोः पीयूषं परथमं तदुक्थ्यम |||
verses.transliteration: ṛturjanitrī tasyā apas pari makṣū jāta āviśad yāsu vardhate tadāhanā abhavat pipyuṣī payo.aṃśoḥ pīyūṣaṃ prathamaṃ tadukthyam

translations.griffith: THE Season was the parent, and when born therefrom it entered rapidly the floods wherein it grows.  Thence was it full of sap, streaming with milky juice: the milk of the plant's stalk is chief and meet for lauds.

verses.sanskrit: सध्रीमा यन्ति परि बिभ्रतीः पयो विश्वप्स्न्याय पर भरन्त भोजनम समानो अध्वा परवतामनुष्यदे यस्ताक्र्णोः परथमं सास्युक्थ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: sadhrīmā yanti pari bibhratīḥ payo viśvapsnyāya pra bharanta bhojanam samāno adhvā pravatāmanuṣyade yastākṛṇoḥ prathamaṃ sāsyukthyaḥ

translations.griffith: They come trooping together bearing milk to him, and bring him sustenance who gives support to all.  The way is common for the downward streams to flow. Thou who didst these things first art worthy of our lauds.

verses.sanskrit: अन्वेको वदति यद ददाति तद रूपा मिनन तदपा एक ईयते विश्वा एकस्य विनुदस्तितिक्षते यस्ताक्र... |||
verses.transliteration: anveko vadati yad dadāti tad rūpā minan tadapā eka īyate viśvā ekasya vinudastitikṣate yastākṛ...

translations.griffith: One priest announces what the institutor gives: one, altering the forms, zealously plies his task,  The third corrects the imperfections left by each. Thou who didst these things first art worthy of our lauds.

verses.sanskrit: परजाभ्यः पुष्टिं विभजन्त आसते रयिमिव पर्ष्ठं परभवन्तमायते असिन्वन दंष्ट्रैः पितुरत्ति भोजनं यस्ताक्र... |||
verses.transliteration: prajābhyaḥ puṣṭiṃ vibhajanta āsate rayimiva pṛṣṭhaṃ prabhavantamāyate asinvan daṃṣṭraiḥ pituratti bhojanaṃ yastākṛ...

translations.griffith: Dealing out food unto their people there they sit, like wealth to him who comes, more than the back can bear.  Greedily with his teeth he eats the master's food. Thou who didst these things first art worthy of our lauds.

verses.sanskrit: अधाक्र्णोः पर्थिवीं सन्द्र्शे दिवे यो धौतीनामहिहन्नारिणक पथः तं तवा सतोमेभिरुदभिर्न वाजिनं देवं देवा अजनन सास्युक्थ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: adhākṛṇoḥ pṛthivīṃ sandṛśe dive yo dhautīnāmahihannāriṇak pathaḥ taṃ tvā stomebhirudabhirna vājinaṃ devaṃ devā ajanan sāsyukthyaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou hast created earth to look upon the sky: thou, slaying Ahi, settest free the river's paths.  Thee, such, a God, the Gods have quickened with their lauds, even as a steed with waters: meet for praise art thou.

verses.sanskrit: यो भोजनं च दयसे च वर्धनमार्द्रादा शुष्कं मधुमद दुदोहिथ स शेवधिं नि दधिषे विवस्वति विश्वस्यैक ईशिषे सास्यु. |||
verses.transliteration: yo bhojanaṃ ca dayase ca vardhanamārdrādā śuṣkaṃ madhumad dudohitha sa śevadhiṃ ni dadhiṣe vivasvati viśvasyaika īśiṣe sāsyu.

translations.griffith: Thou givest increase, thou dealest to us our food: thou milkest from the moist the dry, the rich in sweets.  Thou by the worshipper layest thy precious store: thou art sole Lord of all. Meet for our praise art thou.

verses.sanskrit: यः पुष्पिणीश्च परस्वश्च धर्मणाधि दाने वयवनीरधारयः यश्चासमा अजनो दिद्युतो दिव उरुरूर्वानभितः स. उ. |||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ puṣpiṇīśca prasvaśca dharmaṇādhi dāne vyavanīradhārayaḥ yaścāsamā ajano didyuto diva ururūrvānabhitaḥ s. u.

translations.griffith: Thou who hast spread abroad the streams by stablished law, and in the field the plants that blossom and bear seed;  Thou who hast made the matchless lightnings of the sky,—vast, compassing vast realms, meet for our praise art thou.

verses.sanskrit: यो नार्मरं सहवसुं निहन्तवे पर्क्षाय च दासवेशाय चावहः ऊर्जयन्त्या अपरिविष्टमास्यमुतैवाद्य पुरुक्र्त्स. उ. |||
verses.transliteration: yo nārmaraṃ sahavasuṃ nihantave pṛkṣāya ca dāsaveśāya cāvahaḥ ūrjayantyā apariviṣṭamāsyamutaivādya purukṛts. u.

translations.griffith: Who broughtest Nārmara with all his wealth, for sake of food, to slay him that the fiends might be destroyed,  Broughtest the face unclouded of the strengthening one, performing much even now, worthy art thou of praise.

verses.sanskrit: शतं वा यस्य दश साकमाद्य एकस्य शरुष्टौ यद धचोदमाविथ अरज्जौ दस्यून समुनब दभीतये सुप्राव्योभवः स. उ. |||
verses.transliteration: śataṃ vā yasya daśa sākamādya ekasya śruṣṭau yad dhacodamāvitha arajjau dasyūn samunab dabhītaye suprāvyoabhavaḥ s. u.

translations.griffith: Thou boundest up the Dāsa's hundred friends and ten, when, at one's hearing, thou helpest thy worshipper.  Thou for Dabhīti boundest Dasyus not with cords; Thou wast a mighty help. Worthy of lauds art thou.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वेदनु रोधना अस्य पौंस्यं ददुरस्मै दधिरे कर्त्नवे धनम षळ अस्तभ्ना विष्टिरः पञ्च सन्द्र्शः परिपरो अभवः स. उ. |||
verses.transliteration: viśvedanu rodhanā asya pauṃsyaṃ dadurasmai dadhire kṛtnave dhanam ṣaḷ astabhnā viṣṭiraḥ pañca sandṛśaḥ pariparo abhavaḥ s. u.

translations.griffith: All banks of rivers yielded to his manly might; to him they gave, to him, the Strong, gave up their wealth.  The six directions hast thou fixed, a five-fold view: thy victories reached afar. Worthy of lauds art thou.

verses.sanskrit: सुप्रवाचनं तव वीर वीर्यं यदेकेन करतुना विन्दसे वसु जातूष्ठिरस्य पर वयः सहस्वतो या चकर्थ सेन्द्र विश्वास्युक्थ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: supravācanaṃ tava vīra vīryaṃ yadekena kratunā vindase vasu jātūṣṭhirasya pra vayaḥ sahasvato yā cakartha sendra viśvāsyukthyaḥ

translations.griffith: Meet for high praise, O Hero, is thy power, that with thy single wisdom thou obtainest wealth,  The life-support of conquering Jātūṣṭhira. Indra, for all thy deeds, worthy of lauds art thou.

verses.sanskrit: अरमयः सरपसस्तराय कं तुर्वीतये च वय्याय च सरुतिम नीचा सन्तमुदनयः पराव्र्जं परान्धं शरोणं शरवयन स. उ. |||
verses.transliteration: aramayaḥ sarapasastarāya kaṃ turvītaye ca vayyāya ca srutim nīcā santamudanayaḥ parāvṛjaṃ prāndhaṃ śroṇaṃ śravayan s. u.

translations.griffith: Thou for Turvīti heldest still the flowing floods, the river-stream for Vayya easily to pass  Didst raise the outcast from the depths, and gavest fame unto the halt and blind. Worthy of lauds art thou.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मभ्यं तद वसो दानाय राधः समर्थयस्व बहु ते वसव्यम इन्द्र यच्चित्रं शरवस्या अनु दयून बर्हद वदेम व. स. |||
verses.transliteration: asmabhyaṃ tad vaso dānāya rādhaḥ samarthayasva bahu te vasavyam indra yaccitraṃ śravasyā anu dyūn bṛhad vadema v. s.

translations.griffith: Prepare thyself to grant us that great bounty, O Vasu, for abundant is thy treasure.  Snatch up the wonderful, O Indra, daily. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

verses.sanskrit: अध्वर्यवो भरतेन्द्राय सोममामत्रेभिः सिञ्चता मद्यमन्धः कामी हि वीरः सदमस्य पीतिं जुहोत वर्ष्णे तदिदेश वष्टि |||
verses.transliteration: adhvaryavo bharatendrāya somamāmatrebhiḥ siñcatā madyamandhaḥ kāmī hi vīraḥ sadamasya pītiṃ juhota vṛṣṇe tadideśa vaṣṭi

translations.griffith: MINISTERS, bring the Soma juice for Indra, pour forth the gladdening liquor with the beakers.  To drink of this the Hero longeth ever; offer it to the Bull, for this he willeth.

verses.sanskrit: अध्वर्यवो यो अपो वव्रिवांसं वर्त्रं जघानाशन्येव वर्क्षम तस्मा एतं भरत तद्वशायनेष इन्द्रो अर्हति पीतिमस्य |||
verses.transliteration: adhvaryavo yo apo vavrivāṃsaṃ vṛtraṃ jaghānāśanyeva vṛkṣam tasmā etaṃ bharata tadvaśāyaneṣa indro arhati pītimasya

translations.griffith: Ye ministers, to him who with the lightning smote, like a tree, the rain-withholding Vṛtra—  Bring it to him, him who is fain to taste it, a draught of this which Indra here deserveth.

verses.sanskrit: अध्वर्यवो यो दर्भीकं जघान यो गा उदाजदप हि वलं वः तस्मा एतमन्तरिक्षे न वातमिन्द्रं सोमैरोर्णुत जूर्न वस्त्रैः |||
verses.transliteration: adhvaryavo yo dṛbhīkaṃ jaghāna yo ghā udājadapa hi valaṃ vaḥ tasmā etamantarikṣe na vātamindraṃ somairorṇuta jūrna vastraiḥ

translations.griffith: Ye ministers, to him who smote Dṛbhīka, who drove the kine forth, and discovered Vala,  Offer this draught, like Vita in the region: clothe him with Soma even as steeds with trappings.

verses.sanskrit: अध्वर्यवो य उरणं जघान नव चख्वांसं नवतिं चबाहून यो अर्बुदमव नीचा बबाधे तमिन्द्रं सोमस्यभ्र्थे हिनोत |||
verses.transliteration: adhvaryavo ya uraṇaṃ jaghāna nava cakhvāṃsaṃ navatiṃ cabāhūn yo arbudamava nīcā babādhe tamindraṃ somasyabhṛthe hinota

translations.griffith: Him who did Uraṇa to death, Adhvaryus! though showing arms ninety-and-nine in number;  Who cast down headlong Arbuda and slew him,—speed ye that Indra to our offered Soma.

verses.sanskrit: अध्वर्यवो यः सवश्नं जघान यः शुष्णमशुषं यो वयंसम यः पिप्रुं नमुचिं यो रुधिक्रां तस्मा इन्द्रायान्धसो जुहोत |||
verses.transliteration: adhvaryavo yaḥ svaśnaṃ jaghāna yaḥ śuṣṇamaśuṣaṃ yo vyaṃsam yaḥ pipruṃ namuciṃ yo rudhikrāṃ tasmā indrāyāndhaso juhota

translations.griffith: Ye ministers, to him who struck down Svaśna, and did to death Vyaṁsa and greedy Śuṣṇa,  And Rudhikrās and Namuci and Pipru,—to him, to Indra, pour ye forth libation.

verses.sanskrit: अध्वर्यवो यः शतं शम्बरस्य पुरो बिभेदाश्मनेव पूर्वीः यो वर्चिनः शतमिन्द्रः सहस्रमपावपद भरतासोममस्मै |||
verses.transliteration: adhvaryavo yaḥ śataṃ śambarasya puro bibhedāśmaneva pūrvīḥ yo varcinaḥ śatamindraḥ sahasramapāvapad bharatāsomamasmai

translations.griffith: Ye ministers, to him who as with thunder demolished Śambara's hundred ancient castles;  Who cast down Varcin's sons, a hundred thousand,—to him, to Indra, offer ye the Soma.

verses.sanskrit: अध्वर्यवो यः शतमा सहस्रं भूम्या उपस्थे.अवपज्जघन्वान कुत्सस्यायोरतिथिग्वस्य वीरान नयाव्र्णग भरता सोममस्मै |||
verses.transliteration: adhvaryavo yaḥ śatamā sahasraṃ bhūmyā upasthe.avapajjaghanvān kutsasyāyoratithighvasya vīrān nyāvṛṇagh bharatā somamasmai

translations.griffith: Ye ministers, to him who slew a hundred thousand, and cast them down upon earth's bosom;  Who quelled the valiant men of Atithigva, Kutsa, and Āyu,—bring to him the Soma.

verses.sanskrit: अध्वर्यवो यन नरः कामयाध्वे शरुष्टी वहन्तो नशथा तदिन्द्रे गभस्तिपूतं भरत शरुतायेन्द्राय सोमं यज्यवो जुहोत |||
verses.transliteration: adhvaryavo yan naraḥ kāmayādhve śruṣṭī vahanto naśathā tadindre ghabhastipūtaṃ bharata śrutāyendrāya somaṃ yajyavo juhota

translations.griffith: Ministers, men, whatever thing ye long for obtain ye quickly bringing gifts to Indra.  Bring to the Glorious One what bands have cleansed; to Indra bring, ye pious ones, the Soma.

verses.sanskrit: अध्वर्यवः कर्तना शरुष्टिमस्मै वने निपूतं वन उन नयध्वम जुषाणो हस्त्यमभि वावशे व इन्द्राय सोमं मदिरं जुहोत |||
verses.transliteration: adhvaryavaḥ kartanā śruṣṭimasmai vane nipūtaṃ vana un nayadhvam juṣāṇo hastyamabhi vāvaśe va indrāya somaṃ madiraṃ juhota

translations.griffith: Do ye, O ministers, obey his order: that purified in wood, in wood uplift ye.  Well pleased he longs for what your hands have tended: offer the gladdening Soma juice to Indra.

verses.sanskrit: अध्वर्यवः पयसोधर्यथा गोः सोमेभिरीं पर्णता भोजमिन्द्रम वेदाहमस्य निभ्र्तं म एतद दित्सन्तं भूयो यजतश्चिकेत |||
verses.transliteration: adhvaryavaḥ payasodharyathā ghoḥ somebhirīṃ pṛṇatā bhojamindram vedāhamasya nibhṛtaṃ ma etad ditsantaṃ bhūyo yajataściketa

translations.griffith: As the cow's udder teems with milk, Adhvaryus, so fill with Soma Indra, liberal giver.  I know him: I am sure of this, the Holy knows that I fain would give to him more largely.

verses.sanskrit: अध्वर्यवो यो दिव्यस्य वस्वो यः पार्थिवस्य कषम्यस्य राजा तमूर्दरं न परिणता यवेनेन्द्रं सोमेभिस्तदपोवो अस्तु |||
verses.transliteration: adhvaryavo yo divyasya vasvo yaḥ pārthivasya kṣamyasya rājā tamūrdaraṃ na priṇatā yavenendraṃ somebhistadapovo astu

translations.griffith: Him, ministers, the Lord of heavenly treasure and all terrestrial wealth that earth possesses,  Him, Indra, fill with Soma as a garner is filled with barley full: be this your labour.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मभ्यं तद ... ||
verses.transliteration: asmabhyaṃ tad ...

translations.griffith: Prepare thyself to grant us that great booty, O Vasu, for abundant is thy treasure.  Gather up wondrous wealth, O Indra, daily. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

verses.sanskrit: पर घा नवस्य महतो महानि सत्या सत्यस्य करणानि वोचम तरिकद्रुकेश्वपिबत सुतस्यास्य मदे अहिमिन्द्रो जघान |||
verses.transliteration: pra ghā nvasya mahato mahāni satyā satyasya karaṇāni vocam trikadrukeśvapibat sutasyāsya made ahimindro jaghāna

translations.griffith: Now, verily, will I declare the exploits, mighty and true, of him the True and Mighty.  In the Trikadrukas he drank the Soma: then in its rapture Indra slew the Dragon.

verses.sanskrit: अवंशे दयामस्तभायद बर्हन्तमा रोदसी अप्र्णदन्तरिक्षम स धारयद पर्थिवीं पप्रथच्च सोमस्य ता मद इन्द्रश्चकार |||
verses.transliteration: avaṃśe dyāmastabhāyad bṛhantamā rodasī apṛṇadantarikṣam sa dhārayad pṛthivīṃ paprathacca somasya tā mada indraścakāra

translations.griffith: High heaven unsupported in space he stablished: he filled the two worlds and the air's mid-region.  Earth he upheld, and gave it wide expansion. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

verses.sanskrit: सद्मेव पराचो वि मिमाय मानैर्वज्रेण खान्यत्र्णन नदीनाम वर्थास्र्जत पथिभिर्दीर्घयाथैः सोमस्य ता ... |||
verses.transliteration: sadmeva prāco vi mimāya mānairvajreṇa khānyatṛṇan nadīnām vṛthāsṛjat pathibhirdīrghayāthaiḥ somasya tā ...

translations.griffith: From front, as ’twere a house, he ruled and measured; pierced with his bolt the fountains of the rivers,  And made them flow at ease by paths far-reaching, These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

verses.sanskrit: स परवोळ्हॄन परिगत्या दभीतेर्विश्वमधागायुधमिद्धे अग्नौ सं गोभिरश्वैरस्र्जद रथेभिः सो... |||
verses.transliteration: sa pravoḷhṝn parighatyā dabhīterviśvamadhāghāyudhamiddhe aghnau saṃ ghobhiraśvairasṛjad rathebhiḥ so...

translations.griffith: Compassing those who bore away Dabhīti, in kindled fire he burnt up all their weapons.  And made him rich with kine and cars and horses. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

verses.sanskrit: स ईं महीं धुनिमेतोररम्णात सो अस्नातॄनपारयत सवस्ति त उत्स्नाय रयिमभि पर तस्थुः सो... |||
verses.transliteration: sa īṃ mahīṃ dhunimetoraramṇāt so asnātṝnapārayat svasti ta utsnāya rayimabhi pra tasthuḥ so...

translations.griffith: The mighty roaring flood he stayed from flowing, and carried those who swam not safely over.  They having crossed the stream attained to riches. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

verses.sanskrit: सोदञ्चं सिन्धुमरिणान महित्वा वज्रेणान उषसः सं पिपेष अजवसो जविनीभिर्विव्र्श्चन सो... |||
verses.transliteration: sodañcaṃ sindhumariṇān mahitvā vajreṇāna uṣasaḥ saṃ pipeṣa ajavaso javinībhirvivṛścan so...

translations.griffith: With mighty power he made the stream flow upward, crushed with his thunderbolt the car of Uṣas,  Rending her slow steeds with his rapid coursers. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

verses.sanskrit: स विद्वानपगोहं कनीनामाविर्भवन्नुदतिष्ठत पराव्र्क परति शरोण सथाद वयनगचष्ट सो... |||
verses.transliteration: sa vidvānapaghohaṃ kanīnāmāvirbhavannudatiṣṭhat parāvṛk prati śroṇa sthād vyanaghacaṣṭa so...

translations.griffith: Knowing the place wherein the maids were hiding, the outcast showed himself and stood before them.  The cripple stood erect, the blind beheld them. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

verses.sanskrit: भिनद वलमङगिरोभिर्ग्र्णानो वि पर्वतस्य दरंहितान्यैरत रिणग रोधांसि कर्त्रिमाण्येषां सो... |||
verses.transliteration: bhinad valamaṅghirobhirghṛṇāno vi parvatasya dṛṃhitānyairat riṇagh rodhāṃsi kṛtrimāṇyeṣāṃ so...

translations.griffith: Praised by the Aṅgirases he slaughtered Vala, and burst apart the bulwarks of the mountain.  He tore away their deftly-built defences. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

verses.sanskrit: सवप्नेनाभ्युप्या चुमुरिं धुनिं च जघन्थ दस्यं पर दभीतिमावः रम्भी चिदत्र विविदे हिरण्यं सो... |||
verses.transliteration: svapnenābhyupyā cumuriṃ dhuniṃ ca jaghantha dasyaṃ pra dabhītimāvaḥ rambhī cidatra vivide hiraṇyaṃ so...

translations.griffith: Thou, with sleep whelming Cumuri and Dhuni, slewest the Dasyu, keptest safe Dabhīti.  There the staff-bearer found the golden treasure. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

verses.sanskrit: नूनं सा ते परति ... ||
verses.transliteration: nūnaṃ sā te prati ...

translations.griffith: Now let that wealthy Cow of thine, O Indra , yield in return a boon to him who lauds thee.  Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with brave men, in assembly.

verses.sanskrit: पर वः सतां जयेष्ठतमाय सुष्टुतिमग्नाविव समिधाने हविर्भरे इन्द्रमजुर्यं जरयन्तमुक्षितं सनाद युवानमवसे हवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: pra vaḥ satāṃ jyeṣṭhatamāya suṣṭutimaghnāviva samidhāne havirbhare indramajuryaṃ jarayantamukṣitaṃ sanād yuvānamavase havāmahe

translations.griffith: To him, your own, the best among the good, I bring eulogy, like oblation in the kindled fire.  We invocate for help Indra untouched by eld, who maketh all decay, strengthened, for ever young.

verses.sanskrit: यस्मादिन्द्राद बर्हतः किं चनें रते विश्वान्यस्मिन सम्भ्र्ताधि वीर्या जठरे सोमं तन्वी सहो महो हस्ते वज्रं भरति शीर्षणि करतुम |||
verses.transliteration: yasmādindrād bṛhataḥ kiṃ caneṃ ṛte viśvānyasmin sambhṛtādhi vīryā jaṭhare somaṃ tanvī saho maho haste vajraṃ bharati śīrṣaṇi kratum

translations.griffith: Without whom naught exists, Indra the Lofty One; in whom alone all powers heroic are combined.  The Soma is within him, in his frame vast strength, the thunder in his hand and wisdom in his head.

verses.sanskrit: न कषोणीभ्यां परिभ्वे त इन्द्रियं न समुद्रैः पर्वतैरिन्द्र ते रथः न ते वज्रमन्वश्नोति कश्चन यदाशुभिः पतसि योजना पुरु |||
verses.transliteration: na kṣoṇībhyāṃ paribhve ta indriyaṃ na samudraiḥ parvatairindra te rathaḥ na te vajramanvaśnoti kaścana yadāśubhiḥ patasi yojanā puru

translations.griffith: Not by both worlds is thine own power to be surpassed, nor may thy car be stayed by mountains or by seas.  None cometh near, O Indra, to thy thunderbolt, when with swift steeds thou fliest over many a league.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वे हयस्मै यजताय धर्ष्णवे करतुं भरन्ति वर्षभाय सश्चते वर्षा यजस्व हविषा विदुष्टरः पिबेन्द्र सोमं वर्षभेण भानुना |||
verses.transliteration: viśve hyasmai yajatāya dhṛṣṇave kratuṃ bharanti vṛṣabhāya saścate vṛṣā yajasva haviṣā viduṣṭaraḥ pibendra somaṃ vṛṣabheṇa bhānunā

translations.griffith: For all men bring their will to him the Resolute, to him the Holy One, to him the Strong they cleave.  Pay worship with oblation, strong and passing wise. Drink thou the Soma, Indra, through the mighty blaze.

verses.sanskrit: वर्ष्णः कोशः पवते मध्व ऊर्मिर्व्र्षभान्नाय वर्षभाय पातवे वर्षणाध्वर्यू वर्षभासो अद्रयो वर्षणं सोमं वर्षभाय सुष्वति |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣṇaḥ kośaḥ pavate madhva ūrmirvṛṣabhānnāya vṛṣabhāya pātave vṛṣaṇādhvaryū vṛṣabhāso adrayo vṛṣaṇaṃ somaṃ vṛṣabhāya suṣvati

translations.griffith: The vessel of the strong flows forth, the flood of meath, unto the Strong who feeds upon the strong, for drink,  Strong are the two Adhvaryus, strong are both the stones. They press the Soma that is strong for him the Strong.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षा ते वज्र उत ते वर्षा रथो वर्षणा हरी वर्षभाण्यायुधा वर्ष्णो मदस्य वर्षभ तवमीशिष इन्द्र सोमस्य वर्षभस्य तर्प्णुहि |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣā te vajra uta te vṛṣā ratho vṛṣaṇā harī vṛṣabhāṇyāyudhā vṛṣṇo madasya vṛṣabha tvamīśiṣa indra somasya vṛṣabhasya tṛpṇuhi

translations.griffith: Strong is thy thunderbolt, yea, and thy car is strong; strong are thy Bay Steeds and thy weapons powerful.  Thou, Indra, Bull, art Lord of the strong gladdening drink. with the strong Soma, Indra, satisfy thyself.

verses.sanskrit: पर ते नावं न समने वचस्युवं बरह्मणा यामि सवनेषुदाध्र्षिः कुविन नो अस्य वचसो निबोधिषदिन्द्रमुत्सं न वसुनः सिचामहे |||
verses.transliteration: pra te nāvaṃ na samane vacasyuvaṃ brahmaṇā yāmi savaneṣudādhṛṣiḥ kuvin no asya vacaso nibodhiṣadindramutsaṃ na vasunaḥ sicāmahe

translations.griffith: I, bold by prayer, come near thee in thy sacred rites, thee like a saving ship, thee shouting in the war.  Verily he will hear and mark this word of ours: we will pour Indra forth as ’twere a spring of wealth.

verses.sanskrit: पुरा सम्बाधादभ्या वव्र्त्स्व नो धेनुर्न वत्सं यवसस्य पिप्युषी सक्र्त सु ते सुमतिभिः शतक्रतो सं पत्नीभिर्न वर्षणो नसीमहि |||
verses.transliteration: purā sambādhādabhyā vavṛtsva no dhenurna vatsaṃ yavasasya pipyuṣī sakṛt su te sumatibhiḥ śatakrato saṃ patnībhirna vṛṣaṇo nasīmahi

translations.griffith: Turn thee unto us ere calamity come nigh, as a cow full of pasture turns her to her calf.  Lord of a Hundred Powers, may we once firmly cling to thy fair favours even as husbands to their wives.

verses.transliteration: nūnaṃ sā ...

translations.griffith: Now let that wealthy Cow of thine, O Indra, yield in return a boon to him who lauds thee.  Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

verses.sanskrit: तदस्मै नव्यमङगिरस्वदर्चत शुष्मा यदस्य परत्नथोदीरते विश्वा यद गोत्रा सहसा परीव्र्ता मदे सोमस्य दरंहितान्यैरयत |||
verses.transliteration: tadasmai navyamaṅghirasvadarcata śuṣmā yadasya pratnathodīrate viśvā yad ghotrā sahasā parīvṛtā made somasya dṛṃhitānyairayat

translations.griffith: LIKE the Aṅgirases, sing this new song forth to him, for, as in ancient days, his mighty powers are shown,  When in the rapture of the Soma he unclosed with strength the solid firm-shut stables of the kine.

verses.sanskrit: स भुतु यो ह परथमाय धायस ओजो मिमानो महिमानमातिरत शूरो यो युत्सु तन्वं परिव्यत शीर्षणि दयां महिना परत्यमुञ्चत |||
verses.transliteration: sa bhutu yo ha prathamāya dhāyasa ojo mimāno mahimānamātirat śūro yo yutsu tanvaṃ parivyata śīrṣaṇi dyāṃ mahinā pratyamuñcata

translations.griffith: Let him be even that God who, for the earliest draught measuring out his power, increased his majesty;  Hero who fortified his body in the wars, and through his greatness set the heaven upon his head.

verses.sanskrit: अधाक्र्णोः परथमं वीर्यं महद यदस्याग्रे बरह्मणा शुष्ममैरयः रथेष्ठेन हर्यश्वेन विच्युताः पर जीरयः सिस्रते सध्र्यक पर्थक |||
verses.transliteration: adhākṛṇoḥ prathamaṃ vīryaṃ mahad yadasyāghre brahmaṇā śuṣmamairayaḥ ratheṣṭhena haryaśvena vicyutāḥ pra jīrayaḥ sisrate sadhryak pṛthak

translations.griffith: Thou didst perform thy first great deed of hero might what time thou showedst power, through prayer, before this folk.  Hurled down by thee the car-borne Lord of Tawny Steeds, the congregated swift ones fled in sundry ways.

verses.sanskrit: अधा यो विश्वा भुवनाभि मज्मनेशानक्र्त परवया अभ्यवर्धत आद रोदसी जयोतिषा वह्निरातनोत सीव्यन तमांसि दुधिता समव्ययत |||
verses.transliteration: adhā yo viśvā bhuvanābhi majmaneśānakṛt pravayā abhyavardhata ād rodasī jyotiṣā vahnirātanot sīvyan tamāṃsi dudhitā samavyayat

translations.griffith: He made himself by might Lord of all living things, and strong in vital power waxed great above them all.  He, borne on high, o’erspread with light the heaven and earth, and, sewing up the turbid darkness, closed it in.

verses.sanskrit: स पराचीनान पर्वतान दरंहदोजसाधराचीनमक्र्णोदपामपः अधारयत पर्थिवीं विश्वधायसमस्तभ्नान मायया दयामवस्रसः |||
verses.transliteration: sa prācīnān parvatān dṛṃhadojasādharācīnamakṛṇodapāmapaḥ adhārayat pṛthivīṃ viśvadhāyasamastabhnān māyayā dyāmavasrasaḥ

translations.griffith: He with his might made firm the forward-bending hills, the downward rushing of the waters he ordained.  Fast he upheld the earth that nourisheth all life, and stayed the heaven from falling by his wondrous skill.

verses.sanskrit: सास्मा अरं बाहुभ्यां यं पिताक्र्णोद विश्वस्मादा जनुषो वेदसस परि येना पर्थिव्यां नि करिविं शयध्यै वज्रेण हत्व्यव्र्णक तुविष्वणिः |||
verses.transliteration: sāsmā araṃ bāhubhyāṃ yaṃ pitākṛṇod viśvasmādā januṣo vedasas pari yenā pṛthivyāṃ ni kriviṃ śayadhyai vajreṇa hatvyavṛṇak tuviṣvaṇiḥ

translations.griffith: Fit for the grasping of his arms is what the Sire hath fabricated from all kind of precious wealth.  The thunderbolt, wherewith, loud-roaring, he smote down, and striking him to death laid Krivi on the earth.

verses.sanskrit: अमाजूरिव पित्रोः सचा सती समानादा सदसस्त्वामिये भगम कर्धि परकेतमुप मास्या भर दद्धि भागं तन्वो येन मामहः |||
verses.transliteration: amājūriva pitroḥ sacā satī samānādā sadasastvāmiye bhagham kṛdhi praketamupa māsyā bhara daddhi bhāghaṃ tanvo yena māmahaḥ
