translations.griffith: As she who in her parents' house is growing old, I pray to thee as Bhaga from the seat of all.  Grant knowledge, mete it out and bring it to us here: give us the share wherewith thou makest people glad.

verses.sanskrit: भोजं तवामिन्द्र वयं हुवेम ददिष टवमिन्द्रापांसि वाजान अविड्ढीन्द्र चित्रया न ऊति कर्धि वर्शन्निन्द्र वस्यसो नः |||
verses.transliteration: bhojaṃ tvāmindra vayaṃ huvema dadiṣ ṭvamindrāpāṃsi vājān aviḍḍhīndra citrayā na ūti kṛdhi vṛśannindra vasyaso naḥ

translations.griffith: May we invoke thee as a liberal giver thou givest us, O Indra, strength and labours.  Help us with manifold assistance, Indra:  Mighty  One, Indra, make us yet more wealthy.

verses.transliteration: nūnaṃ sā ...

translations.griffith: Now may that wealthy Cow of thine, O Indra, give in return a boon to him who lauds thee.  Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

verses.sanskrit: पराता रथो नवो योजि सस्निश्चतुर्युगस्त्रिकशः सप्तरश्मिः दशारित्रो मनुष्यः सवर्षाः स इष्टिभिर्मतिभीरंह्यो भूत |||
verses.transliteration: prātā ratho navo yoji sasniścaturyughastrikaśaḥ saptaraśmiḥ daśāritro manuṣyaḥ svarṣāḥ sa iṣṭibhirmatibhīraṃhyo bhūt

translations.griffith: THE rich new car hath been equipped at morning; four yokes it hath, three whips, seven reins to guide it:  Ten-sided, friendly to mankind, light-winner, that must be urged to speed with prayers and wishes.

verses.sanskrit: सास्मा अरं परथमं स दवितीयमुतो तर्तीयं मनुषः स होता अन्यस्या गर्भमन्य ऊ जनन्त सो अन्येभिः सचते जेन्यो वर्षा |||
verses.transliteration: sāsmā araṃ prathamaṃ sa dvitīyamuto tṛtīyaṃ manuṣaḥ sa hotā anyasyā gharbhamanya ū jananta so anyebhiḥ sacate jenyo vṛṣā

translations.griffith: This is prepared for him the first, the second, and the third time: he is man's Priest and Herald.  Others get offspring of another parent he goeth, as a noble Bull, with others.

verses.sanskrit: हरी नु कं रथ इन्द्रस्य योजमायै सूक्तेन वचसा नवेन मो षु तवामत्र बहवो हि विप्रा नि रीरमन यजमानासो अन्ये |||
verses.transliteration: harī nu kaṃ ratha indrasya yojamāyai sūktena vacasā navena mo ṣu tvāmatra bahavo hi viprā ni rīraman yajamānāso anye

translations.griffith: To Indra's car the Bay Steeds have I harnessed, that new well-spoken words may bring him hither.  Here let not other worshippers detain thee, for among us are many holy singers.

verses.sanskrit: आ दवाभ्यां हरिभ्यामिन्द्र याह्या चतुर्भिरा षड्भिर्हूयमानः आष्टाभिर्दशभिः सोमपेयमयं सुतःसुमख मा मर्धस कः |||
verses.transliteration: ā dvābhyāṃ haribhyāmindra yāhyā caturbhirā ṣaḍbhirhūyamānaḥ āṣṭābhirdaśabhiḥ somapeyamayaṃ sutaḥsumakha mā mṛdhas kaḥ

translations.griffith: Indra, come hitherward with two Bay Coursers, come thou with four, with six when invocated.  Come thou with eight, with ten, to drink the Soma. Here is the juice, brave Warrior: do not scorn it.

verses.sanskrit: आ विंशत्या तरिंशता याह्यर्वां आ चत्वारिंशता हरिभिर्यजानः आ पञ्चाशता सुरथेभिरिन्द्रा षष्ट्या सप्तत्या सोमपेयम |||
verses.transliteration: ā viṃśatyā triṃśatā yāhyarvāṃ ā catvāriṃśatā haribhiryajānaḥ ā pañcāśatā surathebhirindrā ṣaṣṭyā saptatyā somapeyam

translations.griffith: O Indra, come thou hither having harnessed thy car with twenty, thirty, forty horses.  Come thou with fifty well trained coursers, Indra, sixty or seventy, to drink the Soma.

verses.sanskrit: आशीत्या नवत्या याह्यर्वां आ शतेन हरिभिरुह्यमानः अयं हि ते शुनहोत्रेषु सोम इन्द्र तवाया परिषिक्तो मदाय |||
verses.transliteration: āśītyā navatyā yāhyarvāṃ ā śatena haribhiruhyamānaḥ ayaṃ hi te śunahotreṣu soma indra tvāyā pariṣikto madāya

translations.griffith: Come to us hitherward, O Indra, carried by eighty, ninety, or an hundred horses.  This Soma juice among the Śunahotras hath been poured out, in love, to glad thee, Indra.

verses.sanskrit: मम बरह्मेन्द्र याह्यछा विश्वा हरी धुरि धिष्वा रथस्य पुरुत्रा हि विहव्यो बभूथास्मिञ्छूर सवने मादयस्व |||
verses.transliteration: mama brahmendra yāhyachā viśvā harī dhuri dhiṣvā rathasya purutrā hi vihavyo babhūthāsmiñchūra savane mādayasva

translations.griffith: To this my prayer, O Indra, come thou hither: bind to thy car's pole all thy two Bay Coursers.  Thou art to be invoked in many places Hero, rejoice thyself in this libation.

verses.sanskrit: न म इन्द्रेण सख्यं वि योषदस्मभ्यमस्य दक्षिणा दुहीत उप जयेष्ठे वरूथे गभस्तौ पराये-पराये जिगीवांसः सयाम |||
verses.transliteration: na ma indreṇa sakhyaṃ vi yoṣadasmabhyamasya dakṣiṇā duhīta upa jyeṣṭhe varūthe ghabhastau prāye-prāye jighīvāṃsaḥ syāma

translations.griffith: Ne’er be my love from Indra disunited still may his liberal Milch-cow yield us treasure.  So may we under his supreme protection, safe in his arms, succeed in each forth-going.

verses.transliteration: nūnaṃ sā ...

translations.griffith: Now may that wealthy Cow Of thine, O Indra, give in return a boon to him who lauds thee.  Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

verses.sanskrit: अपाय्यस्यान्धसो मदाय मनीषिणः सुवानस्य परयसः यस्मिन्निन्द्रः परदिवि वाव्र्धान ओको दधे बरह्मण्यन्तश्च नरः |||
verses.transliteration: apāyyasyāndhaso madāya manīṣiṇaḥ suvānasya prayasaḥ yasminnindraḥ pradivi vāvṛdhāna oko dadhe brahmaṇyantaśca naraḥ

translations.griffith: DRAUGHTS of this sweet juice have been drunk for rapture, of the wise Soma-presser's offered dainty,  Wherein, grown mighty in the days aforetime, Indra hath found delight, and men who worship.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य मन्दानो मध्वो वज्रहस्तो.अहिमिन्द्रो अर्णोव्र्तं वि वर्श्चत पर यद वयो स सवसराण्यछा परयांसि च नदीनां चक्रमन्त |||
verses.transliteration: asya mandāno madhvo vajrahasto.ahimindro arṇovṛtaṃ vi vṛścat pra yad vayo sa svasarāṇyachā prayāṃsi ca nadīnāṃ cakramanta

translations.griffith: Cheered by this meath Indra, whose hand wields thunder, rent piecemeal Ahi who barred up the waters,  So that the quickening currents of the rivers flowed forth like birds unto their resting-places.

verses.sanskrit: स माहिन इन्द्रो अर्णो अपां परैरयदहिहाछा समुद्रम अजनयत सूर्यं विदद गा अक्तुनाह्नां वयुनानि साधत |||
verses.transliteration: sa māhina indro arṇo apāṃ prairayadahihāchā samudram ajanayat sūryaṃ vidad ghā aktunāhnāṃ vayunāni sādhat

translations.griffith: Indra, this Mighty One, the Dragon's slayer, sent forth the flood of waters to the ocean.  He gave the Sun his life, he found the cattle, and with the night the works of days completed.

verses.sanskrit: सो अप्रतीनि मनवे पुरूणीन्द्रो दाशद दाशुषे हन्ति वर्त्रम सद्यो यो नर्भ्यो अतसाय्यो भूत पस्प्र्धानेभ्यः सूर्यस्य सातौ |||
verses.transliteration: so apratīni manave purūṇīndro dāśad dāśuṣe hanti vṛtram sadyo yo nṛbhyo atasāyyo bhūt paspṛdhānebhyaḥ sūryasya sātau

translations.griffith: To him who worshippeth hath Indra given many and matchless gifts. He slayeth Vṛtra.  Straight was he to be sought with supplications by men who struggled to obtain the sunlight.

verses.sanskrit: स सुन्वत इन्द्रः सूर्यमा देवो रिणं मर्त्याय सतवान आ यद रयिं गुहदवद्यमस्मै भरदंशं नैतशो दशस्यन |||
verses.transliteration: sa sunvata indraḥ sūryamā devo riṇaṃ martyāya stavān ā yad rayiṃ ghuhadavadyamasmai bharadaṃśaṃ naitaśo daśasyan

translations.griffith: To him who poured him gifts he gave up Sūrya,—Indra, the God, the Mighty, to the mortal;  For Etaśa with worship brought him riches that keep distress afar, as ’twere his portion.

verses.sanskrit: स रन्धयत सदिवः सारथये शुष्णमशुषं कुयवं कुत्साय दिवोदासाय नवतिं च नवेन्द्रः पुरो वयैरच्छम्बरस्य |||
verses.transliteration: sa randhayat sadivaḥ sārathaye śuṣṇamaśuṣaṃ kuyavaṃ kutsāya divodāsāya navatiṃ ca navendraḥ puro vyairacchambarasya

translations.griffith: Once to the driver of his chariot, Kutsa, he gave up greedy Sūrya, plague of harvest;  And Indra, for the sake of Divodāsa demolished Śambara's nine-and-ninety castles.

verses.sanskrit: एवा त इन्द्रोचथमहेम शरवस्या न तमना वाजयन्तः अश्याम तत साप्तमाशुषाणा ननमो वधरदेवस्य पीयोः |||
verses.transliteration: evā ta indrocathamahema śravasyā na tmanā vājayantaḥ aśyāma tat sāptamāśuṣāṇā nanamo vadharadevasya pīyoḥ

translations.griffith: So have we brought our hymn to thee, O Indra, strengthening thee and fain ourselves for glory.  May we with best endeavours gain this friendship, and mayst thou bend the godless scorner's weapons.

verses.sanskrit: एवा ते गर्त्समदाः शूर मम्नावस्यवो न वयुनानि तक्षुः बरह्मण्यन्त इन्द्र ते नवीय इषमूर्जं सुक्षितिं सुम्नमश्युः |||
verses.transliteration: evā te ghṛtsamadāḥ śūra mamnāvasyavo na vayunāni takṣuḥ brahmaṇyanta indra te navīya iṣamūrjaṃ sukṣitiṃ sumnamaśyuḥ

translations.griffith: Thus the Gṛtsamadas for thee, O Hero, have wrought their hymn and task as seeking favour.  May they who worship thee afresh, O Indra, gain food and strength, bliss, and a happy dwelling.

verses.transliteration: nūnaṃ sā ...

translations.griffith: Now may that wealthy Cow of thine, O Indra, give in return a boon to him who lauds thee,  Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

verses.sanskrit: वयं ते वय इन्द्र विद्धि षु णः पर भरामहे वाजयुर्न रथम विपन्यवो दीध्यतो मनीषा सुम्नमियक्षन्तस्त्वावतो नॄन |||
verses.transliteration: vayaṃ te vaya indra viddhi ṣu ṇaḥ pra bharāmahe vājayurna ratham vipanyavo dīdhyato manīṣā sumnamiyakṣantastvāvato nṝn

translations.griffith: As one brings forth his car when fain for combat, so bring we power to thee—regard us, Indra—  Well skilled in song, thoughtful in spirit, seeking great bliss from one like thee amid the Heroes.

verses.sanskrit: तवं न इन्द्र तवाभिरूती तवायतो अभिष्टिपासि जनान तवमिनो दाशुषो वरूतेत्थाधीरभि यो नक्षति तवा |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ na indra tvābhirūtī tvāyato abhiṣṭipāsi janān tvamino dāśuṣo varūtetthādhīrabhi yo nakṣati tvā

translations.griffith: Indra, thou art our own with thy protection, a guardian near to men who love thee truly,  Active art thou, the liberal man's defender, his who draws near to thee with right devotion.

verses.sanskrit: स नो युवेन्द्रो जोहूत्रः सखा शिवो नरामस्तु पाता यः शंसन्तं यः शशमानमूती पचन्तं च सतुवन्तंच परणेषत |||
verses.transliteration: sa no yuvendro johūtraḥ sakhā śivo narāmastu pātā yaḥ śaṃsantaṃ yaḥ śaśamānamūtī pacantaṃ ca stuvantaṃca praṇeṣat

translations.griffith: May Indra, called with solemn invocations. the young, the Friend, be men's auspicious keeper,  One who will further with his aid the singer, the toiler, praiser, dresser of oblations.

verses.sanskrit: तमु सतुष इन्द्रं तं गर्णीषे यस्मिन पुरा वाव्र्धुः शाशदुश्च स वस्वः कामं पीपरदियानो बरह्मण्यतो नूतनस्यायोः |||
verses.transliteration: tamu stuṣa indraṃ taṃ ghṛṇīṣe yasmin purā vāvṛdhuḥ śāśaduśca sa vasvaḥ kāmaṃ pīparadiyāno brahmaṇyato nūtanasyāyoḥ

translations.griffith: With laud and song let me extol that Indra in whom of old men prospered and were mighty.  May he, implored, fulfil the prayer for plenty of him who worships, of the living mortal.

verses.sanskrit: सो अङगिरसामुचथा जुजुष्वान बरह्मा तूतोदिन्द्रो गातुमिष्णन मुष्णन्नुषसः सूर्येण सतवानश्नस्य चिच्छिश्नथत पूर्व्याणि |||
verses.transliteration: so aṅghirasāmucathā jujuṣvān brahmā tūtodindro ghātumiṣṇan muṣṇannuṣasaḥ sūryeṇa stavānaśnasya cicchiśnathat pūrvyāṇi

translations.griffith: He, Indra whom the Aṅgirases' praise delighted, strengthened their prayer and made their goings prosper.  Stealing away the mornings with the sunlight, he, lauded, crushed even Aśna's ancient powers.

verses.sanskrit: स ह शरुत इन्द्रो नाम देव ऊर्ध्वो भुवन मनुषे दस्मतमः अव परियमर्शसानस्य साह्वाञ्छिरो भरद दासस्य सवधावान |||
verses.transliteration: sa ha śruta indro nāma deva ūrdhvo bhuvan manuṣe dasmatamaḥ ava priyamarśasānasya sāhvāñchiro bharad dāsasya svadhāvān

translations.griffith: He verily, the God, the glorious Indra, hath raised him up for man, best Wonder-Worker.  He, self-reliant, mighty and triumphant, brought low the dear head of the wicked Dāsa.

verses.sanskrit: स वर्त्रहेन्द्रः कर्ष्णयोनीः पुरन्दरो दासीरैरयद वि अजनयन मनवे कषामपश्च सत्रा शंसं यजमानस्य तूतोत |||
verses.transliteration: sa vṛtrahendraḥ kṛṣṇayonīḥ purandaro dāsīrairayad vi ajanayan manave kṣāmapaśca satrā śaṃsaṃ yajamānasya tūtot

translations.griffith: Indra the Vṛtra-slayer, Fort-destroyer, scattered the Dāsa hosts who dwelt in darkness.  For men hath he created earth and waters, and ever helped the prayer of him who worships.

verses.sanskrit: तस्मै तवस्यमनु दायि सत्रेन्द्राय देवेभिरर्णसातौ परति यदस्य वज्रं बाह्वोर्धुर्हत्वी दस्यून पुर आयसीर्नि तारीत |||
verses.transliteration: tasmai tavasyamanu dāyi satrendrāya devebhirarṇasātau prati yadasya vajraṃ bāhvordhurhatvī dasyūn pura āyasīrni tārīt

translations.griffith: To him in might the Gods have ever yielded, to Indra in the tumult of the battle.  When in his arms they laid the bolt, he slaughtered the Dasyus and cast down their forts of iron.

verses.transliteration: nūnaṃ sā ...

translations.griffith: Now may that wealthy Cow of thine, O Indra, give in return a boon to him who lauds thee.  Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वजिते धनजिते सवर्जिते सत्राजिते नर्जित उर्वराजिते अश्वजिते गोजिते अब्जिते भरेन्द्राय सोमं यजताय हर्यतम |||
verses.transliteration: viśvajite dhanajite svarjite satrājite nṛjita urvarājite aśvajite ghojite abjite bharendrāya somaṃ yajatāya haryatam

translations.griffith: To him the Lord of all, the Lord of wealth, of light; him who is Lord for ever, Lord of men and tilth,  Him who is Lord of horses, Lord of kine, of floods, to Indra, to the Holy bring sweet Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: अभिभुवे.अभिभङगाय वन्वते.अषाळ्हाय सहमानाय वेधसे तुविग्रये वह्नये दुष्टरीतवे सत्रासाहे नम इन्द्राय वोचत |||
verses.transliteration: abhibhuve.abhibhaṅghāya vanvate.aṣāḷhāya sahamānāya vedhase tuvighraye vahnaye duṣṭarītave satrāsāhe nama indrāya vocata

translations.griffith: To him the potent One, who conquers and breaks down, the Victor never vanquished who disposes all,  The mighty-voiced, the rider, unassailable, to Indra everconquering speak your reverent prayer.

verses.sanskrit: सत्रासाहो जनभक्षो जनंसहश्च्यवनो युध्मो अनु जोषमुक्षितः वर्तंचयः सहुरिर्विक्ष्वारित इन्द्रस्य वोचं पर कर्तानि वीर्या |||
verses.transliteration: satrāsāho janabhakṣo janaṃsahaścyavano yudhmo anu joṣamukṣitaḥ vṛtaṃcayaḥ sahurirvikṣvārita indrasya vocaṃ pra kṛtāni vīryā

translations.griffith: Still Victor, loved by mortals, ruler over men, o’erthrower, warrior, he hath waxen as he would;  Host-gatherer, triumphant, honoured mid the folk. Indra's heroic deeds will I tell forth to all.

verses.sanskrit: अनानुदो वर्षभो दोधतो वधो गम्भीर रष्वो असमष्टकाव्यः रध्रचोदः शनथनो वीळितस पर्थुरिन्द्रः सुयज्ञ उषसः सवर्जनत |||
verses.transliteration: anānudo vṛṣabho dodhato vadho ghambhīra ṛṣvo asamaṣṭakāvyaḥ radhracodaḥ śnathano vīḷitas pṛthurindraḥ suyajña uṣasaḥ svarjanat

translations.griffith: The strong who never yields, who slew the furious fiend, the deep, the vast, of wisdom unattainable;  Who speeds the good, the breaker-down, the firm, the vast,—Indra whose rites bring joy hath made the light of Dawn.

verses.sanskrit: यज्णेन गातुमप्तुरो विविद्रिरे धियो हिन्वाना उशिजो मनीषिणः अभिस्वरा निषदा गा अवस्यव इन्द्रे हिन्वाना दरविणान्याशत |||
verses.transliteration: yajṇena ghātumapturo vividrire dhiyo hinvānā uśijo manīṣiṇaḥ abhisvarā niṣadā ghā avasyava indre hinvānā draviṇānyāśata

translations.griffith: By sacrifice the yearning sages sending forth their songs found furtherance from him who speeds the flood.  In Indra seeking help with worship and with hymn, they drew him to themselves and won them kine and wealth.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र शरेष्ठानि दरविणानि धेहि चित्तिं दक्षस्य सुभगत्वं अस्मे पोषं रयीणामरिष्टिं तनूनां सवाद्मानं वाचः सुदिनत्वमह्नाम |||
verses.transliteration: indra śreṣṭhāni draviṇāni dhehi cittiṃ dakṣasya subhaghatvaṃ asme poṣaṃ rayīṇāmariṣṭiṃ tanūnāṃ svādmānaṃ vācaḥ sudinatvamahnām

translations.griffith: Indra, bestow on us the best of treasures, the spirit of ability and fortune;  Increase of riches, safety of our bodies, charm of sweet speech, and days of pleasant weather.

verses.sanskrit: तरिकद्रुकेषु महिषो यवाशिरं तुविशुष्मस्त्र्पत सोममपिबद विष्णुना सुतं यथावशत स ईं ममाद महि कर्म कर्तवे महामुरुं सैनं सश्चद देवो देवं सत्यमिन्द्रंसत्य इन्दुः |||
verses.transliteration: trikadrukeṣu mahiṣo yavāśiraṃ tuviśuṣmastṛpat somamapibad viṣṇunā sutaṃ yathāvaśat sa īṃ mamāda mahi karma kartave mahāmuruṃ sainaṃ saścad devo devaṃ satyamindraṃsatya induḥ

translations.griffith: At the Trikadrukas the Great and Strong hath drunk drink blent with meal. With Viṣṇu hath he quaffed the poured out Soma juice, all that he would.  That hath so heightened him the Great, the Wide, to do his mighty work.  So may the God attain the God, true Indu Indra who is true.

verses.sanskrit: अध तविषीमानभ्योजसा करिविं युधाभवदा रोदसी अप्र्णदस्य मज्मना पर वाव्र्धे अधत्तान्यं जठरे परेमरिच्यत सैनं ... |||
verses.transliteration: adha tviṣīmānabhyojasā kriviṃ yudhābhavadā rodasī apṛṇadasya majmanā pra vāvṛdhe adhattānyaṃ jaṭhare premaricyata sainaṃ ...

translations.griffith: So he resplendent in the battle overcame Krivi by might. He with his majesty hath filled the earth and heaven, and waxen strong.  One share of the libation hath he swallowed down: one share he left.  So may the God attend the God, true Indu Indra who is true.

verses.sanskrit: साकं जातः करतुना साकमोजसा ववक्षिथ साकं वर्द्धो वीर्यैः सासहिर्म्र्धो विचर्षणिः दाता राधः सतुवते काम्यं वसु सैनं ... |||
verses.transliteration: sākaṃ jātaḥ kratunā sākamojasā vavakṣitha sākaṃ vṛddho vīryaiḥ sāsahirmṛdho vicarṣaṇiḥ dātā rādhaḥ stuvate kāmyaṃ vasu sainaṃ ...

translations.griffith: Brought forth together with wisdom and mighty power thou grewest great; with hero deeds subduing the malevolent, most swift in act;  Giving prosperity, and lovely wealth to him who praiseth thee. So may the God attend the God, true Indu Indra who is true.

verses.sanskrit: तव तयन नर्यं नर्तो.अप इन्द्र परथमं पूर्व्यं दिवि परवाच्यं कर्तम यद देवस्य शवसा परारिणा असुं रिणन्नपः भुवद विश्वमभ्यादेवमोजसा विदादूर्जं शतक्रतुर्विदादिषम || ||
verses.transliteration: tava tyan naryaṃ nṛto.apa indra prathamaṃ pūrvyaṃ divi pravācyaṃ kṛtam yad devasya śavasā prāriṇā asuṃ riṇannapaḥ bhuvad viśvamabhyādevamojasā vidādūrjaṃ śatakraturvidādiṣam

translations.griffith: This, Indra, was thy hero deed, Dancer, thy first and ancient work, worthy to be told forth in heaven,  What time thou sentest down life with a God's own power, freeing the floods.  All that is godless may he conquer with his might, and, Lord of Hundred Powers, find for us strength and food.

verses.sanskrit: गणानां तवा गणपतिं हवामहे कविं कवीनामुपमश्रवस्तमम जयेष्ठराजं बरह्मणां बरह्मणस पत आ नः षर्ण्वन्नूतिभिः सीद सादनम |||
verses.transliteration: ghaṇānāṃ tvā ghaṇapatiṃ havāmahe kaviṃ kavīnāmupamaśravastamam jyeṣṭharājaṃ brahmaṇāṃ brahmaṇas pata ā naḥ ṣṛṇvannūtibhiḥ sīda sādanam

translations.griffith: WE call thee, Lord and Leader of the heavenly hosts, the wise among the wise, the famousest of all,  The King supreme of prayers, O Brahmaṇaspati: hear us with help; sit down in place of sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: देवाश्चित ते असुर्य परचेतसो बर्हस्पते यज्ञियं भागमानशुः उस्रा इव सूर्यो जयोतिषा महो विश्वेषामिज्जनिता बरह्मणामसि |||
verses.transliteration: devāścit te asurya pracetaso bṛhaspate yajñiyaṃ bhāghamānaśuḥ usrā iva sūryo jyotiṣā maho viśveṣāmijjanitā brahmaṇāmasi

translations.griffith: Bṛhaspati, God immortal! verily the Gods have gained from thee, the wise, a share in holy rites.  As with great light the Sun brings forth the rays of morn, so thou alone art Father of all sacred prayer.

verses.sanskrit: आ विबाध्या परिरापस्तमांसि च जयोतिष्मन्तं रथं रतस्य तिष्ठसि बर्हस्पते भीमममित्रदम्भनं रक्षोहणंगोत्रभिदं सवर्विदम |||
verses.transliteration: ā vibādhyā parirāpastamāṃsi ca jyotiṣmantaṃ rathaṃ ṛtasya tiṣṭhasi bṛhaspate bhīmamamitradambhanaṃ rakṣohaṇaṃghotrabhidaṃ svarvidam

translations.griffith: When thou hast chased away revilers and the gloom, thou mountest the refulgent car of sacrifice;  The awful car, Bṛhaspati, that quells the foe, slays demons, cleaves the stall of kine, and finds the light.

verses.sanskrit: सुनीतिभिर्नयसि तरायसे जनं यस्तुभ्यं दाशान न तमंहो अश्नवत बरह्मद्विषस्तपनो मन्युमीरसि बर्हस्पते महि तत ते महित्वनम |||
verses.transliteration: sunītibhirnayasi trāyase janaṃ yastubhyaṃ dāśān na tamaṃho aśnavat brahmadviṣastapano manyumīrasi bṛhaspate mahi tat te mahitvanam

translations.griffith: Thou leadest with good guidance and preservest men; distress o’ertakes not him who offers gifts to thee.  Him who hates prayer thou punishest, Bṛhaspati, quelling his wrath: herein is thy great mightiness.

verses.sanskrit: न तमंहो न दुरितं कुतश्चन नारातयस्तितिरुर्न दवयाविनः विश्वा इदस्माद धवरसो वि बाधसे यं सुगोपा रक्षसि बरह्मणस पते |||
verses.transliteration: na tamaṃho na duritaṃ kutaścana nārātayastitirurna dvayāvinaḥ viśvā idasmād dhvaraso vi bādhase yaṃ sughopā rakṣasi brahmaṇas pate

translations.griffith: No sorrow, no distress from any side, no foes, no creatures double-tongued have overcome the man,—  Thou drivest all seductive fiends away from him whom, careful guard, thou keepest Brahmaṇaspati.

verses.sanskrit: तवं नो गोपाः पथिक्र्द विचक्षणस्तव वरताय मतिभिर्जरामहे बर्हस्पते यो नो अभि हवरो दधे सवा तं मर्मर्तु दुछुना हरस्वती |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ no ghopāḥ pathikṛd vicakṣaṇastava vratāya matibhirjarāmahe bṛhaspate yo no abhi hvaro dadhe svā taṃ marmartu duchunā harasvatī

translations.griffith: Thou art our keeper, wise, preparer of our paths: we, for thy service, sing to thee with hymns of praise.  Bṛhaspati, whoever lays a snare for us, him may his evil fate, precipitate, destroy.

verses.sanskrit: उत वा यो नो मर्चयादनागसो.अरातीवा मर्तः सानुको वर्कः बर्हस्पते अप तं वर्तया पथः सुगं नो अस्यै देववीतये कर्धि |||
verses.transliteration: uta vā yo no marcayādanāghaso.arātīvā martaḥ sānuko vṛkaḥ bṛhaspate apa taṃ vartayā pathaḥ sughaṃ no asyai devavītaye kṛdhi

translations.griffith: Him, too, who threatens us without offence of ours, the evilminded, arrogant, rapacious man,—  Him turn thou from our path away, Bṛhaspati: give us fair access to this banquet of the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: तरातारं तवा तनूनां हवामहे.अवस्पर्तरधिवक्तारमस्मयुम बर्हस्पते देवनिदो नि बर्हय मा दुरेवा उत्तरं सुम्नमुन नशन |||
verses.transliteration: trātāraṃ tvā tanūnāṃ havāmahe.avaspartaradhivaktāramasmayum bṛhaspate devanido ni barhaya mā durevā uttaraṃ sumnamun naśan

translations.griffith: Thee as protector of our bodies we invoke, thee, saviour, as the comforter who loveth us.  Strike, O Bṛhaspati, the Gods’ revilers down, and let not the unrighteous come to highest bliss.

verses.sanskrit: तवया वयं सुव्र्धा बरह्मणस पते सपार्हा वसु मनुष्या ददीमहि या नो दूरे तळितो या अरातयो.अभि सन्ति जम्भया ता अनप्नसः |||
verses.transliteration: tvayā vayaṃ suvṛdhā brahmaṇas pate spārhā vasu manuṣyā dadīmahi yā no dūre taḷito yā arātayo.abhi santi jambhayā tā anapnasaḥ

translations.griffith: Through thee, kind prosperer, O Brahmaṇaspati, may we obtain the wealth of Men which all desire:  And all our enemies, who near or far away prevail against us, crush, and leave them destitute.

verses.sanskrit: तवया वयमुत्तमं धीमहे वयो बर्हस्पते पप्रिणा सस्निना युजा मा नो दुःशंसो अभिदिप्सुरीशत पर सुशंसा मतिभिस्तारिषीमहि |||
verses.transliteration: tvayā vayamuttamaṃ dhīmahe vayo bṛhaspate papriṇā sasninā yujā mā no duḥśaṃso abhidipsurīśata pra suśaṃsā matibhistāriṣīmahi

translations.griffith: With thee as our own rich and liberal ally may we, Bṛhaspati, gain highest power of life.  Let not the guileful wicked man be lord of us:—still may we prosper, singing goodly hymns of praise.

verses.sanskrit: अनानुदो वर्षभो जग्मिराहवं निष्टप्ता शत्रुं पर्तनासुसासहिः असि सत्य रणया बरह्मणस पत उग्रस्य चिद दमिता वीळुहर्षिणः |||
verses.transliteration: anānudo vṛṣabho jaghmirāhavaṃ niṣṭaptā śatruṃ pṛtanāsusāsahiḥ asi satya ṛṇayā brahmaṇas pata ughrasya cid damitā vīḷuharṣiṇaḥ

translations.griffith: Strong, never yielding, hastening to the battle-cry, consumer of the foe, victorious in the strife,  Thou art sin's true avenger, Brahmaṇaspati, who tamest e’en the fierce, the wildly passionate.

verses.sanskrit: अदेवेन मनसा यो रिशण्यति शासामुग्रो मन्यमानो जिघांसति बर्हस्पते म परणक तस्य नो वधो नि कर्म मन्युं दुरेवस्य शर्धतः |||
verses.transliteration: adevena manasā yo riśaṇyati śāsāmughro manyamāno jighāṃsati bṛhaspate ma praṇak tasya no vadho ni karma manyuṃ durevasya śardhataḥ

translations.griffith: Whoso with mind ungodly seeks to do us harm, who, deeming him a man of might mid lords, would slay,—  Let not his deadly blow reach us, Bṛhaspati; may we humiliate the strong ill-doer's wrath.

verses.sanskrit: भरेषु हव्यो नमसोपसद्यो गन्ता वाजेषु सनिता धनं धनम विश्वा इदर्यो अभिदिप्स्वो मर्धो बर्हस्पतिर्वि ववर्हा रथां इव |||
verses.transliteration: bhareṣu havyo namasopasadyo ghantā vājeṣu sanitā dhanaṃ dhanam viśvā idaryo abhidipsvo mṛdho bṛhaspatirvi vavarhā rathāṃ iva

translations.griffith: The mover mid the spoil, the winner of all wealth, to be invoked in fight and reverently adored,  Bṛhaspati hath overthrown like cars of war all wicked enemies who fain would injure us.

verses.sanskrit: तेजिष्थया तपनि रक्षसस्तप ये तवा निदे दधिरे दर्ष्टवीर्यम आविस्तत कर्ष्व यदसत त उक्थ्यं बर्हस्पते वि परिरापो अर्दय |||
verses.transliteration: tejiṣthayā tapani rakṣasastapa ye tvā nide dadhire dṛṣṭavīryam āvistat kṛṣva yadasat ta ukthyaṃ bṛhaspate vi parirāpo ardaya

translations.griffith: Burn up the demons with thy fiercest flaming brand, those who have scorned thee in thy manifested might.  Show forth that power that shall deserve the hymn of praise: destroy the evil speakers, O Bṛhaspati.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हस्पते अति यदर्यो अर्हाद दयुमद विभाति करतुमज्जनेषु यद दीदयच्छवस रतप्रजात तदस्मसु दरविणं धेहिचित्रम |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhaspate ati yadaryo arhād dyumad vibhāti kratumajjaneṣu yad dīdayacchavasa ṛtaprajāta tadasmasu draviṇaṃ dhehicitram

translations.griffith: Bṛhaspati, that which the foe deserves not which shines among the folk effectual, splendid,  That, Son of Law I which is with might refulgent-that treasure wonderful bestow thou on us.

verses.sanskrit: मा न सतेनेभ्यो ये अभि दरुहस पदे निरामिणो रिपवो.अन्नेषु जाग्र्धुः आ देवानामोहते वि वरयो हर्दि बर्हस्पते नपरः साम्नो विदुः |||
verses.transliteration: mā na stenebhyo ye abhi druhas pade nirāmiṇo ripavo.anneṣu jāghṛdhuḥ ā devānāmohate vi vrayo hṛdi bṛhaspate naparaḥ sāmno viduḥ

translations.griffith: Give us not up to those who, foes in ambuscade, are greedy for the wealth of him who sits at ease,  Who cherish in their heart abandonment of Gods. Bṛhaspati, no further rest shall they obtain.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वेभ्यो हि तवा भुवनेभ्यस परि तवष्टाजनत साम्नः साम्नः कविः स रणचिद रणया बरह्मणस पतिर्द्रुहो हन्ता मह रतस्य धर्तरि |||
verses.transliteration: viśvebhyo hi tvā bhuvanebhyas pari tvaṣṭājanat sāmnaḥ sāmnaḥ kaviḥ sa ṛṇacid ṛṇayā brahmaṇas patirdruho hantā maha ṛtasya dhartari

translations.griffith: For Tvaṣṭar, he who knows each sacred song, brought thee to life, preeminent o’er all the things that be.  Guilt-scourger, guilt-avenger is Bṛhaspati, who slays the spoiler and upholds the mighty Law.

verses.sanskrit: तव शरिये वयजिहीत पर्वतो गवां गोत्रमुदस्र्जो यदङगिरः इन्द्रेण युजा तमसा परीव्र्तं बर्हस्पते निरपामौब्जो अर्णवम |||
verses.transliteration: tava śriye vyajihīta parvato ghavāṃ ghotramudasṛjo yadaṅghiraḥ indreṇa yujā tamasā parīvṛtaṃ bṛhaspate nirapāmaubjo arṇavam

translations.griffith: The mountain, for thy glory, cleft itself apart when, Aṅgiras! thou openedst the stall of kine.  Thou, O Bṛhaspati, with Indra for ally didst hurl down water-floods which gloom had compassed round.

verses.sanskrit: बरह्मणस पते तवमस्य यन्ता सूक्तस्य बोधि तनयं च जिन्व विश्वं तद भद्रं यदवन्ति देवा बर्हद वदेम ... |||
verses.transliteration: brahmaṇas pate tvamasya yantā sūktasya bodhi tanayaṃ ca jinva viśvaṃ tad bhadraṃ yadavanti devā bṛhad vadema ...

translations.griffith: O Brahmaṇaspati, be thou controller of this our hymn and prosper thou our children.  All that the Gods regard with love is blessed. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

verses.sanskrit: सेमामविड्ढि परभ्र्तिं य ईशिषे.अया विधेम नवया महा गिरा यथा नो मीढ्वान सतवते सखा तव बर्हस्पतेसीषधः सोत नो मतिम |||
verses.transliteration: semāmaviḍḍhi prabhṛtiṃ ya īśiṣe.ayā vidhema navayā mahā ghirā yathā no mīḍhvān stavate sakhā tava bṛhaspatesīṣadhaḥ sota no matim

translations.griffith: BE pleased with this our offering, thou who art the Lord; we will adore thee with this new and mighty song.  As this thy friend, our liberal patron, praises thee, do thou, Bṛhaspati, fulfil our hearts' desire.

verses.sanskrit: यो नन्त्वान्यनमन नयोजसोतादर्दर्मन्युना शम्बराणि वि पराच्यावयदच्युता बरह्मणस पतिरा चाविशद वसुमन्तं वि पर्वतम |||
verses.transliteration: yo nantvānyanaman nyojasotādardarmanyunā śambarāṇi vi prācyāvayadacyutā brahmaṇas patirā cāviśad vasumantaṃ vi parvatam

translations.griffith: He who with might bowed down the things that should be bowed, and in his fury rent the holds of Śambara:  Who overthrew what shook not, Brahmaṇaspati,—he made his way within the mountain stored with wealth.

verses.sanskrit: तद देवानां देवतमाय कर्त्वमश्रथ्नन दर्ळ्हाव्रदन्त वीळिता उद गा आजदभिनद बरह्मणा वलमगूहत तमो वयचक्षयत सवः |||
verses.transliteration: tad devānāṃ devatamāya kartvamaśrathnan dṛḷhāvradanta vīḷitā ud ghā ājadabhinad brahmaṇā valamaghūhat tamo vyacakṣayat svaḥ

translations.griffith: That was a great deed for the Godliest of the Gods: strong things were loosened and the firmly fixed gave way.  He drave the kine forth and cleft Vala through by prayer, dispelled the darkness and displayed the light of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: अश्मास्यमवतं बरह्मणस पतिर्मधुधारमभि यमोजसात्र्णत तमेव विश्वे पपिरे सवर्द्र्शो बहु साकं सिसिचुरुत्समुद्रिणम |||
verses.transliteration: aśmāsyamavataṃ brahmaṇas patirmadhudhāramabhi yamojasātṛṇat tameva viśve papire svardṛśo bahu sākaṃ sisicurutsamudriṇam

translations.griffith: The well with mouth of stone that poured a flood of meath, which Brahmaṇaspati hath opened with his might—  All they who see the light have drunk their fill thereat: together they have made the watery fount flow forth.

verses.sanskrit: सना ता का चिद भुवना भवीत्वा माद्भिः शरद्भिर्दुरो वरन्त वः अयतन्ता चरतो अन्यद-अन्यदिद य चकार वयुना बरह्मणस पतिः |||
verses.transliteration: sanā tā kā cid bhuvanā bhavītvā mādbhiḥ śaradbhirduro varanta vaḥ ayatantā carato anyad-anyadid ya cakāra vayunā brahmaṇas patiḥ

translations.griffith: Ancient will be those creatures, whatsoe’er they be; with moons, with autumns, doors unclose themselves to you.  Effortless they pass on to perfect this and that, appointed works which Brahmaṇaspati ordained.

verses.sanskrit: अभिनक्षन्तो अभि ये तमानशुर्निधिं पणीनां परमंगुहा हितम ते विद्वांसः परतिचक्ष्यान्र्ता पुनर्यत उायन तदुदीयुराविशम |||
verses.transliteration: abhinakṣanto abhi ye tamānaśurnidhiṃ paṇīnāṃ paramaṃghuhā hitam te vidvāṃsaḥ praticakṣyānṛtā punaryata uāyan tadudīyurāviśam

translations.griffith: They who with much endeavour searching round obtained the Paṇis’ noblest treasure hidden in the cave,—  Those sages, having marked the falsehoods, turned them back whence they had come, and sought again to enter in.

verses.sanskrit: रतावानः परतिचक्ष्यान्र्ता पुनरात आ तस्थुः कवयो महस पथः ते बाहुभ्यां धमितमग्निमश्मनि नकिः षो अस्त्यरणो जहुर्हि तम |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtāvānaḥ praticakṣyānṛtā punarāta ā tasthuḥ kavayo mahas pathaḥ te bāhubhyāṃ dhamitamaghnimaśmani nakiḥ ṣo astyaraṇo jahurhi tam

translations.griffith: The pious ones when they had seen the falsehoods turned them back, the sages stood again upon the lofty ways.  Cast down with both their arms upon the rock they left the kindled fire, and said, No enemy is he.

verses.sanskrit: रतज्येन कषिप्रेण बरह्मणस पतिर्यत्र वष्टि पर तदश्नोति धन्वना तस्य साध्वीरिषवो याभिरस्यति नर्चक्षसो दर्शये कर्णयोनयः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtajyena kṣipreṇa brahmaṇas patiryatra vaṣṭi pra tadaśnoti dhanvanā tasya sādhvīriṣavo yābhirasyati nṛcakṣaso dṛśaye karṇayonayaḥ

translations.griffith: With his swift bow, strung truly, Brahmaṇaspati reaches the mark whate’er it be that he desires.  Excellent are the arrows wherewithal he shoots, keen-eyed to look on men and springing from his ear.

verses.sanskrit: स संनयः स विनयः पुरोहितः स सुष्टुतः स युधिब्रह्मणस पतिः चाक्ष्मो यद वाजं भरते मती धनादित सूर्यस्तपति तप्यतुर्व्र्था |||
verses.transliteration: sa saṃnayaḥ sa vinayaḥ purohitaḥ sa suṣṭutaḥ sa yudhibrahmaṇas patiḥ cākṣmo yad vājaṃ bharate matī dhanādit sūryastapati tapyaturvṛthā

translations.griffith: He brings together and he parts, the great High Priest; extolled is he, in battle Brahmaṇaspati.  When, gracious, for the hymn he brings forth food and wealth, the glowing Sun untroubled sends forth fervent heat.

verses.sanskrit: विभु परभु परथमं मेहनावतो बर्हस्पतेः सुविदत्राणि राध्या इमा सातानि वेन्यस्य वाजिनो येन जना उभये भुञ्जते विशः |||
verses.transliteration: vibhu prabhu prathamaṃ mehanāvato bṛhaspateḥ suvidatrāṇi rādhyā imā sātāni venyasya vājino yena janā ubhaye bhuñjate viśaḥ

translations.griffith: First and preeminent, excelling all besides are the kind gifts of liberal Bṛhaspati.  These are the boons of him the Strong who should be loved, whereby both classes and the people have delight.

verses.sanskrit: यो.अवरे वर्जने विश्वथा विभुर्महामु रण्वः शवसा ववक्षिथ स देवो देवान परति पप्रथे पर्थु विश्वेदु तापरिभूर्ब्रह्मणस पतिः |||
verses.transliteration: yo.avare vṛjane viśvathā vibhurmahāmu raṇvaḥ śavasā vavakṣitha sa devo devān prati paprathe pṛthu viśvedu tāparibhūrbrahmaṇas patiḥ

translations.griffith: Thou who in every way supreme in earthly power, rejoicing, by thy mighty strength hast waxen great,—  He is the God spread forth in breadth against the Gods: he, Brahmaṇaspati, encompasseth this All.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वं सत्यं मघवाना युवोरिदापश्चन पर मिनन्ति वरतं वाम अछेन्द्राब्रह्मणस्पती हविर्नो.अन्नं युजेव वाजिना जिगातम |||
verses.transliteration: viśvaṃ satyaṃ maghavānā yuvoridāpaścana pra minanti vrataṃ vām achendrābrahmaṇaspatī havirno.annaṃ yujeva vājinā jighātam

translations.griffith: From you, twain Maghavans, all truth proceedeth: even the waters break not your commandment.  Come to us, Brahmaṇaspati and Indra, to our oblation like yoked steeds to fodder.

verses.sanskrit: उताशिष्ठा अनु शर्ण्वन्ति वह्नयः सभेयो विप्रो भरते मती धना वीळुद्वेषा अनु वश रणमाददिः स ह वाजी समिथे बरह्मणस पतिः |||
verses.transliteration: utāśiṣṭhā anu śṛṇvanti vahnayaḥ sabheyo vipro bharate matī dhanā vīḷudveṣā anu vaśa ṛṇamādadiḥ sa ha vājī samithe brahmaṇas patiḥ

translations.griffith: The sacrificial flames most swiftly hear the call: the priest of the assembly gaineth wealth for hymns.  Hating the stern, remitting at his will the debt, strong in the shock of fight is Brahmaṇaspati.

verses.sanskrit: बरह्मणस पतेरभवद यथावशं सत्यो मन्युर्महि कर्माकरिष्यतः यो गा उदाजत स दिवे वि चाभजन महीव रीतिः शवसासरत पर्थक |||
verses.transliteration: brahmaṇas paterabhavad yathāvaśaṃ satyo manyurmahi karmākariṣyataḥ yo ghā udājat sa dive vi cābhajan mahīva rītiḥ śavasāsarat pṛthak

translations.griffith: The wrath of Brahmaṇaspati according to his will had full effect when he would do a mighty deed.  The kine he drave forth and distributed to heaven, even as a copious flood with strength flows sundry ways.

verses.sanskrit: बरह्मणस पते सुयमस्य विश्वहा रायः सयाम रथ्यो वयस्वतः वीरेषु वीरानुप परंधि नस्त्वं यदीशानो बरह्मणा वेषि मे हवम |||
verses.transliteration: brahmaṇas pate suyamasya viśvahā rāyaḥ syāma rathyo vayasvataḥ vīreṣu vīrānupa pṛṃdhi nastvaṃ yadīśāno brahmaṇā veṣi me havam

translations.griffith: O Brahmaṇaspati, may we be evermore masters of wealth well-guided, full of vital strength.  Heroes on heroes send abundantly to us, when thou omnipotent through prayer seekest my call.

verses.sanskrit: बरह्मणस पते तवमस्य ... ||
verses.transliteration: brahmaṇas pate tvamasya ...

translations.griffith: O Brahmaṇaspati, be thou controller of this our hymn, and prosper thou our children.  All that the Gods regard with love is blessed. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

verses.sanskrit: इन्धानो अग्निं वनवद वनुष्यतः कर्तब्रह्मा शूशुवद रातहव्य इत ||
verses.transliteration: indhāno aghniṃ vanavad vanuṣyataḥ kṛtabrahmā śūśuvad rātahavya it

translations.griffith: HE lighting up the flame shall conquer enemies: strong shall he be who offers prayer and brings his gift.  He with his seed spreads forth beyond another's seed, whomever Brahmaṇaspati takes for his friend.

verses.sanskrit: जातेन जातमति स पर सर्स्र्ते यं-यं युजंक्र्णुते बरह्मणस पतिः ||
verses.transliteration: jātena jātamati sa pra sarsṛte yaṃ-yaṃ yujaṃkṛṇute brahmaṇas patiḥ

translations.griffith: With heroes he shall overcome his hero foes, and spread his wealth by kine wise by himself is be.  His children and his children's children grow in strength, whomever Brahmaṇaspati takes for his friend.

verses.sanskrit: वीरेभिर्वीरान वनवद वनुष्यतो गोभी रयिं पप्रथद बोधति तमना तोकं च तस्य तनयं च वर्धते यं-यं ... |||
verses.transliteration: vīrebhirvīrān vanavad vanuṣyato ghobhī rayiṃ paprathad bodhati tmanā tokaṃ ca tasya tanayaṃ ca vardhate yaṃ-yaṃ ...

translations.griffith: He, mighty like a raving river's billowy flood, as a bull conquers oxen, overcomes with strength.  Like Agni's blazing rush he may not be restrained, whomever Brahmaṇaspati takes for his friend.

verses.sanskrit: सिन्धुर्न कषोदः शिमीवान रघायतो वर्षेव वध्रीन्रभि वष्ट्योजसा अग्नेरिव परसितिर्नाह वर्तवे यं-यं .. |||
verses.transliteration: sindhurna kṣodaḥ śimīvān ṛghāyato vṛṣeva vadhrīnrabhi vaṣṭyojasā aghneriva prasitirnāha vartave yaṃ-yaṃ ..

translations.griffith: For him the floods of heaven flow never failing down: first with the heroes he goes forth to war for kine.  He slays in unabated vigour with great might, whomever Brahmaṇaspati takes for his friend.

verses.sanskrit: तस्मा अर्षन्ति दिव्या असश्चतः स सत्वभिः परथमो गोषुगछति अनिभ्र्ष्टतविषिर्हन्त्योजसा यं-यं ... |||
verses.transliteration: tasmā arṣanti divyā asaścataḥ sa satvabhiḥ prathamo ghoṣughachati anibhṛṣṭataviṣirhantyojasā yaṃ-yaṃ ...

translations.griffith: All roaring rivers pour their waters down for him, and many a flawless shelter hath been granted him.  Blest with the happiness of Gods he prospers well, whomever Brahmaṇaspati takes for his friend.

verses.sanskrit: तस्मा इद विश्वे धुनयन्त सिन्धवो.अछिद्रा शर्म दधिरे पुरूणि देवानां सुम्ने सुभगः स एधते यं-यं ... |||
verses.transliteration: tasmā id viśve dhunayanta sindhavo.achidrā śarma dadhire purūṇi devānāṃ sumne subhaghaḥ sa edhate yaṃ-yaṃ ...

translations.griffith: Missing Line From Griffith.

verses.sanskrit: रजुरिच्छंसो वनवद वनुष्यतो देवयन्निददेवयन्तमभ्यसत सुप्रावीरिद वनवत पर्त्सु दुष्टरं यज्वेदयज्योर्वि भजाति भोजनम |||
verses.transliteration: ṛjuricchaṃso vanavad vanuṣyato devayannidadevayantamabhyasat suprāvīrid vanavat pṛtsu duṣṭaraṃ yajvedayajyorvi bhajāti bhojanam

translations.griffith: THE righteous singer shall o’ercome his enemies, and he who serves the Gods subdue the godless man.  The zealous man shall vanquish the invincible, the worshipper share the food of him who worships not.

verses.sanskrit: यजस्व वीर पर विहि मनायतो भद्रं मनः कर्णुष्व वर्त्रतूर्ये हविष कर्णुष्व सुभगो यथाससि बरह्मणस पतेरव आ वर्णीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: yajasva vīra pra vihi manāyato bhadraṃ manaḥ kṛṇuṣva vṛtratūrye haviṣ kṛṇuṣva subhagho yathāsasi brahmaṇas paterava ā vṛṇīmahe

translations.griffith: Worship, thou hero, chase the arrogant afar: put on auspicious courage for the fight with foes.  Prepare oblation so that thou mayst have success. we crave the favouring help of Brahmaṇaspati.

verses.sanskrit: स इज्जनेन स विशा स जन्मना स पुत्रैर्वाजं भरतेधना नर्भिः देवानां यः पितरमाविवासति शरद्धामना हविषा बरह्मणस पतिम |||
verses.transliteration: sa ijjanena sa viśā sa janmanā sa putrairvājaṃ bharatedhanā nṛbhiḥ devānāṃ yaḥ pitaramāvivāsati śraddhāmanā haviṣā brahmaṇas patim

translations.griffith: He with his folk, his house, his family, his sons, gains booty for himself, and, with the heroes, wealth,  Who with oblation and a true believing heart serves Brahmaṇaspati the Father of the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: यो अस्मै हव्यैर्घ्र्तवद्भिरविधत पर तं पराचा नयति बरह्मणस पतिः उरुष्यतीमंहसो रक्षती रिषो.अंहोश्चिदस्मा उरुचक्रिरद्भुतः |||
verses.transliteration: yo asmai havyairghṛtavadbhiravidhat pra taṃ prācā nayati brahmaṇas patiḥ uruṣyatīmaṃhaso rakṣatī riṣo.aṃhościdasmā urucakriradbhutaḥ

translations.griffith: Whoso hath honoured him with offerings rich in oil, him Brahmaṇaspati leads forward on his way,  Saves him from sorrow, frees him from his enemy, and is his wonderful deliverer from woe.

verses.sanskrit: इमा गिर आदित्येभ्यो घर्तस्नूः सनाद राजभ्यो जुह्वा जुहोमि शर्णोतु मित्रो अर्यमा भगो नस्तुविजातो वरुणो दक्षो अंशः |||
verses.transliteration: imā ghira ādityebhyo ghṛtasnūḥ sanād rājabhyo juhvā juhomi śṛṇotu mitro aryamā bhagho nastuvijāto varuṇo dakṣo aṃśaḥ

translations.griffith: THESE hymns that drop down fatness, with the ladle I ever offer to the Kings Ādityas.  May Mitra, Aryaman, and Bhaga hear us, the mighty Varuṇa Dakṣa, and Aṁśa.

verses.sanskrit: इमं सतोमं सक्रतवो मे अद्य मित्रो अर्यमा वरुणो जुषन्त आदित्यासः शुचयो धारपूता अव्र्जिना अनवद्या अरिष्टाः |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ stomaṃ sakratavo me adya mitro aryamā varuṇo juṣanta ādityāsaḥ śucayo dhārapūtā avṛjinā anavadyā ariṣṭāḥ

translations.griffith: With one accord may Aryaman and Mitra and Varuṇa this day accept this praise-song—  Ādityas bright and pure as streams of water, free from all guile and falsehood, blameless, perfect.

verses.sanskrit: त आदित्यास उरवो गभीरा अदब्धासो दिप्सन्तो भूर्यक्षाः अन्तः पश्यन्ति वर्जिनोत साधु सर्वं राजभ्यः परमा चिदन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: ta ādityāsa uravo ghabhīrā adabdhāso dipsanto bhūryakṣāḥ antaḥ paśyanti vṛjinota sādhu sarvaṃ rājabhyaḥ paramā cidanti

translations.griffith: These Gods, Ādityas, vast, profound, and faithful, with many eyes, fain to deceive the wicked,  Looking within behold the good and evil near to the Kings is even the thing most distant.

verses.sanskrit: धारयन्त आदित्यासो जगत सथा देवा विश्वस्य भुवनस्य गोपाः दीर्घाधियो रक्षमाणा असुर्यं रतावानश्चयमाना रणानि |||
verses.transliteration: dhārayanta ādityāso jaghat sthā devā viśvasya bhuvanasya ghopāḥ dīrghādhiyo rakṣamāṇā asuryaṃ ṛtāvānaścayamānā ṛṇāni

translations.griffith: Upholding that which moves and that which moves not, Ādityas, Gods, protectors of all being,  Provident, guarding well the world of spirits, true to eternal Law, the debt-exactors.

verses.sanskrit: विद्यामादित्या अवसो वो अस्य यदर्यमन भय आ चिन मयोभु युष्माकं मित्रावरुणा परणीतौ परि शवभ्रेव दुरितानिव्र्ज्याम |||
verses.transliteration: vidyāmādityā avaso vo asya yadaryaman bhaya ā cin mayobhu yuṣmākaṃ mitrāvaruṇā praṇītau pari śvabhreva duritānivṛjyām

translations.griffith: May I, Ādityas, share m this your favour which, Aryaman, brings profit e’en in danger.  Under your guidance, Varuṇa and Mitra, round troubles may I pass, like rugged places.

verses.sanskrit: सुगो हि वो अर्यमन मित्र पन्था अन्र्क्षरो वरुण साधुरस्ति तेनादित्या अधि वोचता नो यछता नो दुष्परिहन्तु शर्म |||
verses.transliteration: sugho hi vo aryaman mitra panthā anṛkṣaro varuṇa sādhurasti tenādityā adhi vocatā no yachatā no duṣparihantu śarma

translations.griffith: Smooth is your path, O Aryaman and Mitra; excellent is it, Varuṇa, and thornless.  Thereon, Ādityas, send us down your blessing: grant us a shelter hard to be demolished.

verses.sanskrit: पिपर्तु नो अदिती राजपुत्राति दवेषांस्यर्यमा सुगेभिः बर्हन मित्रस्य वरुणस्य शर्मोप सयाम पुरुवीरा अरिष्टाः |||
verses.transliteration: pipartu no aditī rājaputrāti dveṣāṃsyaryamā sughebhiḥ bṛhan mitrasya varuṇasya śarmopa syāma puruvīrā ariṣṭāḥ

translations.griffith: Mother of Kings, may Aditi transport us, by fair paths Aryaman, beyond all hatred.  May we uninjured, girt by many heroes, win Varuṇa's and Mitra's high protection.

verses.sanskrit: तिस्रो भूमीर्धारयन तरीन्रुत दयून तरीणि वरता विदथे अन्तरेषाम रतेनादित्या महि वो महित्वं तदर्यमन वरुण मित्र चारु |||
verses.transliteration: tisro bhūmīrdhārayan trīnruta dyūn trīṇi vratā vidathe antareṣām ṛtenādityā mahi vo mahitvaṃ tadaryaman varuṇa mitra cāru

translations.griffith: With their support they stay three earths, three heavens; three are their functions in the Gods’ assembly.  Mighty through Law, Ādityas, is your greatness; fair is it, Aryaman, Varuṇa, and Mitra.

verses.sanskrit: तरी रोचना दिव्या धारयन्त हिरण्ययाः शुचयो धारपूताः अस्वप्नजो अनिमिषा अदब्धा उरुशंसा रजवे मर्त्याय |||
verses.transliteration: trī rocanā divyā dhārayanta hiraṇyayāḥ śucayo dhārapūtāḥ asvapnajo animiṣā adabdhā uruśaṃsā ṛjave martyāya

translations.griffith: Golden and splendid, pure like streams of water, they hold aloft the three bright heavenly regions.  Ne’er do they slumber, never close their eyelids, faithful, far-ruling for the righteous mortal.

verses.sanskrit: तवं विश्वेषां वरुणासि राजा ये च देवा असुर ये च मर्ताः शतं नो रास्व शरदो विचक्षे.अच्यामायूंषि सुधितानि पूर्वा |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ viśveṣāṃ varuṇāsi rājā ye ca devā asura ye ca martāḥ śataṃ no rāsva śarado vicakṣe.acyāmāyūṃṣi sudhitāni pūrvā

translations.griffith: Thou over all, O Varuṇa, art Sovran, be they Gods, Asura! or be they mortals.  Grant unto us to see a hundred autumns ours be the blest long lives of our forefathers.

verses.sanskrit: न दक्षिणा वि चिकिते न सव्या न पराचीनमादित्या नोतपश्चा पाक्या चिद वसवो धीर्या चिद युष्मानीतो अभयंज्योतिरश्याम |||
verses.transliteration: na dakṣiṇā vi cikite na savyā na prācīnamādityā notapaścā pākyā cid vasavo dhīryā cid yuṣmānīto abhayaṃjyotiraśyām

translations.griffith: Neither the right nor left do I distinguish, neither the cast nor yet the west, Ādityas.  Simple and guided by your wisdom, Vasus! may I attain the light that brings no danger.

verses.sanskrit: यो राजभ्य रतनिभ्यो ददाश यं वर्धयन्ति पुष्टयश्चनित्याः स रेवान याति परथमो रथेन वसुदावा विदथेषु परशस्तः |||
verses.transliteration: yo rājabhya ṛtanibhyo dadāśa yaṃ vardhayanti puṣṭayaścanityāḥ sa revān yāti prathamo rathena vasudāvā vidatheṣu praśastaḥ

translations.griffith: He who bears gifts unto the Kings, true Leaders, he whom their everlasting blessings prosper,  Moves with his chariot first in rank and wealthy, munificent and lauded in assemblies.

verses.sanskrit: शुचिरपः सूयवसा अदब्ध उप कषेति वर्द्धवयाः सुवीरः नकिष टं घनन्त्यन्तितो न दूराद य आदित्यानां भवति परणीतौ |||
verses.transliteration: śucirapaḥ sūyavasā adabdha upa kṣeti vṛddhavayāḥ suvīraḥ nakiṣ ṭaṃ ghnantyantito na dūrād ya ādityānāṃ bhavati praṇītau

translations.griffith: Pure, faithful, very strong, with heroes round him, he dwells beside the waters rich with pasture.  None slays, from near at hand or from a distance, him who is under the Ādityas’ guidance.

verses.sanskrit: अदिते मित्र वरुणोत मर्ळ यद वो वयं चक्र्मा कच्चिदागः उर्वश्यामभयं जयोतिरिन्द्र मा नो दीर्घा अभि नशन तमिस्राः |||
verses.transliteration: adite mitra varuṇota mṛḷa yad vo vayaṃ cakṛmā kaccidāghaḥ urvaśyāmabhayaṃ jyotirindra mā no dīrghā abhi naśan tamisrāḥ

translations.griffith: Aditi, Mitra, Varuṇa, forgive us however we have erred and sinned against you.  May I obtain the broad light free from peril: O Indra, let not during darkness seize us.

verses.sanskrit: उभे अस्मै पीपयतः समीची दिवो वर्ष्टिं सुभगो नाम पुष्यन उभा कषयावाजयन याति पर्त्सूभावर्धौ भवतः साधू अस्मै |||
verses.transliteration: ubhe asmai pīpayataḥ samīcī divo vṛṣṭiṃ subhagho nāma puṣyan ubhā kṣayāvājayan yāti pṛtsūbhāvardhau bhavataḥ sādhū asmai

translations.griffith: For him the Twain united pour their fulness, the rain from heaven: he thrives most highly favoured.  He goes to war mastering both the mansions: to him both portions of the world are gracious.

verses.sanskrit: या वो माया अभिद्रुहे यजत्राः पाशा आदित्या रिपवे विच्र्त्ताः अश्वीव तानति येषं रथेनारिष्टा उरावा शर्मन सयाम |||
verses.transliteration: yā vo māyā abhidruhe yajatrāḥ pāśā ādityā ripave vicṛttāḥ aśvīva tānati yeṣaṃ rathenāriṣṭā urāvā śarman syāma

translations.griffith: Your guiles, ye Holy Ones, to quell oppressors, your snares spread out against the foe, Ādityas,  May I car-borne pass like a skilful horseman: uninjured may we dwell in spacious shelter.

verses.sanskrit: माहं मघोनो वरुण परियस्य भूरिदाव्न आ विदं शूनमापेः मा रायो राजन सुयमादव सथां बर्हद वदेम ... |||
verses.transliteration: māhaṃ maghono varuṇa priyasya bhūridāvna ā vidaṃ śūnamāpeḥ mā rāyo rājan suyamādava sthāṃ bṛhad vadema ...

translations.griffith: May I not live, O Varuṇa, to witness my wealthy, liberal, dear friend's destitution.  King, may O never lack well-ordered riches. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

verses.sanskrit: इदं कवेरादित्यस्य सवराजो विश्वानि सान्त्यभ्यस्तु मह्ना अति यो मन्द्रो यजथाय देवः सुकीर्तिं भिक्षे वरुणस्य भूरेः |||
verses.transliteration: idaṃ kaverādityasya svarājo viśvāni sāntyabhyastu mahnā ati yo mandro yajathāya devaḥ sukīrtiṃ bhikṣe varuṇasya bhūreḥ

translations.griffith: THIS laud of the self-radiant wise Āditya shall be supreme o’er all that is in greatness.

verses.sanskrit: तव वरते सुभगासः सयाम सवाध्यो वरुण तुष्टुवांसः उपायन उषसां गोमतीनामग्नयो न जरमाणा अनु दयून |||
verses.transliteration: tava vrate subhaghāsaḥ syāma svādhyo varuṇa tuṣṭuvāṃsaḥ upāyana uṣasāṃ ghomatīnāmaghnayo na jaramāṇā anu dyūn

translations.griffith: beg renown of Varuṇa the Mighty, the God exceeding kind to him who worships.

verses.sanskrit: तव सयाम पुरुवीरस्य शर्मन्नुरुशंसस्य वरुण परणेतः यूयं नः पुत्रा अदितेरदब्धा अभि कषमध्वं युज्याय देवाः |||
verses.transliteration: tava syāma puruvīrasya śarmannuruśaṃsasya varuṇa praṇetaḥ yūyaṃ naḥ putrā aditeradabdhā abhi kṣamadhvaṃ yujyāya devāḥ

translations.griffith: Having extolled thee. Varuṇa, with thoughtful care may we have high fortune in thy service,  Singing thy praises like the fires at coming, day after day, of mornings rich in cattle.

verses.sanskrit: पर सीमादित्यो अस्र्जद विधर्तान रतं सिन्धवो वरुणस्य यन्ति न शराम्यन्ति न वि मुचन्त्येते वयो न पप्तू रघुयापरिज्मन |||
verses.transliteration: pra sīmādityo asṛjad vidhartān ṛtaṃ sindhavo varuṇasya yanti na śrāmyanti na vi mucantyete vayo na paptū raghuyāparijman

translations.griffith: May we be in thy keeping, O thou Leader wide-ruling Varuṇa, Lord of many heroes.  O sons of Aditi, for ever faithful, pardon us, Gods, admit us to your friendship.

verses.sanskrit: वि मच्छ्रथाय रशनामिवाग रध्याम ते वरुण खां रतस्य मा तन्तुश्छेदि वयतो धियं मे मा मात्रा शार्यपसः पुर रतोः |||
verses.transliteration: vi macchrathāya raśanāmivāgha ṛdhyāma te varuṇa khāṃ ṛtasya mā tantuśchedi vayato dhiyaṃ me mā mātrā śāryapasaḥ pura ṛtoḥ

translations.griffith: He made them flow, the Āditya, the Sustainer: the rivers run by Varuṇa's commandment.  These feel no weariness, nor cease from flowing: swift have they flown like birds in air around us.

verses.sanskrit: अपो सु मयक्ष वरुण भियसं मत सम्राळ रतावो.अनु मा गर्भाय दामेव वत्साद वि मुमुग्ध्यंहो नहि तवदारे निमिषश्चनेशे |||
verses.transliteration: apo su myakṣa varuṇa bhiyasaṃ mat samrāḷ ṛtāvo.anu mā ghṛbhāya dāmeva vatsād vi mumughdhyaṃho nahi tvadāre nimiṣaścaneśe

translations.griffith: Loose me from sin as from a bond that binds me: may we swell, Varuṇa, thy spring of Order.  Let not my thread, while I weave song, be severed, nor my work's sum, before the time, be shattered.

verses.sanskrit: मा नो वधैर्वरुण ये त इष्टावेनः कर्ण्वन्तमसुर भरीणन्ति मा जयोतिषः परवसथानि गन्म वि षू मर्धः शिश्रथो जीवसे नः |||
verses.transliteration: mā no vadhairvaruṇa ye ta iṣṭāvenaḥ kṛṇvantamasura bhrīṇanti mā jyotiṣaḥ pravasathāni ghanma vi ṣū mṛdhaḥ śiśratho jīvase naḥ

translations.griffith: Far from me, Varuṇa, remove all danger accept me graciously, thou Holy Sovran.  Cast off, like cords that hold a calf, my troubles: I am not even mine eyelid's lord without thee.

verses.sanskrit: नमः पुरा ते वरुणोत नूनमुतापरं तुविजात बरवाम तवे हि कं पर्वते न शरितान्यप्रच्युतानि दूळभ वरतानि |||
verses.transliteration: namaḥ purā te varuṇota nūnamutāparaṃ tuvijāta bravāma tve hi kaṃ parvate na śritānyapracyutāni dūḷabha vratāni

translations.griffith: Strike us not, Varuṇa, with those dread weapons which, Asura, at thy bidding wound the sinner.  Let us not pass away from light to exile. Scatter, that we may live, the men who hate us

verses.sanskrit: पर रणा सावीरध मत्क्र्तानि माहं राजन्नन्यक्र्तेन भोजम अव्युष्टा इन नु भूयसीरुषास आ नो जीवान वरुण तासु शाधि |||
verses.transliteration: para ṛṇā sāvīradha matkṛtāni māhaṃ rājannanyakṛtena bhojam avyuṣṭā in nu bhūyasīruṣāsa ā no jīvān varuṇa tāsu śādhi

translations.griffith: O mighty Varuṇa, now and hereafter, even as of old, will we speak forth our worship.  For in thyself, invincible God, thy statutes ne’er to be moved are fixed as on a mountain.

verses.sanskrit: यो मे राजन युज्यो वा सखा वा सवप्ने भयं भीरवे मह्यमाह सतेनो वा यो दिप्सति नो वर्को वा तवं तस्माद वरुणपाह्यस्मान |||
verses.transliteration: yo me rājan yujyo vā sakhā vā svapne bhayaṃ bhīrave mahyamāha steno vā yo dipsati no vṛko vā tvaṃ tasmād varuṇapāhyasmān

translations.griffith: Move far from me what sins I have committed: let me not suffer, King, for guilt of others.  Full many a morn remains to dawn upon us: in these, O Varuṇa, while we live direct us.

verses.transliteration: māhaṃ maghono ...

translations.griffith: O King, whoever, be he friend or kinsman, hath threatened me affrighted in my slumber-  If any wolf or robber fain would harm us, therefrom, O Varuṇa, give thou us protection.

verses.sanskrit: धर्तव्रता आदित्या इषिरा आरे मत कर्त रहसूरिवागः शर्ण्वतो वो वरुण मित्र देवा भद्रस्य विद्वानवसे हुवेवः |||
verses.transliteration: dhṛtavratā ādityā iṣirā āre mat karta rahasūrivāghaḥ śṛṇvato vo varuṇa mitra devā bhadrasya vidvānavase huvevaḥ

translations.griffith: UPHOLDERS of the Law, ye strong Ādityas, remove my sin like her who bears in secret.  You, Varuṇa, Mitra and all Gods who listen, I call to help me, I who know your goodness.

verses.sanskrit: यूयं देवाः परमतिर्यूयमोजो यूयं दवेषांसि सनुतर्युयोत अभिक्षत्तारो अभि च कषमध्वमद्या च नो मर्ळयतापरं च |||
verses.transliteration: yūyaṃ devāḥ pramatiryūyamojo yūyaṃ dveṣāṃsi sanutaryuyota abhikṣattāro abhi ca kṣamadhvamadyā ca no mṛḷayatāparaṃ ca

translations.griffith: Ye, Gods, are providence and ye are power: remove ye utterly all those who hate us.  As givers of good things deal with us kindly: this day be gracious to us and hereafter.

verses.sanskrit: किमू नु वः कर्णवामापरेण किं सनेन वसव आप्येन यूयं नो मित्रावरुणादिते च सवस्तिमिन्द्रामरुतो दधात |||
verses.transliteration: kimū nu vaḥ kṛṇavāmāpareṇa kiṃ sanena vasava āpyena yūyaṃ no mitrāvaruṇādite ca svastimindrāmaruto dadhāta

translations.griffith: What service may we do you with our future, what service, Vasus, with our ancient friendship?  O Aditi, and Varuṇa and Mitra, Indra and Maruts, make us well and happy.

verses.sanskrit: हये देवा यूयमिदापय सथ ते मर्ळत नाधमानाय मह्यम मा वो रथो मध्यमवाळ रते भून मा युष्मावस्त्वापिषु शरमिष्म |||
verses.transliteration: haye devā yūyamidāpaya stha te mṛḷata nādhamānāya mahyam mā vo ratho madhyamavāḷ ṛte bhūn mā yuṣmāvastvāpiṣu śramiṣma

translations.griffith: Ye, O ye Gods, are verily our kinsmen as such be kind to me who now implore you.  Let not your car come slowly to our worship: of kinsmen such as you ne’er let us weary.

verses.sanskrit: पर व एको मिमय भूर्यागो यन मा पितेव कितवं शशास आरे पाषा आरे अघानि देवा मा माधि पुत्रे विमिव गरभीष्ट |||
verses.transliteration: pra va eko mimaya bhūryāgho yan mā piteva kitavaṃ śaśāsa āre pāṣā āre aghāni devā mā mādhi putre vimiva ghrabhīṣṭa

translations.griffith: I singly have sinned many a sin against you, and ye chastised me as a sire the gambler.  Far be your nets, far, Gods, be mine offences: seize me not like a bird upon her offspring.

verses.sanskrit: अर्वाञ्चो अद्या भवता यजत्रा आ वो हार्दि भयमानो वययेयम तराध्वं नो देवा निजुरो वर्कस्य तराध्वं कर्तादवपदो यजत्राः |||
verses.transliteration: arvāñco adyā bhavatā yajatrā ā vo hārdi bhayamāno vyayeyam trādhvaṃ no devā nijuro vṛkasya trādhvaṃ kartādavapado yajatrāḥ

translations.griffith: Turn yourselves hitherward this day, ye Holy, that fearing in my heart I may approach you.  Protect us, God; let not the wolf destroy us. Save us, ye Holy, from the pit and falling.

verses.transliteration: māhaṃ maghono ...

translations.griffith: May I not live, O Varuṇa, to witness my wealthy, liberal, dear friend's destitution.  King, may I never lack well-ordered riches. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

verses.sanskrit: रतं देवाय कर्ण्वते सवित्र इन्द्रायाहिघ्ने न रमन्त आपः अहर-अहर्यात्यक्तुरपां कियात्या परथमः सर्ग आसाम |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtaṃ devāya kṛṇvate savitra indrāyāhighne na ramanta āpaḥ ahar-aharyātyakturapāṃ kiyātyā prathamaḥ sargha āsām

translations.griffith: THE streams unceasing flow to Indra, slayer of Ahi, Savitar, God, Law's fulfiller,  Day after day goes on the sheen of waters. What time hath past since they were first set flowing?

verses.sanskrit: यो वर्त्राय सिनमत्राभरिष्यत पर तं जनित्री विदुष उवाच पथो रदन्तीरनु जोषमस्मै दिवे-दिवे धुनयो यन्त्यर्थम |||
verses.transliteration: yo vṛtrāya sinamatrābhariṣyat pra taṃ janitrī viduṣa uvāca patho radantīranu joṣamasmai dive-dive dhunayo yantyartham

translations.griffith: His Mother—for she knew—spake and proclaimed him who was about to cast his bolt at Vṛtra.  Cutting their paths according to his pleasure day after day flow to their goal the rivers.

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्ध्वो हयस्थादध्यन्तरिक्षे.अधा वर्त्राय पर वधंजभार मिहं वसान उप हीमदुद्रोत तिग्मायुधो अजयच्छत्रुमिन्द्रः |||
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvo hyasthādadhyantarikṣe.adhā vṛtrāya pra vadhaṃjabhāra mihaṃ vasāna upa hīmadudrot tighmāyudho ajayacchatrumindraḥ

translations.griffith: Aloft he stood above the airy region, and against Vṛtra shot his deadly missile.  Enveloped in a cloud he rushed upon him. Indra subdued the foe with sharpened weapons.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हस्पते तपुषाश्नेव विध्य वर्कद्वरसो असुरस्य वीरान यथा जघन्थ धर्षता पुरा चिदेवा जहि शत्रुमस्माकमिन्द्र |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhaspate tapuṣāśneva vidhya vṛkadvaraso asurasya vīrān yathā jaghantha dhṛṣatā purā cidevā jahi śatrumasmākamindra

translations.griffith: As with a bolt, Bṛhaspati, fiercely flaming, pierce thou Vṛkadvaras’, the Asura's, heroes.  Even as in time of old with might thou slewest, so slay even now our enemy, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit: अव कषिप दिवो अश्मानमुच्चा येन शत्रुं मन्दसानो निजूर्वाः तोकस्य सातौ तनयस्य भूरेरस्मानर्धं कर्णुतादिन्द्र गोनाम |||
verses.transliteration: ava kṣipa divo aśmānamuccā yena śatruṃ mandasāno nijūrvāḥ tokasya sātau tanayasya bhūrerasmānardhaṃ kṛṇutādindra ghonām

translations.griffith: Cast down from heaven on high thy bolt of thunder wherewith in joy thou smitest dead the foeman.  For gain of children make us thine, O Indra, of many children's children and of cattle.

verses.sanskrit: पर हि करतुं वर्हथो यं वनुथो रध्रस्य सथो यजमानस्य चोदौ इन्द्रासोमा युवमस्मानविष्टमस्मिन भयस्थे कर्णुतमु लोकम |||
verses.transliteration: pra hi kratuṃ vṛhatho yaṃ vanutho radhrasya stho yajamānasya codau indrāsomā yuvamasmānaviṣṭamasmin bhayasthe kṛṇutamu lokam

translations.griffith: Whomso ye love, his power ye aid and strengthen; ye Twain are the rich worshipper's advancers.  Graciously favour us, Indra and Soma; give us firm standing in this time of danger.

verses.sanskrit: न मा तमन न शरमन नोत तन्द्रन न वोचाम मा सुनोतेति सोमम यो मे पर्णाद यो ददद यो निबोधाद यो मा सुन्वन्तमुप गोभिरायत |||
verses.transliteration: na mā taman na śraman nota tandran na vocāma mā sunoteti somam yo me pṛṇād yo dadad yo nibodhād yo mā sunvantamupa ghobhirāyat

translations.griffith: Let it not vex me, tire me, make me slothful, and never let us say, Press not the Soma;  For him who cares for me, gives gifts, supports me, who comes with kine to me who pour libations.

verses.sanskrit: सरस्वति तवमस्मानविड्ढि मरुत्वती धर्षती जेषि शत्रून तयं चिच्छर्धन्तं तविषीयमाणमिन्द्रो हन्ति वर्षभं शण्डिकानाम |||
verses.transliteration: sarasvati tvamasmānaviḍḍhi marutvatī dhṛṣatī jeṣi śatrūn tyaṃ cicchardhantaṃ taviṣīyamāṇamindro hanti vṛṣabhaṃ śaṇḍikānām

translations.griffith: Sarasvatī, protect us: with the Maruts allied thou boldly conquerest our foemen,  While Indra does to death the daring chieftain of Śaṇḍikas exulting in his prowess.

verses.sanskrit: यो नः सनुत्य उत वा जिघत्नुरभिख्याय तं तिगितेन विध्य बर्हस्पत आयुधैर्जेषि शत्रून दरुहे रीषन्तं परि धेहि राजन |||
verses.transliteration: yo naḥ sanutya uta vā jighatnurabhikhyāya taṃ tighitena vidhya bṛhaspata āyudhairjeṣi śatrūn druhe rīṣantaṃ pari dhehi rājan

translations.griffith: Him who waylays, yea, him who would destroy us,—aim at him, pierce him with thy sharpened weapon.  Bṛhaspati, with arms thou slayest foemen O King, give up the spoiler to destruction.

verses.sanskrit: अस्माकेभिः सत्वभिः शूर शूरैर्वीर्य कर्धि यानि ते कर्त्वानि जयोगभूवन्ननुधूपितासो हत्वी तेशामा भरानो वसूनि |||
verses.transliteration: asmākebhiḥ satvabhiḥ śūra śūrairvīrya kṛdhi yāni te kartvāni jyoghabhūvannanudhūpitāso hatvī teśāmā bharāno vasūni

translations.griffith: Perform, O Hero, with our valiant heroes the deeds heroic which thou hast to finish.  Long have they been inflated with presumption: slay them, and bring us hither their possessions.

verses.sanskrit: तं वः शर्धं मारुतं सुम्नयुर्गिरोप बरुवे नमसा दैव्यं जनम यथा रयिं सर्ववीरं नशामहा अपत्यसाचं शरुत्यं दिवे-दिवे |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ vaḥ śardhaṃ mārutaṃ sumnayurghiropa bruve namasā daivyaṃ janam yathā rayiṃ sarvavīraṃ naśāmahā apatyasācaṃ śrutyaṃ dive-dive

translations.griffith: I craving joy address with hymn and homage your heavenly host, the company of Maruts,  That we may gain wealth with full store of heroes, each day more famous, and with troops of children.

verses.sanskrit: अस्माकं मित्रावरुणावतं रथमादित्यै रुद्रैर्वसुभिः सचाभुवा पर यद वयो न पप्तन वस्मनस परि शरवस्यवोह्र्षीवन्तो वनर्षदः |||
verses.transliteration: asmākaṃ mitrāvaruṇāvataṃ rathamādityai rudrairvasubhiḥ sacābhuvā pra yad vayo na paptan vasmanas pari śravasyavohṛṣīvanto vanarṣadaḥ

translations.griffith: HELP, Varuṇa and Mitra, O ye Twain allied with Vasus, Rudras, and Ādityas, help our car,  That, as the wild birds of the forest from their home, our horses may fly forth, glad, eager for renown.

verses.sanskrit: अध समा न उदवता सजोषसो रथं देवासो अभि विक्षु वाजयुम यदाशवः पद्याभिस्तित्रतो रजः पर्थिव्याः सानौ जङघनन्त पाणिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: adha smā na udavatā sajoṣaso rathaṃ devāso abhi vikṣu vājayum yadāśavaḥ padyābhistitrato rajaḥ pṛthivyāḥ sānau jaṅghananta pāṇibhiḥ

translations.griffith: Yea, now ye Gods of one accord speed on our car what time among the folk it seeks an act of might;  When, hasting through the region with the stamp of hoofs, our swift steeds trample on the ridges of the earth.

verses.sanskrit: उत सय न इन्द्रो विश्वचर्षणिर्दिवः शर्धेन मारुतेन सुक्रतुः अनु नु सथात्यव्र्काभिरूतिभी रथं महे सनये वाजसातये |||
verses.transliteration: uta sya na indro viśvacarṣaṇirdivaḥ śardhena mārutena sukratuḥ anu nu sthātyavṛkābhirūtibhī rathaṃ mahe sanaye vājasātaye

translations.griffith: Or may our Indra here, the Friend of all mankind, coming from heaven, most wise, girt by the Marut host,  Accompany, with aid untroubled by a foe, our car to mighty gain, to win the meed of strength.

verses.sanskrit: उत सय देवो भुवनस्य सक्षणिस्त्वष्टा गनाभिः सजोषा जूजुवद रथम इळा भगो बर्हद्दिवोत रोदसी पूषा पुरन्धिरश्विनावधा पती |||
verses.transliteration: uta sya devo bhuvanasya sakṣaṇistvaṣṭā ghnābhiḥ sajoṣā jūjuvad ratham iḷā bhagho bṛhaddivota rodasī pūṣā purandhiraśvināvadhā patī

translations.griffith: Or may this Tvaṣṭar, God who rules the world with power, one-minded with the Goddesses speed forth our car;  Iḷā and Bhaga the celestial, Earth and Heaven, Pūṣan, Purandhi, and the Aśvins, ruling Lords.

verses.sanskrit: उत तये देवी सुभगे मिथूद्र्शोषासानक्ता जगतामपीजुवा सतुषे यद वां पर्थिवि नव्यसा वच सथातुश्च वयस्त्रिवया उपस्तिरे |||
verses.transliteration: uta tye devī subhaghe mithūdṛśoṣāsānaktā jaghatāmapījuvā stuṣe yad vāṃ pṛthivi navyasā vaca sthātuśca vayastrivayā upastire

translations.griffith: Or, seen alternate, those two blessed Goddesses, Morning and Night who stir all living things to act:  While with my newest song I praise you both, O Earth, that from what moves not ye may spread forth threefold food.

verses.sanskrit: उत वः शंसमुशिजामिव शमस्यहिर्बुध्न्यो.अज एकपादुत तरित रभुक्षाः सविता चनो दधे.अपां नपादाशुहेमा धिया शमि |||
verses.transliteration: uta vaḥ śaṃsamuśijāmiva śmasyahirbudhnyo.aja ekapāduta trita ṛbhukṣāḥ savitā cano dadhe.apāṃ napādāśuhemā dhiyā śami

translations.griffith: Your blessing as a boon for suppliants we desire: the Dragon of the Deep, and Aja-Ekapād,  Trita, Ṛbhukṣan, Savitar shall joy in us, and the Floods’ swift Child in our worship and our prayer.

verses.sanskrit: एता वो वश्म्युद्यता यजत्रा अतक्षन्नायवो नव्यसे सम शरवस्यवो वाजं चकानाः सप्तिर्न रथ्यो अह धीतिमश्याः |||
verses.transliteration: etā vo vaśmyudyatā yajatrā atakṣannāyavo navyase sam śravasyavo vājaṃ cakānāḥ saptirna rathyo aha dhītimaśyāḥ

translations.griffith: These earnest prayers I pray to you, ye Holy: to pay you honour, living men have formed them,  Men fain to win the prize and glory. May they win, as a car-horse might the goal, your notice.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य मे दयावाप्र्थिवी रतायतो भूतमवित्री वचसः सिषासतः ययोरायः परतरं ते इदं पुर उपस्तुते वसूयुर्वां महो दधे |||
verses.transliteration: asya me dyāvāpṛthivī ṛtāyato bhūtamavitrī vacasaḥ siṣāsataḥ yayorāyaḥ prataraṃ te idaṃ pura upastute vasūyurvāṃ maho dadhe

translations.griffith: GRACIOUSLY further, O ye Heaven and Earth, this speech striving to win reward, of me your worshipper.  First rank I give to you, Immortal, high extolled! I, fain to win me wealth, to you the mighty Pair.

verses.sanskrit: मा नो गुह्या रिप आयोरहन दभन मा न आभ्यो रीरधो दुछुनाभ्यः मा नो वि यौः सख्या विद्धि तस्य नः सुम्नायता मनसा तत तवेमहे |||
verses.transliteration: mā no ghuhyā ripa āyorahan dabhan mā na ābhyo rīradho duchunābhyaḥ mā no vi yauḥ sakhyā viddhi tasya naḥ sumnāyatā manasā tat tvemahe

translations.griffith: Let not man's guile annoy us, secret or by day: give not us up a prey to these calamities.  Sever not thou our friendship: think thereon for us. This, with a heart that longs for bliss, we seek from thee.

verses.sanskrit: अहेळता मनसा शरुष्टिमा वह दुहानां धेनुं पिप्युषीमसश्चतम पद्याभिराशुं वचसा च वाजिनं तवां हिनोमि पुरुहूत विश्वहा |||
verses.transliteration: aheḷatā manasā śruṣṭimā vaha duhānāṃ dhenuṃ pipyuṣīmasaścatam padyābhirāśuṃ vacasā ca vājinaṃ tvāṃ hinomi puruhūta viśvahā

translations.griffith: Bring hither with benignant mind the willing Cow teeming with plenteous milk, full, inexhaustible.  O thou invoked by many, day by day I urge thee with my word, a charger rapid in his tread.

verses.sanskrit: राकामहं सुहवां सुष्टुती हुवे शर्णोतु नः सुभगा बोधतु तमना सीव्यत्वपः सूच्याछिद्यमानया ददातु वीरं सतदायमुक्थ्यम |||
verses.transliteration: rākāmahaṃ suhavāṃ suṣṭutī huve śṛṇotu naḥ subhaghā bodhatu tmanā sīvyatvapaḥ sūcyāchidyamānayā dadātu vīraṃ satadāyamukthyam

translations.griffith: With eulogy I call on Rākā swift to hear may she, auspicious, hear us, and herself observe.  With never-breaking needle may she sew her work, and give a hero son most wealthy, meet for praise.

verses.sanskrit: यास्ते राके सुमतयः सुपेशसो याभिर्ददासि दाशुषे वसूनि ताभिर्नो अद्य सुमना उपागहि सहस्रपोषं सुभगे रराणा |||
verses.transliteration: yāste rāke sumatayaḥ supeśaso yābhirdadāsi dāśuṣe vasūni tābhirno adya sumanā upāghahi sahasrapoṣaṃ subhaghe rarāṇā

translations.griffith: All thy kind thoughts, O Rākā, lovely in their form, wherewith thou grantest wealth to him who offers gifts—  With these come thou to us this day benevolent, O Blessed One, bestowing food of thousand sorts.

verses.sanskrit: सिनीवालि पर्थुष्टुके या देवानामसि सवसा जुषस्व हव्यमाहुतं परजां देवि दिदिड्ढि नः |||
verses.transliteration: sinīvāli pṛthuṣṭuke yā devānāmasi svasā juṣasva havyamāhutaṃ prajāṃ devi didiḍḍhi naḥ

translations.griffith: O broad-tressed Sinīvālī, thou who art the Sister of the Gods,  Accept the offered sacrifice, and, Goddess, grant us progeny.

verses.sanskrit: या सुबाहुः सवङगुरिः सुषूमा बहुसूवरी तस्यै विश्पत्न्यै हविः सिनीवाल्यै जुहोतन |||
verses.transliteration: yā subāhuḥ svaṅghuriḥ suṣūmā bahusūvarī tasyai viśpatnyai haviḥ sinīvālyai juhotana

translations.griffith: With lovely fingers, lovely arms, prolific Mother of many sons—  Present the sacred gifts to her, to Sinīvālī Queen of men.

verses.sanskrit: या गुङगूर्या सिनीवाली या राका या सरस्वती इन्द्राणीमह्व ऊतये वरुणानीं सवस्तये |||
verses.transliteration: yā ghuṅghūryā sinīvālī yā rākā yā sarasvatī indrāṇīmahva ūtaye varuṇānīṃ svastaye

translations.griffith: Her, Sinīvālī, her, Gungū, her, Rākā, her, Sarasvatī, Indrāṇī to mine aid I call, and Varuṇānī for my weal.

verses.sanskrit: आ ते पितर्मरुतां सुम्नमेतु मा नः सूर्यस्य सन्द्र्षो युयोथाः अभि नो वीरो अर्वति कषमेत पर जायेमहि रुद्र परजाभिः |||
verses.transliteration: ā te pitarmarutāṃ sumnametu mā naḥ sūryasya sandṛṣo yuyothāḥ abhi no vīro arvati kṣameta pra jāyemahi rudra prajābhiḥ

translations.griffith: FATHER of Maruts, let thy bliss approach us: exclude us not from looking on the sunlight.  Gracious to our fleet courser be the Hero may we transplant us, Rudra, in our children.

verses.sanskrit: तवादत्तेभी रुद्र शन्तमेभिः शतं हिमा अशीय भेषजेभिः वयस्मद दवेषो वितरं वयंहो वयमीवाश्चातयस्वा विषूचीः |||
verses.transliteration: tvādattebhī rudra śantamebhiḥ śataṃ himā aśīya bheṣajebhiḥ vyasmad dveṣo vitaraṃ vyaṃho vyamīvāścātayasvā viṣūcīḥ

translations.griffith: With the most saving medicines which thou givest, Rudra, may I attain a hundred winters.  Far from us banish enmity and hatred, and to all quarters maladies and trouble.

verses.sanskrit: शरेष्ठो जातस्य रुद्र शरियासि तवस्तमस्तवसां वज्रबाहो पर्षि णः पारमंहसः सवस्ति विश्वा अभीती रपसो युयोधि |||
verses.transliteration: śreṣṭho jātasya rudra śriyāsi tavastamastavasāṃ vajrabāho parṣi ṇaḥ pāramaṃhasaḥ svasti viśvā abhītī rapaso yuyodhi

translations.griffith: Chief of all born art thou in glory, Rudra, armed with the thunder, mightiest of the mighty.  Transport us over trouble to well-being repel thou from us all assaults of mischief.

verses.sanskrit: मा तवा रुद्र चुक्रुधामा नमोभिर्मा दुष्टुती वर्षभ मासहूती उन नो वीरानर्पय भेषजेभिर्भिषक्तमं तवा भिषजां शर्णोमि |||
verses.transliteration: mā tvā rudra cukrudhāmā namobhirmā duṣṭutī vṛṣabha māsahūtī un no vīrānarpaya bheṣajebhirbhiṣaktamaṃ tvā bhiṣajāṃ śṛṇomi

translations.griffith: Let us not anger thee with worship, Rudra, ill praise, Strong God! or mingled invocation.  Do thou with strengthening balms incite our heroes: I hear thee famed as best of all physicians.

verses.sanskrit: हवीमभिर्हवते यो हविर्भिरव सतोमेभी रुद्रं दिषीय रदूदरः सुहवो मा नो अस्यै बभ्रुः सुशिप्रो रीरधन मनायै |||
verses.transliteration: havīmabhirhavate yo havirbhirava stomebhī rudraṃ diṣīya ṛdūdaraḥ suhavo mā no asyai babhruḥ suśipro rīradhan manāyai

translations.griffith: May I with praise-songs win that Rudra's favour who is adored with gifts and invocations.  Ne’er may the tawny God, fair-checked, and gracious, swifthearing, yield us to this evil purpose.

verses.sanskrit: उन मा ममन्द वर्षभो मरुत्वान तवक्षीयसा वयसा नाधमानम घर्णीव छायामरपा अशीया विवासेयं रुद्रस्य सुम्नम |||
verses.transliteration: un mā mamanda vṛṣabho marutvān tvakṣīyasā vayasā nādhamānam ghṛṇīva chāyāmarapā aśīyā vivāseyaṃ rudrasya sumnam

translations.griffith: The Strong, begirt by Maruts, hath refreshed me, with most invigorating food, imploring.  As he who finds a shade in fervent sunlight may I, uninjured, win the bliss of Rudra.

verses.sanskrit: कव सय ते रुद्र मर्ळयाकुर्हस्तो यो अस्ति भेषजो जलाषः अपभर्ता रपसो दैव्यस्याभी नु मा वर्षभ चक्षमीथाः |||
verses.transliteration: kva sya te rudra mṛḷayākurhasto yo asti bheṣajo jalāṣaḥ apabhartā rapaso daivyasyābhī nu mā vṛṣabha cakṣamīthāḥ

translations.griffith: Where is that gracious hand of thine, O Rudra, the hand that giveth health and bringeth comfort,  Remover of the woe that Gods have sent us? O Strong One, look thou on me with compassion.

verses.sanskrit: पर बभ्रवे वर्षभाय शवितीचे महो महीं सुष्टुतिमीरयामि नमस्या कल्मलीकिनं नमोभिर्ग्र्णीमसि तवेषं रुद्रस्य नाम |||
verses.transliteration: pra babhrave vṛṣabhāya śvitīce maho mahīṃ suṣṭutimīrayāmi namasyā kalmalīkinaṃ namobhirghṛṇīmasi tveṣaṃ rudrasya nāma

translations.griffith: To him the strong, great, tawny, fair-complexioned, I utter forth a mighty hymn of praises.  We serve the brilliant God with adorations, we glorify, the splendid name of Rudra.

verses.sanskrit: सथिरेभिरङगैः पुरुरूप उग्रो बभ्रुः शुक्रेभिः पिपिशेहिरण्यैः ईशानादस्य भुवनस्य भूरेर्न वा उ योषद रुद्रादसुर्यम |||
verses.transliteration: sthirebhiraṅghaiḥ pururūpa ughro babhruḥ śukrebhiḥ pipiśehiraṇyaiḥ īśānādasya bhuvanasya bhūrerna vā u yoṣad rudrādasuryam

translations.griffith: With firm limbs, multiform, the strong, the tawny adorns himself with bright gold decorations:  The strength of Godhead ne’er departs from Rudra, him who is Sovran of this world, the mighty.

verses.sanskrit: अर्हन बिभर्षि सायकानि धन्वार्हन निष्कं यजतं विश्वरूपम अर्हन्निदं दयसे विश्वमभ्वं न वा ओजीयो रुद्र तवदस्ति |||
verses.transliteration: arhan bibharṣi sāyakāni dhanvārhan niṣkaṃ yajataṃ viśvarūpam arhannidaṃ dayase viśvamabhvaṃ na vā ojīyo rudra tvadasti

translations.griffith: Worthy, thou carriest thy bow and arrows, worthy, thy manyhued and honoured necklace.  Worthy, thou cuttest here each fiend to pieces: a mightier than thou there is not, Rudra.

verses.sanskrit: सतुहि शरुतं गर्तसदं युवानं मर्गं न भीममुपहत्नुमुग्रम मर्ला जरित्रे रुद्र सतवानो.अन्यं ते अस्मन नि वपन्तु सेनाः |||
verses.transliteration: stuhi śrutaṃ ghartasadaṃ yuvānaṃ mṛghaṃ na bhīmamupahatnumughram mṛlā jaritre rudra stavāno.anyaṃ te asman ni vapantu senāḥ

translations.griffith: Praise him the chariot-borne, the young, the famous, fierce, slaying like a dread beast of the forest.  O Rudra, praised, be gracious to the singer. let thy hosts spare us and smite down another.

verses.sanskrit: कुमारश्चित पितरं वन्दमानं परति नानाम रुद्रोपयन्तम भूरेर्दातारं सत्पतिं गर्णीषे सतुतस्त्वं भेषजा रास्यस्मे |||
verses.transliteration: kumāraścit pitaraṃ vandamānaṃ prati nānāma rudropayantam bhūrerdātāraṃ satpatiṃ ghṛṇīṣe stutastvaṃ bheṣajā rāsyasme

translations.griffith: I bend to thee as thou approachest, Rudra, even as a boy before the sire who greets him.  I praise thee Bounteous Giver, Lord of heroes: give medicines to us as thou art lauded.

verses.sanskrit: या वो भेषजा मरुतः शुचीनि या शन्तमा वर्षणो या मयोभु यानि मनुरव्र्णीता पिता नस्ता शं च योश्चरुद्रस्य वश्मि |||
verses.transliteration: yā vo bheṣajā marutaḥ śucīni yā śantamā vṛṣaṇo yā mayobhu yāni manuravṛṇītā pitā nastā śaṃ ca yoścarudrasya vaśmi

translations.griffith: Of your pure medicines, O potent Maruts, those that are wholesomest and health-bestowing,  Those which our father Manu hath selected, I crave from. Rudra for our gain and welfare.

verses.sanskrit: परि णो हेती रुद्रस्य वर्ज्याः परि तवेषस्य दुर्मतिर्महीगात अव सथिरा मघवद्भ्यस्तनुष्व मीढ्वस्तोकाय तनयाय मर्ळ |||
verses.transliteration: pari ṇo hetī rudrasya vṛjyāḥ pari tveṣasya durmatirmahīghāt ava sthirā maghavadbhyastanuṣva mīḍhvastokāya tanayāya mṛḷa

translations.griffith: May Rudra's missile turn aside and spare us, the great wrath of the impetuous One avoid us.  Turn, Bounteous God, thy strong bow from our princes, and be thou gracious to our seed and offspring.

verses.sanskrit: एवा बभ्रो वर्षभ चेकितान यथा देव न हर्णीषे न हंसि हवनश्रुन नो रुद्रेह बोधि बर्हद व. व. स. |||
verses.transliteration: evā babhro vṛṣabha cekitāna yathā deva na hṛṇīṣe na haṃsi havanaśrun no rudreha bodhi bṛhad v. v. s.

translations.griffith: O tawny Bull, thus showing forth thy nature, as neither to be wroth, O God, nor slay us.  Here, Rudra, listen to our invocation. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

verses.sanskrit: धारावरा मरुतो धर्ष्ण्वोजसो मर्गा न भीमास्तविषीभिरर्चिनः अग्नयो न शुशुचाना रजीषिणो भर्मिं धमन्तोप गा अव्र्ण्वत |||
verses.transliteration: dhārāvarā maruto dhṛṣṇvojaso mṛghā na bhīmāstaviṣībhirarcinaḥ aghnayo na śuśucānā ṛjīṣiṇo bhṛmiṃ dhamantoapa ghā avṛṇvata

translations.griffith: THE Maruts of resistless might who love the rain, resplendent, terrible like wild beasts in their strength,  Glowing like flames of fire, impetuous in career, blowing the wandering rain-cloud, have disclosed the kine.

verses.sanskrit: दयावो न सत्र्भिश्चितयन्त खादिनो वयभ्रिया न दयुतयन्तव्र्ष्टयः रुद्रो यद वो मरुतो रुक्मवक्षसो वर्षाजनि पर्श्न्याः शुक्र ऊधनि |||
verses.transliteration: dyāvo na stṛbhiścitayanta khādino vyabhriyā na dyutayantavṛṣṭayaḥ rudro yad vo maruto rukmavakṣaso vṛṣājani pṛśnyāḥ śukra ūdhani

translations.griffith: They gleam with armlets as the heavens are decked with stars, like cloud-born lightnings shine the torrents of their rain.  Since the strong Rudra, O Maruts with brilliant chests, sprang into life for you in Pṛśni's radiant lap.

verses.sanskrit: उक्षन्ते अश्वानत्यानिवाजिषु नदस्य कर्णैस्तुरयन्त आशुभिः हिरण्यशिप्रा मरुतो दविध्वतः पर्क्षं याथ पर्षतीभिः समन्यवः |||
verses.transliteration: ukṣante aśvānatyānivājiṣu nadasya karṇaisturayanta āśubhiḥ hiraṇyaśiprā maruto davidhvataḥ pṛkṣaṃ yātha pṛṣatībhiḥ samanyavaḥ

translations.griffith: They drip like horses in the racings of swift steeds; with the stream's rapid cars they hasten on their way.  Maruts with helms of gold, ye who make all things shake,  come  with your spotted deer, one-minded, to our food.

verses.sanskrit: पर्क्षे ता विश्वा भुवना ववक्षिरे मित्राय वा सदमा जीरदानवः पर्षदश्वासो अनवभ्रराधस रजिप्यासो न वयुनेषु धूर्षदः |||
verses.transliteration: pṛkṣe tā viśvā bhuvanā vavakṣire mitrāya vā sadamā jīradānavaḥ pṛṣadaśvāso anavabhrarādhasa ṛjipyāso na vayuneṣu dhūrṣadaḥ

translations.griffith: They have bestowed of Mitra all that live, to feed, they who for evermore cause their swift drops to flow;  Whose steeds are spotted deer, whose riches never fail, like horses in full speed, bound to the pole in work.

verses.sanskrit: इन्धन्वभिर्धेनुभी रप्शदूधभिरध्वस्मभिः पथिभिर्भ्राजद्र्ष्टयः आ हंसासो न सवसराणि गन्तन मधोर्मदाय मरुतः समन्यवः |||
verses.transliteration: indhanvabhirdhenubhī rapśadūdhabhiradhvasmabhiḥ pathibhirbhrājadṛṣṭayaḥ ā haṃsāso na svasarāṇi ghantana madhormadāya marutaḥ samanyavaḥ

translations.griffith: With brightly-flaming kine whose udders swell with milk, with glittering lances on your unobstructed paths,  O Maruts, of one mind, like swans who seek their nests, come to the rapturous enjoyment of the meath.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो बरह्माणि मरुतः समन्यवो नरां न शंसः सवनानि गन्तन अश्वामिव पिप्यत धेनुमूधनि कर्ता धियं जरित्रे वाजपेशसम |||
verses.transliteration: ā no brahmāṇi marutaḥ samanyavo narāṃ na śaṃsaḥ savanāni ghantana aśvāmiva pipyata dhenumūdhani kartā dhiyaṃ jaritre vājapeśasam

translations.griffith: To these our prayers, O Maruts, come unanimous, come ye to our libations like the praise of men.  Make it swell like a mare, in udder like a cow, and for the singer grace the song with plenteous strength.

verses.sanskrit: तं नो दात मरुतो वाजिनं रथ आपानं बरह्म चितयद दिवे-दिवे इषं सतोत्र्भ्यो वर्जनेषु कारवे सनिं मेधामरिष्टं दुष्टरं सहः |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ no dāta maruto vājinaṃ ratha āpānaṃ brahma citayad dive-dive iṣaṃ stotṛbhyo vṛjaneṣu kārave saniṃ medhāmariṣṭaṃ duṣṭaraṃ sahaḥ

translations.griffith: Give us a steed, O Maruts mighty in the car; prevailing prayer that brings remembrance day by day;  Food to your praisers, to your bard in deeds of might give winning wisdom, power uninjured, unsurpassed.

verses.sanskrit: यद युञ्जते मरुतो रुक्मवक्षसो.अश्वान रथेषु भग आ सुदानवः धेनुर्न शिश्वे सवसरेषु पिन्वते जनाय रातहविषे महीमिषम |||
verses.transliteration: yad yuñjate maruto rukmavakṣaso.aśvān ratheṣu bhagha ā sudānavaḥ dhenurna śiśve svasareṣu pinvate janāya rātahaviṣe mahīmiṣam
