translations.griffith: When the bright-chested Maruts, lavish of their gifts, bind at the time bliss their horses to the cars,  Then, as the milch-cow feeds her calf within the stalls, they pour forth food for all oblation-bringing men.

verses.sanskrit: यो नो मरुतो वर्कताति मर्त्यो रिपुर्दधे वसवो रक्षता रिषः वर्तयत तपुषा चक्रियाभि तमव रुद्रा अशसो हन्तना वधः |||
verses.transliteration: yo no maruto vṛkatāti martyo ripurdadhe vasavo rakṣatā riṣaḥ vartayata tapuṣā cakriyābhi tamava rudrā aśaso hantanā vadhaḥ

translations.griffith: Save us, O Maruts, Vasus, from the injurer, the mortal foe who makes us looked upon as wolves.  With chariot all aflame compass him round about: O Rudras, cast away the foeman's deadly bolt.

verses.sanskrit: चित्रं तद वो मरुतो याम चेकिते पर्श्न्या यदूधरप्यापयो दुहुः यद वा निदे नवमानस्य रुद्रियास्त्रितं जरायजुरतामदाभ्याः |||
verses.transliteration: citraṃ tad vo maruto yāma cekite pṛśnyā yadūdharapyāpayo duhuḥ yad vā nide navamānasya rudriyāstritaṃ jarāyajuratāmadābhyāḥ

translations.griffith: Well-known, ye Maruts, is that wondrous course of yours, when they milked Pṛśni's udder, close akin to her.  Or when to shame the bard who lauded, Rudra's Sons, ye O infallible brought Trita to decay.

verses.sanskrit: तान वो महो मरुत एवयाव्नो विष्णोरेषस्य परभ्र्थे हवामहे हिरण्यवर्णान ककुहान यतस्रुचो बरह्मण्यन्तः शंस्यं राध ईमहे |||
verses.transliteration: tān vo maho maruta evayāvno viṣṇoreṣasya prabhṛthe havāmahe hiraṇyavarṇān kakuhān yatasruco brahmaṇyantaḥ śaṃsyaṃ rādha īmahe

translations.griffith: We call you such, great Maruts, following wonted ways, to the oblation paid to Viṣṇu Speeder-on.  With ladles lifted up, with prayer, we seek of them preeminent, golden-hued, the wealth which all extol.

verses.sanskrit: ते दशग्वाः परथमा यज्ञमूहिरे ते नो हिन्वन्तूषसो वयुष्टिषु उषा न रामीररुणैरपोर्णुते महो जयोतिषाशुचता गोर्णसा |||
verses.transliteration: te daśaghvāḥ prathamā yajñamūhire te no hinvantūṣaso vyuṣṭiṣu uṣā na rāmīraruṇairaporṇute maho jyotiṣāśucatā ghoarṇasā

translations.griffith: They, the Daśagvas, first of all brought sacrifice: they at the break of mornings shall inspirit us.  Dawn with her purple beams uncovereth the nights, with great light glowing like a billowy sea of milk.

verses.sanskrit: ते कषोणीभिररुणेभिर्नाञ्जिभी रुद्रा रतस्य सदनेषुवाव्र्धुः निमेघमाना अत्येन पाजसा सुश्चन्द्रं वर्णन्दधिरे सुपेशसम |||
verses.transliteration: te kṣoṇībhiraruṇebhirnāñjibhī rudrā ṛtasya sadaneṣuvāvṛdhuḥ nimeghamānā atyena pājasā suścandraṃ varṇandadhire supeśasam

translations.griffith: The Rudras have rejoiced them in the gathered bands at seats of worship as in purple ornaments.  They with impetuous vigour sending down the rain have taken to themselves a bright and lovely hue.

verses.sanskrit: तानियानो महि वरूथमूतय उप घेदेना नमसा गर्णीमसि तरितो न यान पञ्च होतॄनभिष्टय आववर्तदवराञ्चक्रियावसे |||
verses.transliteration: tāniyāno mahi varūthamūtaya upa ghedenā namasā ghṛṇīmasi trito na yān pañca hotṝnabhiṣṭaya āvavartadavarāñcakriyāvase

translations.griffith: Soliciting their high protection for our help, with this our adoration we sing praise to them,  Whom, for assistance, like the five terrestrial priests. Trita hath brought to aid us hither on his car.

verses.sanskrit: यया रध्रं पारयथात्यंहो यया निदो मुञ्चथ वन्दितारम अर्वाची सा मरुतो या व ऊतिरो षु वाश्रेव सुमतिर्जिगातु |||
verses.transliteration: yayā radhraṃ pārayathātyaṃho yayā nido muñcatha vanditāram arvācī sā maruto yā va ūtiro ṣu vāśreva sumatirjighātu

translations.griffith: So may your favouring help be turned to us-ward, your kindness like a lowing cow approach us,  Wherewith ye bear your servant over trouble, and free your worshipper from scoff and scorning.

verses.sanskrit: उपेमस्र्क्षि वाजयुर्वचस्यां चनो दधीत नाद्यो गिरो मे अपां नपादाशुहेमा कुवित स सुपेशसस करति जोषिषद धि |||
verses.transliteration: upemasṛkṣi vājayurvacasyāṃ cano dadhīta nādyo ghiro me apāṃ napādāśuhemā kuvit sa supeśasas karati joṣiṣad dhi

translations.griffith: EAGER for spoil my flow of speech I utter: may the Floods' Child accept my songs with favour.  Will not the rapid Son of Waters make them lovely, for he it is who shall enjoy them?

verses.sanskrit: इमं सवस्मै हर्द आ सुतष्टं मन्त्रं वोचेम कुविदस्य वेदत अपां नपादसुर्यस्य मह्ना विश्वान्यर्यो भुवना जजान |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ svasmai hṛda ā sutaṣṭaṃ mantraṃ vocema kuvidasya vedat apāṃ napādasuryasya mahnā viśvānyaryo bhuvanā jajāna

translations.griffith: To him let us address the song well-fashioned, forth from the heart. Shall he not understand it'  The friendly Son of Waters by the greatness of Godhead hath produced all things existing.

verses.sanskrit: समन्या यन्त्युप यन्त्यन्याः समानमूर्वं नद्यः पर्णन्ति तमू शुचिं शुचयो दीदिवांसमपां नपातं परि तस्थुरापः |||
verses.transliteration: samanyā yantyupa yantyanyāḥ samānamūrvaṃ nadyaḥ pṛṇanti tamū śuciṃ śucayo dīdivāṃsamapāṃ napātaṃ pari tasthurāpaḥ

translations.griffith: Some floods unite themselves and others join them: die sounding rivers fill one common storehouse.  On every side the bright Floods have encompassed the bright resplendent Offspring of the Waters.

verses.sanskrit: तमस्मेरा युवतयो युवानं मर्म्र्ज्यमानाः परि यन्त्यापः स शुक्रेभिः शिक्वभी रेवदस्मे दीदायानिध्मो घर्तनिर्णिगप्सु |||
verses.transliteration: tamasmerā yuvatayo yuvānaṃ marmṛjyamānāḥ pari yantyāpaḥ sa śukrebhiḥ śikvabhī revadasme dīdāyānidhmo ghṛtanirṇighapsu

translations.griffith: The never-sullen waters, youthful Maidens, carefully decking, wait on him the youthful.  He with bright rays shines forth in splendid beauty, unfed with wood, in waters, oil-enveloped.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मै तिस्रो अव्यथ्याय नारीर्देवाय देवीर्दिधिषन्त्यन्नम कर्ता इवोप हि परसर्स्रे अप्सु स पीयूषं धयति पूर्वसूनाम |||
verses.transliteration: asmai tisro avyathyāya nārīrdevāya devīrdidhiṣantyannam kṛtā ivopa hi prasarsre apsu sa pīyūṣaṃ dhayati pūrvasūnām

translations.griffith: To him three Dames are offering food to feed him, Goddesses to the God whom none may injure.  Within the waters hath he pressed, as hollows, and drinks their milk who now are first made mothers.

verses.sanskrit: अश्वस्यात्र जनिमास्य च सवर्द्रुहो रिषः सम्प्र्चः पाहिसूरीन आमासु पूर्षु परो अप्रम्र्ष्यं नारातयो वि नशन नान्र्तानि |||
verses.transliteration: aśvasyātra janimāsya ca svardruho riṣaḥ sampṛcaḥ pāhisūrīn āmāsu pūrṣu paro apramṛṣyaṃ nārātayo vi naśan nānṛtāni

translations.griffith: Here was the horse's birth; his was the sunlight. Save thou our princes from the oppressor's onslaught.  Him, indestructible, dwelling at a distance in forts unwrought lies and ill spirits reach not.

verses.sanskrit: सव आ दमे सुदुघा यस्य धेनुः सवधां पीपाय सुभ्वन्नमत्ति सो अपां नपादूर्जयन्नप्स्वन्तर्वसुदेयाय विधते वि भाति |||
verses.transliteration: sva ā dame sudughā yasya dhenuḥ svadhāṃ pīpāya subhvannamatti so apāṃ napādūrjayannapsvantarvasudeyāya vidhate vi bhāti

translations.griffith: He, in whose mansion is the teeming Milch-cow, swells the Gods’ nectar and cats noble viands.  The Son of Waters, gathering strength in waters, shines for his worshipper to give him treasures.

verses.sanskrit: यो अप्स्वा सुचिना दैव्येन रतावाजस्र उर्विया विभाति वया इदन्या भुवनान्यस्य पर जायन्ते वीरुधश्च परजाभिः |||
verses.transliteration: yo apsvā sucinā daivyena ṛtāvājasra urviyā vibhāti vayā idanyā bhuvanānyasya pra jāyante vīrudhaśca prajābhiḥ

translations.griffith: He who in waters with his own pure Godhead shines widely, law-abiding, everlasting—  The other worlds are verily his branches, and plants are born of him with all their offspring.

verses.sanskrit: अपां नपादा हयस्थादुपस्थं जिह्मानामूर्ध्वो विद्युतं वसानः तस्य जयेष्ठं महिमानं वहन्तीर्हिरण्यवर्णाः परि यन्ति यह्वीः |||
verses.transliteration: apāṃ napādā hyasthādupasthaṃ jihmānāmūrdhvo vidyutaṃ vasānaḥ tasya jyeṣṭhaṃ mahimānaṃ vahantīrhiraṇyavarṇāḥ pari yanti yahvīḥ

translations.griffith: The Waters’ Son hath risen, and clothed in lightning ascended up unto the curled cloud's bosom;  And bearing with them his supremest glory the Youthful Ones, gold-coloured, move around him.

verses.sanskrit: हिरण्यरूपः स हिरण्यसन्द्र्गपां नपात सेदु हिरण्यवर्णः हिरण्ययात परि योनेर्निषद्या हिरण्यदा ददत्यन्नमस्मै |||
verses.transliteration: hiraṇyarūpaḥ sa hiraṇyasandṛghapāṃ napāt sedu hiraṇyavarṇaḥ hiraṇyayāt pari yonerniṣadyā hiraṇyadā dadatyannamasmai

translations.griffith: Golden in form is he, like gold to look on, his colour is like gold, the Son of Waters.  When he is seated fresh from golden birthplace those who present their gold give food to feed him.

verses.sanskrit: तदस्यानीकमुत चारु नामापीच्यं वर्धते नप्तुरपाम यमिन्धते युवतयः समित्था हिरण्यवर्णं घर्तमन्नमस्य |||
verses.transliteration: tadasyānīkamuta cāru nāmāpīcyaṃ vardhate napturapām yamindhate yuvatayaḥ samitthā hiraṇyavarṇaṃ ghṛtamannamasya

translations.griffith: This the fair name and this the lovely aspect of him the Waters’ Son increase in secret.  Whom here the youthful Maids together kindle, his food is sacred oil of golden colour.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मै बहूनामवमाय सख्ये यज्ञैर्विधेम नमसा हविर्भिः सं सानु मार्ज्मि दिधिषामि बिल्मैर्दधाम्यन्नैःपरि वन्द रग्भिः |||
verses.transliteration: asmai bahūnāmavamāya sakhye yajñairvidhema namasā havirbhiḥ saṃ sānu mārjmi didhiṣāmi bilmairdadhāmyannaiḥpari vanda ṛghbhiḥ

translations.griffith: Him, nearest Friend of many, will we worship with sacrifice. and reverence and oblation.  I make his back to shine, with chips provide him; I offer food and with my songs exalt him.

verses.sanskrit: स ईं वर्षाजनयत तासु गर्भं स ईं सिशुर्धयति तं रिहन्ति सो अपां नपादनभिम्लातवर्णो.अन्यस्येवेह तन्वा विवेष |||
verses.transliteration: sa īṃ vṛṣājanayat tāsu gharbhaṃ sa īṃ siśurdhayati taṃ rihanti so apāṃ napādanabhimlātavarṇo.anyasyeveha tanvā viveṣa

translations.griffith: The Bull hath laid his own life-germ Within them. He sucks them as an infant, and they kiss him.  He, Son of Waters, of unfading colour, hath entered here as in another's body.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मिन पदे परमे तस्थिवांसमध्वस्मभिर्विश्वहा दीदिवांसाम आपो नप्त्रे घर्तमन्नं वहन्तीः सवयमत्कैः परि दीयन्ति यह्वीः |||
verses.transliteration: asmin pade parame tasthivāṃsamadhvasmabhirviśvahā dīdivāṃsām āpo naptre ghṛtamannaṃ vahantīḥ svayamatkaiḥ pari dīyanti yahvīḥ

translations.griffith: While here he dwelleth in sublimest station, resplendent with the rays that never perish,  The Waters, bearing oil to feed their offspring, flow, Youthful Ones, in wanderings about him.

verses.sanskrit: अयांसमग्ने सुक्षितिं जनायायांसमु मघवद्भ्यः सुव्र्क्तिम विश्वं तद ... |||
verses.transliteration: ayāṃsamaghne sukṣitiṃ janāyāyāṃsamu maghavadbhyaḥ suvṛktim viśvaṃ tad ...

translations.griffith: Agni, I gave good shelter to the people, and to the princes goodly preparation.  Blessed is all that Gods regard with favour. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

verses.sanskrit: तुभ्यं हिन्वानो वसिष्ट गा अपो.अधुक्षन सीमविभिरद्रिभिर्नरः पिबेन्द्र सवाहा परहुतं वषत्क्र्तं होत्रादासोमं परथमो य ईशिषे |||
verses.transliteration: tubhyaṃ hinvāno vasiṣṭa ghā apo.adhukṣan sīmavibhiradribhirnaraḥ pibendra svāhā prahutaṃ vaṣatkṛtaṃ hotrādāsomaṃ prathamo ya īśiṣe

translations.griffith: WATER and milk hath he endued, sent forth to thee: the men have drained him with the filters and the stones.  Drink, Indra, from the Hotar's bowl—first right is thine—Soma hallowed and poured with Vaṣaṭ and Svāhā.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञैः सम्मिश्लाः पर्षतीभिर्र्ष्टिभिर्यामञ्छुभ्रासो अञ्जिषु परिया उत आसद्या बर्हिर्भरतस्य सूनवः पोत्रादा सोमं पिबता दिवो नरः |||
verses.transliteration: yajñaiḥ sammiślāḥ pṛṣatībhirṛṣṭibhiryāmañchubhrāso añjiṣu priyā uta āsadyā barhirbharatasya sūnavaḥ potrādā somaṃ pibatā divo naraḥ

translations.griffith: Busied with sacrifice, with spotted deer and spears, gleaming upon your way with ornaments, yea, our Friends,  Sitting on sacred grass, ye Sons of Bhārata, drink Soma from the Potar's bowl, O Men of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: अमेव नः सुहवा आ हि गन्तन नि बर्हिषि सदतना रणिष्टन अथा मन्दस्व जुजुषाणो अन्धसस्त्वष्टर्देवेभिर्जनिभिः सुमद्गणः |||
verses.transliteration: ameva naḥ suhavā ā hi ghantana ni barhiṣi sadatanā raṇiṣṭana athā mandasva jujuṣāṇo andhasastvaṣṭardevebhirjanibhiḥ sumadghaṇaḥ

translations.griffith: Come unto us, ye swift to listen: as at home upon the sacred grass sit and enjoy yourselves.  And, Tvaṣṭar, well-content be joyful in the juice with Gods and Goddesses in gladsome company.

verses.sanskrit: आ वक्षि देवानिह विप्र यक्षि चोशन होतर्नि षदा योनिषु तरिषु परति वीहि परस्थितं सोम्यं मधु पिबाग्नीध्रात्तव भागस्य तर्प्णुहि |||
verses.transliteration: ā vakṣi devāniha vipra yakṣi cośan hotarni ṣadā yoniṣu triṣu prati vīhi prasthitaṃ somyaṃ madhu pibāghnīdhrāttava bhāghasya tṛpṇuhi

translations.griffith: Bring the Gods hither, Sage, and offer sacrifice: at the three altars seat thee willingly, O Priest.  Accept for thy delight the proffered Soma meath: drink from the Kindler's bowl and fill thee with thy share.

verses.sanskrit: एष सय ते तन्वो नर्म्णवर्धनः सह ओजः परदिवि बाह्वोर्हितः तुभ्यं सुतो मघवन तुभ्यमाभ्र्तस्त्वमस्य बराह्मनादा तर्पत पिब |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa sya te tanvo nṛmṇavardhanaḥ saha ojaḥ pradivi bāhvorhitaḥ tubhyaṃ suto maghavan tubhyamābhṛtastvamasya brāhmanādā tṛpat piba

translations.griffith: This is the strengthener of thy body's manly might: strength, victory for all time are placed within thine arms.  Pressed for thee, Maghavan, it is offered unto thee: drink from the chalice of this Brahman, drink thy fill.

verses.sanskrit: जुषेथां यज्ञं बोधतं हवस्य मे सत्तो होता निविदः पूर्व्या अनु अछा राजाना नम एत्याव्र्तं परशास्त्रादा पिबतं सोम्यं मधु |||
verses.transliteration: juṣethāṃ yajñaṃ bodhataṃ havasya me satto hotā nividaḥ pūrvyā anu achā rājānā nama etyāvṛtaṃ praśāstrādā pibataṃ somyaṃ madhu

translations.griffith: Accept the sacrifice; mark both of you, my call: the Priest hath seated him after the ancient texts.  My prayer that bids them come goes forth to both the Kings: drink ye the Soma meath from the Director's bowl.

verses.sanskrit: मन्दस्व होत्रादनु जोषमन्धसो.अध्वर्यवः स पूर्णांवष्ट्यासिचम तस्मा एतं भरत तद्वशो ददिर्होत्राद सोमं दरविणोदः पिब रतुभिः |||
verses.transliteration: mandasva hotrādanu joṣamandhaso.adhvaryavaḥ sa pūrṇāṃvaṣṭyāsicam tasmā etaṃ bharata tadvaśo dadirhotrād somaṃ draviṇodaḥ piba ṛtubhiḥ

translations.griffith: Enjoy thy fill of meath out of the Hotar's cup: Adhvaryus he desires a full draught poured for him.  Bring it him: seeking this he gives. Granter of Wealth, drink Soma with the Ṛtus from the Hotar's cup.

verses.sanskrit: यमु पूर्वमहुवे तमिदं हुवे सेदु हव्यो ददिर्यो नाम पत्यते अध्वर्युभिः परस्थितं सोम्यं मधु पोत्रात सोमं द. प. र. |||
verses.transliteration: yamu pūrvamahuve tamidaṃ huve sedu havyo dadiryo nāma patyate adhvaryubhiḥ prasthitaṃ somyaṃ madhu potrāt somaṃ d. p. ṛ.

translations.griffith: He whom of old I called on, him I call on now. He is to be invoked; his name is He who Gives,  Here brought by priests is Soma meath. Granter of Wealth, drink Soma with the Ṛtus from the Potar's cup.

verses.sanskrit: मेद्यन्तु ते वह्नयो येभिरीयसे.अरिषण्यन वीळयस्वा वनस्पते आयूया धर्ष्णो अभिगूर्या तवं नेष्ट्रात सोमं ... |||
verses.transliteration: medyantu te vahnayo yebhirīyase.ariṣaṇyan vīḷayasvā vanaspate āyūyā dhṛṣṇo abhighūryā tvaṃ neṣṭrāt somaṃ ...

translations.griffith: Fat may the horses be wherewith thou speedest on: Lord of the Wood, unharming, strengthen thou thyself.  Drawing and seizing, Bold One, thou who grantest wealth, drink Soma with the Ṛtus from the Neṣṭar's cup.

verses.sanskrit: अपाद धोत्रादुत पोत्रादमत्तोत नेष्ट्रादजुषत परयो हितम तुरीयं पात्रमम्र्क्तममर्त्यं दरविणोदाः पिबतु दराविणोदसः |||
verses.transliteration: apād dhotrāduta potrādamattota neṣṭrādajuṣata prayo hitam turīyaṃ pātramamṛktamamartyaṃ draviṇodāḥ pibatu drāviṇodasaḥ

translations.griffith: From Hotar's cup and Potar's he hath drunk and joyed: the proffered food hath pleased him from the Neṣṭar's bowl.  The fourth cup undisturbed, immortal, let him drink who giveth wealth, the cup of the wealth-giving God.

verses.sanskrit: अर्वाञ्चमद्य यय्यं नर्वाहणं रथं युञ्जाथामिह वां विमोचनम पर्ङकतं हवींषि मधुना हि कं गतमथा सोमं पिबतं वाजिनीवसू |||
verses.transliteration: arvāñcamadya yayyaṃ nṛvāhaṇaṃ rathaṃ yuñjāthāmiha vāṃ vimocanam pṛṅktaṃ havīṃṣi madhunā hi kaṃ ghatamathā somaṃ pibataṃ vājinīvasū

translations.griffith: Yoke, O ye Twain, to-day your hero-bearing car, swift-moving hitherward: your loosing-place is here.  Mix the oblations, then come hither with the meath, and drink the Soma, ye rich in abundant strength.

verses.sanskrit: जोष्यग्ने समिधं जोष्याहुतिं जोषि बरह्म जन्यं जोषिसुष्टुतिम विश्वेभिर्विश्वान रतुना वसो मह उशन देवानुशतः पायया हविः |||
verses.transliteration: joṣyaghne samidhaṃ joṣyāhutiṃ joṣi brahma janyaṃ joṣisuṣṭutim viśvebhirviśvān ṛtunā vaso maha uśan devānuśataḥ pāyayā haviḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, accept the fuel and our offered gift: accept the prayer of man, accept our eulogy,  Do thou with all, with Ṛtu, O thou Excellent, fain, make the great Gods all fain taste the gift we bring.

verses.sanskrit: उदु षय देवः सविता सवाय शश्वत्तमं तदपा वह्निरस्थात नूनं देवेभ्यो वि हि धाति रत्नमथाभजद वीतिहोत्रं सवस्तौ |||
verses.transliteration: udu ṣya devaḥ savitā savāya śaśvattamaṃ tadapā vahnirasthāt nūnaṃ devebhyo vi hi dhāti ratnamathābhajad vītihotraṃ svastau

translations.griffith: UPRISEN is Savitar, this God, to quicken, Priest who neglects not this most constant duty.  To the Gods, verily, he gives rich treasure, and blesses him who calls them to the banquet.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वस्य हि शरुष्टये देव ऊर्ध्वः पर बाहवा पर्थुपाणिः सिसर्ति आपश्चिदस्य वरत आ निम्र्ग्रा अयं चिद वातो रमते परिज्मन |||
verses.transliteration: viśvasya hi śruṣṭaye deva ūrdhvaḥ pra bāhavā pṛthupāṇiḥ sisarti āpaścidasya vrata ā nimṛghrā ayaṃ cid vāto ramate parijman

translations.griffith: Having gone up on high, the God broad-handed spreads his arms widely forth that all may mark him.  Even the waters bend them to his service: even this wind rests in the circling region.

verses.sanskrit: आशुभिश्चिद यान वि मुचाति नूनमरीरमदतमानं चिदेतोः अह्यर्षूणां चिन नययानविष्यामनु वरतं सवितुर्मोक्यागात |||
verses.transliteration: āśubhiścid yān vi mucāti nūnamarīramadatamānaṃ cidetoḥ ahyarṣūṇāṃ cin nyayānaviṣyāmanu vrataṃ saviturmokyāghāt

translations.griffith: Though borne by swift steeds he will yet unyoke them: e’en the fleet chariot hath he stayed from going.  He hath checked e’en their haste who glide like serpents. Night closely followed Savitar's dominion.

verses.sanskrit: पुनः समव्यद विततं वयन्ती मध्या कर्तोर्न्यधाच्छक्म धीरः उत संहायास्थाद वय रतूं अदर्धररमतिःसविता देव आगात |||
verses.transliteration: punaḥ samavyad vitataṃ vayantī madhyā kartornyadhācchakma dhīraḥ ut saṃhāyāsthād vy ṛtūṃ adardhararamatiḥsavitā deva āghāt

translations.griffith: What was spread out she weaves afresh, re-weaving: the skilful leaves his labour half-completed.  He hath arisen from rest, and parted seasons: Savitar hath approached, God, holy-minded.

verses.sanskrit: नानौकांसि दुर्यो विश्वमायुर्वि तिष्ठते परभवः शोको अग्नेः जयेष्ठं माता सूनवे भागमाधादन्वस्यकेतमिषितं सवित्रा |||
verses.transliteration: nānaukāṃsi duryo viśvamāyurvi tiṣṭhate prabhavaḥ śoko aghneḥ jyeṣṭhaṃ mātā sūnave bhāghamādhādanvasyaketamiṣitaṃ savitrā

translations.griffith: Through various dwellings, through entire existence, spreads, manifest, the household light of Agni.  The Mother gives her Son the goodliest portion, and Savitar hath sped to meet his summons.

verses.sanskrit: समाववर्ति विष्ठितो जिगीषुर्विश्वेषां कामश्चरताममाभूत शश्वानपो विक्र्तं हित्व्यागादनु वरतं सवितुर्दैव्यस्य |||
verses.transliteration: samāvavarti viṣṭhito jighīṣurviśveṣāṃ kāmaścaratāmamābhūt śaśvānapo vikṛtaṃ hitvyāghādanu vrataṃ saviturdaivyasya

translations.griffith: He comes again, unfolded, fain for conquest: at home was he, the love of all things moving.  Each man hath come leaving his evil doings, after the Godlike Savitar's commandment.

verses.sanskrit: तवया हितमप्यमप्सु भागं धन्वान्वा मर्गयसो वि तस्थुः वनानि विभ्यो नकिरस्य तानि वरता देवस्य सवितुर्मिनन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: tvayā hitamapyamapsu bhāghaṃ dhanvānvā mṛghayaso vi tasthuḥ vanāni vibhyo nakirasya tāni vratā devasya saviturminanti

translations.griffith: The wild beasts spread through desert places seeking their watery share which thou hast set in waters.  The woods are given to the birds. These statutes of the God Savitar none disobeyeth.

verses.sanskrit: याद्राध्यं वरुणो योनिमप्यमनिशितं निमिषि जर्भुराणः विश्वो मार्ताण्डो वरजमा पशुर्गात सथशो जन्मानि सविता वयाकः |||
verses.transliteration: yādrādhyaṃ varuṇo yonimapyamaniśitaṃ nimiṣi jarbhurāṇaḥ viśvo mārtāṇḍo vrajamā paśurghāt sthaśo janmāni savitā vyākaḥ

translations.griffith: With utmost speed, in restless haste at sunset Varuṇa seeks his watery habitation.  Then seeks each bird his nest, each beast his lodging. In due place Savitar hath set each creature.

verses.sanskrit: न यस्येन्द्रो वरुणो न मित्रो वरतमर्यमा न मिनन्ति रुद्रः नारातयस्तमिदं सवस्ति हुवे देवं सवितारं नमोभिः |||
verses.transliteration: na yasyendro varuṇo na mitro vratamaryamā na minanti rudraḥ nārātayastamidaṃ svasti huve devaṃ savitāraṃ namobhiḥ

translations.griffith: Him whose high law not Varuṇa nor Indra, not Mitra, Aryaman, nor Rudra breaketh,  Nor evil-hearted fiends, here for my welfare him I invoke, God Savitar, with worship.

verses.sanskrit: भगं धियं वाजयन्तः पुरन्धिं नराशंसो गनास्पतिर्नो अव्याः आये वामस्य संगथे रयीणां परिया देवस्य सवितुः सयाम |||
verses.transliteration: bhaghaṃ dhiyaṃ vājayantaḥ purandhiṃ narāśaṃso ghnāspatirno avyāḥ āye vāmasya saṃghathe rayīṇāṃ priyā devasya savituḥ syāma

translations.griffith: May they who strengthen bliss, and thought and wisdom, and the Dames’ Lord and Narāśaṁsa aid us.  That good may come to us and wealth be gathered, may we be Savitar the God's beloved.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मभ्यं तद दिवो अद्भ्यः पर्थिव्यास्त्वया दत्तं काम्यं राध आ गात शं यत सतोत्र्भ्य आपये भवात्युरुशंसाय सवितर्जरित्रे |||
verses.transliteration: asmabhyaṃ tad divo adbhyaḥ pṛthivyāstvayā dattaṃ kāmyaṃ rādha ā ghāt śaṃ yat stotṛbhya āpaye bhavātyuruśaṃsāya savitarjaritre

translations.griffith: So come to us our hearts' desire, the bounty bestowed by thee, from heaven and earth and waters,  That it be well with friends and those who praise thee, and, Savitar, with the loud-lauding singer.

verses.sanskrit: गरावाणेव तदिदथं जरेथे गर्ध्रेव वर्क्षं निधिमन्तमछ बरह्माणेव विदथ उक्थशासा दूतेव हव्या जन्या पुरुत्रा |||
verses.transliteration: ghrāvāṇeva tadidathaṃ jarethe ghṛdhreva vṛkṣaṃ nidhimantamacha brahmāṇeva vidatha ukthaśāsā dūteva havyā janyā purutrā

translations.griffith: SING like the two press-stones for this same purpose; come like two misers to the tree of treasure;  Like two laud-singing Brahmans in the assembly, like the folk's envoys called in many places.

verses.sanskrit: परातर्यावाणा रथ्येव वीराजेव यमा वरमा सचेथे मेने इव तन्वा शुम्भमाने दम्पतीव करतुविदा जनेषु |||
verses.transliteration: prātaryāvāṇā rathyeva vīrājeva yamā varamā sacethe mene iva tanvā śumbhamāne dampatīva kratuvidā janeṣu

translations.griffith: Moving at morning like two car-borne heroes, like to a pair of goats ye come electing;  Like two fair dames embellishing their bodies, like a wise married pair among the people.

verses.sanskrit: शर्ङगेव नः परथमा गन्तमर्वाक छफाविव जर्भुराणातरोभिः चक्रवाकेव परति वस्तोरुस्रार्वाञ्चा यातं रथ्येव शक्रा |||
verses.transliteration: śṛṅgheva naḥ prathamā ghantamarvāk chaphāviva jarbhurāṇātarobhiḥ cakravākeva prati vastorusrārvāñcā yātaṃ rathyeva śakrā

translations.griffith: Like to a pair of horns come first to us-ward, like to a pair of hoofs with rapid motion;  Come like two Cakavās in the grey of morning, come like two chariot wheels at dawn, ye Mighty.

verses.sanskrit: नावेव नः पारयतं युगेव नभ्येव न उपधीव परधीव शवानेव नो अरिषण्या तनूनां खर्गलेव विस्रसः पातमस्मान |||
verses.transliteration: nāveva naḥ pārayataṃ yugheva nabhyeva na upadhīva pradhīva śvāneva no ariṣaṇyā tanūnāṃ khṛghaleva visrasaḥ pātamasmān

translations.griffith: Bear us across the rivers like two vessels, save us as ye were yokes, naves, spokes and fellies.  Be like two dogs that injure not our bodies; preserve us, like two crutches, that we fall not.

verses.sanskrit: वातेवाजुर्या नद्येव रीतिरक्षी इव चक्षुषा यातमर्वाक हस्ताविव तन्वे शम्भविष्ठा पादेव नो नयतं वस्यो अछ |||
verses.transliteration: vātevājuryā nadyeva rītirakṣī iva cakṣuṣā yātamarvāk hastāviva tanve śambhaviṣṭhā pādeva no nayataṃ vasyo acha

translations.griffith: Like two winds ageing not, two confluent rivers, come with quick vision like two eyes before us.  Come like two hands most helpful to the body, and guide us like two feet to what is precious.

verses.sanskrit: ओष्ठाविव मध्वास्ने वदन्ता सतनाविव पिप्यतं जीवसेनः नासेव नस्तन्वो रक्षितारा कर्णाविव सुश्रुता भूतमस्मे |||
verses.transliteration: oṣṭhāviva madhvāsne vadantā stanāviva pipyataṃ jīvasenaḥ nāseva nastanvo rakṣitārā karṇāviva suśrutā bhūtamasme

translations.griffith: Even as two lips that with the mouth speak honey, even as two breasts that nourish our existence,  Like the two nostrils that protect our being, be to us as our ears that hear distinctly.

verses.sanskrit: हस्तेव शक्तिमभि सन्ददी नः कषामेव नः समजतं रजांसि इमा गिरो अश्विना युष्मयन्तीः कष्णोत्रेणेव सवधितिं सं शिशीतम |||
verses.transliteration: hasteva śaktimabhi sandadī naḥ kṣāmeva naḥ samajataṃ rajāṃsi imā ghiro aśvinā yuṣmayantīḥ kṣṇotreṇeva svadhitiṃ saṃ śiśītam

translations.griffith: Like two hands give ye us increasing vigour; like heaven and earth constrain the airy regions.  Aśvins, these hymns that struggle to approach you, sharpen ye like an axe upon a whetstone.

verses.sanskrit: एतानि वामश्विना वर्धनानि बरह्म सतोमं गर्त्समदासो अक्रन तानि नरा जुजुषाणोप यातं बर्हद ... |||
verses.transliteration: etāni vāmaśvinā vardhanāni brahma stomaṃ ghṛtsamadāso akran tāni narā jujuṣāṇopa yātaṃ bṛhad ...

translations.griffith: These prayers of ours exalting you, O Aśvins, have the Gṛtsamadas, for a laud, made ready.  Welcome them, O ye Heroes, and come hither. Loud may we speak. with brave men, in assembly.

verses.sanskrit: सोमापूषणा जनना रयीणां जनना दिवो जनना पर्थिव्याः जातौ विश्वस्य भुवनस्य गोपौ देवा अक्र्ण्वन्नम्र्तस्य नाभिम |||
verses.transliteration: somāpūṣaṇā jananā rayīṇāṃ jananā divo jananā pṛthivyāḥ jātau viśvasya bhuvanasya ghopau devā akṛṇvannamṛtasya nābhim

translations.griffith: SOMA and Pūṣan, Parents of all riches, Parents of earth and Parents of high heaven,  You Twain, brought forth as the whole world's protectors, the Gods have made centre of life eternal.

verses.sanskrit: इमौ देवौ जायमानौ जुषन्तेमौ तमांसि गूहतामजुष्टा आभ्यामिन्द्रः पक्वमामास्वन्तः सोमापूषभ्यां जनदुस्रियासु |||
verses.transliteration: imau devau jāyamānau juṣantemau tamāṃsi ghūhatāmajuṣṭā ābhyāmindraḥ pakvamāmāsvantaḥ somāpūṣabhyāṃ janadusriyāsu

translations.griffith: At birth of these two Gods all Gods are joyful: they have caused darkness, which we hate, to vanish.  With these, with Soma and with Pūṣan, India generates ripe warm milk in the raw milch-cows.

verses.sanskrit: सोमापूषणा रजसो विमानं सप्तचक्रं रथमविश्वमिन्वम विषूव्र्तं मनसा युज्यमानं तं जिन्वथो वर्षणा पञ्चरश्मिम |||
verses.transliteration: somāpūṣaṇā rajaso vimānaṃ saptacakraṃ rathamaviśvaminvam viṣūvṛtaṃ manasā yujyamānaṃ taṃ jinvatho vṛṣaṇā pañcaraśmim

translations.griffith: Soma and Pūṣan, urge your chariot hither, the seven-wheeled car that measures out the region,  That stirs not all, that moves to every quarter, five-reined and harnessed by the thought, ye Mighty.

verses.sanskrit: दिव्यन्यः सदनं चक्र उच्चा पर्थिव्यामन्यो अध्यन्तरिक्षे तावस्मभ्यं पुरुवारं पुरुक्षुं रायस पोषं वि षयतां नाभिमस्मे |||
verses.transliteration: divyanyaḥ sadanaṃ cakra uccā pṛthivyāmanyo adhyantarikṣe tāvasmabhyaṃ puruvāraṃ purukṣuṃ rāyas poṣaṃ vi ṣyatāṃ nābhimasme

translations.griffith: One in the heaven on high hath made his dwelling, on earth and in the firmament the other.  May they disclose to us great store of treasure, much-longed for, rich in food, source of enjoyment.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वान्यन्यो भुवना जजान विश्वमन्यो अभिचक्षाण एति सोमापूषणाववतं धियं मे युवाभ्यां विश्वाः पर्तना जयेम |||
verses.transliteration: viśvānyanyo bhuvanā jajāna viśvamanyo abhicakṣāṇa eti somāpūṣaṇāvavataṃ dhiyaṃ me yuvābhyāṃ viśvāḥ pṛtanā jayema

translations.griffith: One of you Twain is Parent of all creatures, the other journeys onward all-beholding.  Soma and Pūṣan, aid my thought with favour: with you may we o’ercome in all encounters.

verses.sanskrit: धियं पूषा जिन्वतु विश्वमिन्वो रयिं सोमो रयिपतिर्दधातु अवतु देव्यदितिरनर्वा बर... |||
verses.transliteration: dhiyaṃ pūṣā jinvatu viśvaminvo rayiṃ somo rayipatirdadhātu avatu devyaditiranarvā bṛ...

translations.griffith: May Pūṣan stir our thought, the all-impelling, may Soma Lord of riches grant us riches.  May Aditi the perfect Goddess aid us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

verses.sanskrit: वायो ये ते सहस्रिणो रथासस्तेभिरा गहि नियुत्वान सोमपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: vāyo ye te sahasriṇo rathāsastebhirā ghahi niyutvān somapītaye

translations.griffith: O VĀYU, come to us with all the thousand chariots that are thine,  Team-borne, to drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: नियुत्वान वायवा गह्ययं शुक्रो अयामि ते गन्तासि सुन्वतो गर्हम |||
verses.transliteration: niyutvān vāyavā ghahyayaṃ śukro ayāmi te ghantāsi sunvato ghṛham

translations.griffith: Drawn by thy team, O Vāyu, come; to thee is offered this, the pure.  Thou visitest the presser's house.

verses.sanskrit: शुक्रस्याद्य गवाशिर इन्द्रवायू नियुत्वतः आ यातं पिबतं नरा |||
verses.transliteration: śukrasyādya ghavāśira indravāyū niyutvataḥ ā yātaṃ pibataṃ narā

translations.griffith: Indra and Vāyu, drawn by teams, ye Heroes, come today and drink.  Of the bright juice when blent with milk.

verses.sanskrit: अयं वां मित्रावरुणा सुतः सोम रताव्र्धा ममेदिह शरुतं हवम |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ vāṃ mitrāvaruṇā sutaḥ soma ṛtāvṛdhā mamediha śrutaṃ havam

translations.griffith: This Soma hath been shed for you, Law-strengtheners, Mitra-Varuṇa!  Listen ye here to this my call.

verses.sanskrit: राजानावनभिद्रुहा धरुवे सदस्युत्तमे सहस्रस्थूण आसाते |||
verses.transliteration: rājānāvanabhidruhā dhruve sadasyuttame sahasrasthūṇa āsāte

translations.griffith: Both Kings who never injure aught seat them in their supremest home,  The thousand-pillared, firmly-based.

verses.sanskrit: ता सम्राजा घर्तासुती आदित्या दानुनस पती सचेते अनवह्वरम |||
verses.transliteration: tā samrājā ghṛtāsutī ādityā dānunas patī sacete anavahvaram

translations.griffith: Fed with oblation, Sovran Kings, Ādityas, Lords of liberal gifts.  They wait on him whose life is true.

verses.sanskrit: गोमदू षु नासत्याश्वावद यातमश्विना वर्ती रुद्रा नर्पाय्यम |||
verses.transliteration: ghomadū ṣu nāsatyāśvāvad yātamaśvinā vartī rudrā nṛpāyyam

translations.griffith: With kine, Nāsatyas, and with steeds, come, Aśvins, Rudras, to the house  That will protect its heroes well;

verses.sanskrit: न यत परो नान्तर आदधर्षद वर्षण्वसू दुःशंसो मर्त्यो रिपुः |||
verses.transliteration: na yat paro nāntara ādadharṣad vṛṣaṇvasū duḥśaṃso martyo ripuḥ

translations.griffith: Such, wealthy Gods! as none afar nor standing nigh to us may harm,  Yea, no malicious mortal foe.

verses.sanskrit: ता न आ वोळ्हमश्विना रयिं पिशङगसन्द्र्शम धिष्न्यावरिवोविदम |||
verses.transliteration: tā na ā voḷhamaśvinā rayiṃ piśaṅghasandṛśam dhiṣnyāvarivovidam

translations.griffith: As such, O longed-far Aśvins, lead us on to wealth of varied sort,  Wealth that shall bring us room and rest.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो अङग महद भयमभी षदप चुच्यवत स हि सथिरो विचर्षणिः |||
verses.transliteration: indro aṅgha mahad bhayamabhī ṣadapa cucyavat sa hi sthiro vicarṣaṇiḥ

translations.griffith: Verily Indra, conquering all, driveth e’en mighty fear away,  For firm is he and swift to act.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रश्च मर्ळयाति नो न नः पश्चादघं नशत भद्रं भवाति नः पुरः |||
verses.transliteration: indraśca mṛḷayāti no na naḥ paścādaghaṃ naśat bhadraṃ bhavāti naḥ puraḥ

translations.griffith: Indra be gracious unto us: sin shall not reach us afterward,  And good shall be before us still.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र आशाभ्यस परि सर्वाभ्यो अभयं करत जेता शत्रून विचर्शणिः |||
verses.transliteration: indra āśābhyas pari sarvābhyo abhayaṃ karat jetā śatrūn vicarśaṇiḥ

translations.griffith: From all the regions of the world let Indra send security,  The foe-subduer, swift to act.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वे देवास आ गत शर्णुता म इमं हवम एदं बर्हिर्नि षीदत |||
verses.transliteration: viśve devāsa ā ghata śṛṇutā ma imaṃ havam edaṃ barhirni ṣīdata

translations.griffith: O all ye Gods, come hitherward: hear this mine invocation, seat  Yourselves upon this sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit: तीव्रो वो मधुमानयं शुनहोत्रेषु मत्सरः एतं पिबतकाम्यम |||
verses.transliteration: tīvro vo madhumānayaṃ śunahotreṣu matsaraḥ etaṃ pibatakāmyam

translations.griffith: Among the Śunahotras strong for you is this sweet gladdening draught.  Drink ye of this delightsome juice.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रज्येष्ठा ... ||
verses.transliteration: indrajyeṣṭhā ...

translations.griffith: Ye  Maruts  led by Indra, Gods with Pūṣan for your bounteousest,  Hear all of you this call of mine.

verses.sanskrit: अम्बितमे नदीतमे देवितमे सरस्वति अप्रशस्ता इव समसि परशस्तिमम्ब नस कर्धि |||
verses.transliteration: ambitame nadītame devitame sarasvati apraśastā iva smasi praśastimamba nas kṛdhi

translations.griffith: Best Mother, best of Rivers, best of Goddesses, Sarasvatī, We are, as ’twere, of no repute and dear Mother, give thou us renown.

verses.sanskrit: तवे विश्वा सरस्वति शरितायूंषि देव्याम शुनहोत्रेषु मत्स्व परजां देवि दिदिड्ढि नः |||
verses.transliteration: tve viśvā sarasvati śritāyūṃṣi devyām śunahotreṣu matsva prajāṃ devi didiḍḍhi naḥ

translations.griffith: In thee, Sarasvatī, divine, all generations have their stay.  Be, glad with Śunahotra's sons: O Goddess grant us progeny.

verses.sanskrit: इमा बरह्म सरस्वति जुषस्व वाजिनीवति या ते मन्म गर्त्समदा रतावरि परिया देवेषु जुह्वति |||
verses.transliteration: imā brahma sarasvati juṣasva vājinīvati yā te manma ghṛtsamadā ṛtāvari priyā deveṣu juhvati

translations.griffith: Enriched with sacrifice, accept Sarasvatī, these prayers of ours,  Thoughts which Gṛtsamadas beloved of Gods bring, Holy One, to thee.

verses.sanskrit: परेतां यज्ञस्य शम्भुवा युवामिदा वर्णीमहे अग्निंच हव्यवाहनम |||
verses.transliteration: pretāṃ yajñasya śambhuvā yuvāmidā vṛṇīmahe aghniṃca havyavāhanam

translations.griffith: Ye who bless sacrifice, go forth, for verily we choose you both,  And Agni who conveys our gifts.

verses.sanskrit: दयावा नः पर्थिवी इमं सिध्रमद्य दिविस्प्र्शम यज्णन्देवेषु यछताम |||
verses.transliteration: dyāvā naḥ pṛthivī imaṃ sidhramadya divispṛśam yajṇandeveṣu yachatām

translations.griffith: This our effectual sacrifice, reaching the sky, shall Heaven and Earth  Present unto the Gods to-day.

verses.sanskrit: आ वामुपस्थमद्रुहा देवाः सीदन्तु यज्ञियाः इहाद्यसोमपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: ā vāmupasthamadruhā devāḥ sīdantu yajñiyāḥ ihādyasomapītaye

translations.griffith: In both your laps, ye guileless Ones, the Holy Gods shall sit them down  To-day to drink the Soma here.

verses.sanskrit: कनिक्रदज्जनुषं परब्रुवाण इयर्ति वाचमरितेव नावम सुमङगलश्च शकुने भवासि मा तवा का चिदभिभा विश्व्या विदत |||
verses.transliteration: kanikradajjanuṣaṃ prabruvāṇa iyarti vācamariteva nāvam sumaṅghalaśca śakune bhavāsi mā tvā kā cidabhibhā viśvyā vidat

translations.griffith: TELLING his race aloud with cries repeated, he sends his voice out as his boat a steersman.  O Bird, be ominous of happy fortune from no side may calamity befall thee.

verses.sanskrit: मा तवा शयेन उद वधीन मा सुपर्णो मा तवा विददिषुमान्वीरो अस्ता पित्र्यामनु परदिशं कनिक्रदत सुमङगलो भद्रवादी वदेह |||
verses.transliteration: mā tvā śyena ud vadhīn mā suparṇo mā tvā vidadiṣumānvīro astā pitryāmanu pradiśaṃ kanikradat sumaṅghalo bhadravādī vadeha

translations.griffith: Let not the falcon kill thee, nor the eagle let not the arrow-bearing archer reach thee.  Still crying in the region of the Fathers, speak here auspicious, bearing joyful tidings.

verses.sanskrit: अव करन्द दक्षिणतो गर्हाणां सुमङगलो भद्रवादी शकुन्ते मा न सतेन ईशत माघशंसो बर्हद ... |||
verses.transliteration: ava kranda dakṣiṇato ghṛhāṇāṃ sumaṅghalo bhadravādī śakunte mā na stena īśata māghaśaṃso bṛhad ...

translations.griffith: Bringing good tidings, Bird of happy omen, call thou out loudly southward of our dwellings,  So that no thief, no sinner may oppress us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

verses.sanskrit: परदक्षिनिदभि गर्णन्ति कारवो वयो वदन्त रतुथा शकुन्तयः उभे वाचौ वदति सामगा इव गायत्रं च तरैष्टुभं चानु राजति |||
verses.transliteration: pradakṣinidabhi ghṛṇanti kāravo vayo vadanta ṛtuthā śakuntayaḥ ubhe vācau vadati sāmaghā iva ghāyatraṃ ca traiṣṭubhaṃ cānu rājati

translations.griffith: HERE on the right sing forth chanters of hymns of praise, even the winged birds that in due season speak.  He, like: a Sāma-chanter utters both the notes, skilled in the mode of Tṛṣṭup and of Gāyatrī.

verses.sanskrit: उद्गातेव शकुने साम गायसि बरह्मपुत्र इव सवनेषु शंससि वर्षेव वाजी शिशुमतीरपीत्या सर्वतो नः शकुने भद्रमा वद विश्वतो नः शकुने पुण्यमा वद |||
verses.transliteration: udghāteva śakune sāma ghāyasi brahmaputra iva savaneṣu śaṃsasi vṛṣeva vājī śiśumatīrapītyā sarvato naḥ śakune bhadramā vada viśvato naḥ śakune puṇyamā vada

translations.griffith: Thou like the chanter-priest chantest the Sāma, Bird; thou singest at libations like a Brahman's son.  Even as a vigorous horse when he comes near the mare, announce to us good fortune, Bird, on every side, proclaim in all directions happy luck, O Bird.

verses.sanskrit: आवदंस्त्वं शकुने भद्रमा वद तूष्णीमासीनः सुमतिं चिकिद्धि नः यदुत्पतन वदसि कर्करिर्यथा बर्हद . .. |||
verses.transliteration: āvadaṃstvaṃ śakune bhadramā vada tūṣṇīmāsīnaḥ sumatiṃ cikiddhi naḥ yadutpatan vadasi karkariryathā bṛhad . ..

translations.griffith: When singing here, O Bird. announce good luck to us, and when thou sittest still think on us with kind thoughts.
